loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a married man with three children. One of his children is enrolled in school, the other two are still young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Baya owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and water. 

Baya has operated an electronics workshop for the past ten years; his potential clients are local residents. He faces a major challenge which is competition from other operators. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the KES 100,000 loan he wants to purchase electronic spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial services to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase electronic spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Kimatullo

texts.ru: Киматулло житель района Дангары. Ему 44 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Более 15 лет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Кредит берет для закупа овощей и фруктов.
texts.en: Kimatullo is a resident of the Dangara region. He is 44 years old, married and has two children. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy carrots, onions, apples and pomegranates.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions, apples and pomegranates.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Mhekela Group

texts.en:
Lusiana is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has been a coffee farmer for over 20 years. She has been challenged by lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. She has also started a business of buying and selling fish. 

Lusiana seeks a loan to pay for fertilizers and insecticides for her crops. Also she is thinking of increasing her scale of production from 13 to 22 acres in five years to come. By expanding her scale of production, she will be able to pay medical expenses and buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 38 years old and married to Julius. They have four children.

She has been involved in her clothing business for the last 10 years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing and selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for sewing and selling

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 27 years of age. She is married and has no child yet and lives in her father’s home.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her brother’s livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.

He is new in his business and Farhat is hopeful that an investment will help him earn higher profits and get more established in his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 51 years old, married to Nicholas, and they are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Bossèdè Rosalie

texts.fr: Bossèdè Rosalie âgée de 37 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Bossèdè Rosalie est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Irénée. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bossèdè Rosalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Bossèdè Rosalie vend de la nourriture de façon ambulante depuis douze ans. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Bossèdè Rosalie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Bossèdè Rosalie sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du poisson et du maïs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
M. Seng is a 27 year old wife and mother. She and her husband have two daughters and one son. Their oldest daughter attends school and their youngest two children stay at home. M. Seng and her husband run their own business of selling eye glasses and earn about $10 per day. 

M. Seng is requesting this loan of $1,000 to make improvements on their home and livelihood. She will use $450 to purchase land, $350 to purchase a buffalo, and $200 to build a fence around their home.  She is excited about being able to improve her families lives through these changes. 

M. Seng has taken other loans with CREDIT and she had no problem with the payments. In the future she would like to purchase a small stall in the market to sell her eye glasses in.

loans.use: Buy land, a buffalo, and build a fence around home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Wangui Kagia intends to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy chemicals/ingredients for making the soaps

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: “I make wheat and barley flour at home, which my husband sells in the market. We have been doing this business in a village in Pakistan. It is easier for my husband to go out and do the transactions in the market place. Now we need a loan to purchase stock so that we can sell more in the market place. I have five children in school and I would like for them to continue their education.”

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doña Hermelinda is originally from Huayucachi. She has been raising chickens in her home for the past 20 years which in turn she sells at the local mercado once the chickens are fully developed. Chicken meat is in high demand in this area due to its nutrional value. Her business has grown over the past years due to the good care Hermelinda gives to her chickens.

Hermelinda's motivation are her two children. Since she stays at home taking care of her chickens, she also spends a lot quality time with ther children. Hermelinda has big aspirations and one of them is to have her small chicken farm transform into a big and prosperous business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more chicks and to purchase better food to feed her chickens. She comitts to repay this loan within 6 months. She thanks you for your generosity!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda es natural de Huayucachi, y hace 20 años decidió criar gallinas en las humildes instalaciones de su hogar para que a su madurez total pueda comercializarlas en el mercado de su localidad; debido a la demanda y al alto contenido proteico esta carne de ave es muy solicitada por las madres de familia para el alimento de sus pequeños en crecimiento y desarrollo continuo, con el tiempo este pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo y cada vez es más solicitado debido al cuidado que les profesa Hermelinda, en la actualidad su mayor motivación son sus dos pequeños hijos a los que atiende diariamente y gracias a que esta actividad la puede realizar en casa puede otorgarles mucho amor y dedicación.Doña Hermelinda tiene grandes aspiraciones y una de ellas es ver su pequeña granja de pollos convertida en todo una avícola, para ello es que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más y mejor alimento para sus gallinas y la compra de más pollitos para criarlos hasta su madurez y te extiende el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses y te agradece tu noble colaboración para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and food to feed the chickens

loans.name: Mamah

texts.en: Mamah is 40 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to sell her products. She usually earns $10 per day. Her husband sells clothes in the market. She needs more capital to expand her business, due to the small profit margin of her husband's clothes business. Mamah is a member of MBK and requests a IDR 900,000 loan. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Mr. Celso Martinez works in furniture manufacturing and sales. This business, which he and his wife run, is his family's sole source of income. They would like to invest in the business without losing profits, so they are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy the materials needed to manufacture wood furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Celso M. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera y venta. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Queremos invertir le mas al negocio pero sin descapitalizarnos. Así que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles de madera.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make wood furniture

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Fatuma P.. She is married with two children, ages 18 months and 10, and has one other dependent who is her niece. In 2007 Fatuma established a pharmacy business and now requires a loan of $175 in order to increase her inventory of medicine. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Kisakye A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Florence A.. She sells used clothing and is requesting a loan to expand business. Florence is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging in age from age 3 months to 10 years old, and her children go to school.

Each week, Florence makes approximately 50000 UGX (about $30) profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide for the basic needs of the family and home. Previously, Florence had a loan from BRAC Uganda for 200000 UGX (about $120) in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Amina N., Topista N., and Rose N.. Amina N. has a retail shop and wants to purchase more items to sell in the shop. Topista N. sells second-hand clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell and expand the business. Rose N. runs a retail shop and wants to increase the stock of goods in the shop.

loans.use: To expand the clothing business and earn more to support her family

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married woman with two children, ages 2-12 years old. Rehema is a soft drink seller; she started this business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
Mrs Sri I., 42 years old, sells foods which are categorized as "Sembako" or nine basic necessities. This business is quite good as she has a lot of customers from her neighbors. Twice a week she buys her merchandises from Badung Market. Her eldest son usually drives her to the market in a motorcycle.

She wants to use the loan money to expand her Sembako business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Sri I. mulai menekuni usaha jual Sembako sejak tahun 2000. Usahanya cukup lancar karena disekitar tempat tinggalnya hanya dia yang berjualan dan biasanya konsumennya adalah mereka yang kost disekitar tempat itu. Dua (2) seminggu dia belanja bahan-bahan di Pasar Badung, dan biasanya dia diantar oleh anak sulungnya menggunakan sepeda motor. Ibu berusia 42 tahun ini bisa membiayai kebutuhan keluarganya dan juga pendidikan anaknya dengan keuntungan dari jualan Sembako. Ibu Sri I. sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal usaha untuk pengembangan toko Sembako miliknya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth has an internal fortitude motivated by the love of a mother for her only child. She has gotten ahead after many failures that didn’t permit her to practice her profession as a teacher. Not long ago, she decided to sell groceries at a stand in the market and it has proven to be a good option to sustain her family on a daily basis; the family includes only her son and her mother, with whom she shares her days. She greatly enjoys her mother’s company, and she now wishes to increase her merchandise and that way grow her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Margoth, tiene una fortaleza interna motivada por el amor de madre hacia su único hijo. Ella sale adelante después de muchos fracasos que no le permitían ejercer su profesión de maestra. Hace poco decidió vender abarrotes en un puesto de mercado la cual ha sido y es una buena opción para lograr el sustento diario de su familia: que son únicamente su hijo y su madre con quienes comparte los días. Ella disfruta mucho de la compañía de su madre y ahora su deseo es incrementar su mercadera y así acrecentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
H. Shavkat is 34 years old. He is married and the loving father of five children. Shavkat is a farmer. Shavkat is a strong physical and spiritual man. He plows the land to the best of his abilities. Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 10 years and to offer them an education as well. Shavkat sows potatoes, onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

Each year he is growing sufficient crops to feed his family and the rest to sell. At the same time, Shavkat is raises cattle. He buys cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. Now that the business is stable, Shavkat believes it shall be the main income for his family in the future as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly the expenses are raising.

Today Shavkat requests 600 $ US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Shavkat thanks everyone who trusted him and supports him today. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. Be an important part of the growth of Shavkat’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. is 43 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, she had a lot of difficulties in life because her husband passed away. In 1999, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in breeding animals. Later, she used the borrowed money to buy waste materials and resell them to wholesalers. This activity helps stabilizing her family economy. Being hardworking, she raised her 2 children on her own. She is currently invest in decorative plants to sell to local people and people from other towns. She wants to borrow 600 USD to buy more materials for her business. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Bích năm nay 43 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm. Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư các dự án phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi sau đó chị vay thêm vốn để đi mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc buôn bán phế liệu đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Là người phụ nữ chăm chỉ, chịu khó chị đã cố gắng làm ăn và nuôi được hai con khôn lớn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang đầu tư vào làm chậu trồng cây cảnh bán cho nhân dân địa phương và các vùng lân cận. Chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu phục vụ sản xuất. Thu nhập : 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy materials for business

loans.name: Nataša

texts.en: Nataša is a young woman from the town of Doboj.  She is not married and supports herself by working in a local coffee bar.  Since her income from this job is pretty small - around 260 USD per month - Nataša wants to try her luck with a second business. She wants to start selling cosmetics and thinks this will be a good way to increase her overall income.  This is her first loan from Zene za Zene, which she requests in the amount of 600 KM, and all of it will go towards building this side business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Yawovi Mawulom

texts.fr:
Monsieur M. Yawovi Mawulom est né le 30 novembre 1978 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est célibataire avec un enfant. Il a ouvert un magasin «  MINI PHARMA DIEU EST GRAND » de vente des produits génériques  dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son objectif en exerçant cette activité est de sauver des vies humaines à coût réduit.
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’aller s’approvisionner au Ghana en produits génériques pour un total de sept cartons afin de pouvoir servir la population. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aussi subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Yawovi Mawulom M. was born on November 30, 1978 in Mission Tové in Zio Prefecture. He is single and has a child. He opened a store called “MINI PHARMA DIEU EST GRAND” selling generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè district of Lomé. The objective of his work is to save human lives at a reduced cost. This first loan that he is requesting will enable him to get supplies of generic pharmaceuticals in Ghana totaling seven boxes in order to be able to serve the people. And thus, with the income from this business, he will also be able to provide for himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Ngwafu

texts.en:
G. is married and has four children with Nche Nji Michael. 

G. dropped out of school early because her parents were unable to continue her education. She was then pushed   to marry early in order to care for herself. As a child with her parents G. practiced a lot of farm work. Now in her husband's house she continues to use the skills of hard work and farming practices, and is able to support and cater to the needs of her family. Her yield from her activity is always good and she always has a ready market. She provides a lot of corn and beans to the community; people buy from her and go to resell at long distances.

Since joining GHAPE in 2006, G. has been able to take and repay two loans. This will be her third loan, which she will use for farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and beans.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou B. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (une des préfectures de la   troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans la concession paternelle avec sa maman et ses frères et soeurs.
Très tôt  Seydou B. a abandonné l’école pour mener  les activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de bicyclettes neufs et surtout d’occasions qu’il a appris  auprès de son cousin. 
Avec une experience de 8 ans, Monsieur Bagayogo maîtrise parfaitemenet cette activité et jouit d’une notoriété exemplaire et enviable à Bougouni. Il est beaucoup sollicité pendant les périodes de fêtes et la veille de la rentrée des classes car chaque enfant veut avoir une bicyclette.
C’est dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de son activité qu’il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 15 bicyclettes tout terrain. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la republique du Mali)
La vente de ses bicyclettes se fait au marché de Bougouni à une  clientéle composée de toutes les franches de la population.
Monsieur Seydou B. vend ses bicyclettes au comptant ou à crédit payable mensuellement. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA.qui servira essentiellement  à  agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.  Son ambition est d’associer à ses activités autres articles tels la vente de moto d’occasions et de pièces de vehicules.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B., 31, is married and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and his child in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) in his father’s holdings, together with his mother and his sisters and brothers.

Seydou B. left school at a young age to go out into the business world, selling in particular new bicycles and especially used ones, a business he learned from his cousin. With 8 years’ experience, Mr. Bagayogo is perfectly at home in this business and has an exemplary and enviable reputation in Bougouni. He has lots of customers during the holiday season and just before school begins, since every child wants to have a bicycle.

With a view to expanding his business, he came to Soro Yiriwaso through whom he is presently requesting his first loan. With this loan he intends to buy 15 all-terrain bikes. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells the bicycles in the market in Bougouni to a clientele composed of all sorts of people.

Mr. Seydou B. sells his bicycles for cash, or on credit with monthly payments. He expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which he will use to expand his business and support his family. His ambition is to add other lines to his business, for example used motorcycles and spare parts for cars.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bicycles for re-sale

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: How sweet is success in the field! Precilla P., who is 64 years old, lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, in the Philippines. She shared her happiness that her children were able to lead a better life because of rice farming, now that most of them have finished school and are married. “For 20 years I have been in rice farming, helping my husband do all the dirty work in the field, just to feed our 8 children,” she says. Because this is their only source of income, they exert every effort to make their rice-farming business sustainable. She owns a 1-hectare rice field and hires additional help during planting and harvesting. Their harvest has reached an average of 100 sacks during peak season, which is more than enough to sustain the family. Their main buyer is KC Marketing in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. In order to maintain this bountiful harvest and quality of produce, she is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Sandra tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Esperanza de la capital de Managua, casada, tiene un nieto de 8 años y una hija de 21 años. Los planes para con su familia es construir parte de su casa, mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerle un porvenir mejor Doña Sandra se desempeña como domestica desde hace diecisiete años tiene un negocio de cosméticos y vende también cosméticos desde hace siete años para obtener otros ingresos, que inicio con fondos propios Sus planes en el ámbito empresarial es aumentar sus ingresos con la innovación de nuevos Producto en la comercialización de Cosméticos, platería.
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic logrará comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, ladrillo y bloque, para terminar de hacer su casa Así  también le ofrecerá seguridad y protección a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 51 years old and lives in the Esperanza neighborhood in Managua. She is married and has a grandson of 8 years and a 21 year old daughter. The plans for her family are to repair part of their home, improve their quality of life and offer them a better livelihood. Sandra works from home where she has run a cosmetics business for 16 years. She also has also sold cosmetics for 7 years to obtain additional income, which she began with her own funds. For her business, she plans to increase her income with the innovation of new products in the commercialization of cosmetics and jewelry. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she has been able to purchase construction materials such as: cement, iron, brick, and cinder block, so that she can finish repairing her home. With their help, she has also been able to provide security and protection to those that she loves.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Tann

texts.en:
Tann L. is 51 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who typically make $2.50 a day. The weather conditions have been good this year and they hope to have great crops in the upcoming harvest season. The have two school-aged children.

Tann L. is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en: Lyudmila was born in 1950. She has been in the education business for 15 years. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a computer for improving her work. She lives in Baku city. Lyudmila is a teacher at a school. She is pictured with a student.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty A. is 32 years old. She is married and has three children -- a girl and two boys. Two of her children are currently in the primary school. The last born, however, is yet to start school. She says her husband has travelled abroad for greener pastures. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Gifty sells eggs to make some income to provide for the family. She procures the eggs from the poultry farms in the surrounding villages, and then sells them in a store at the local market square. She sells mostly to retailers. Gifty says she has been in this business for six years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more eggs. She hopes to improve upon the standard of living of the family and give the children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure eggs

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a nurse by training and she also has a store where she sells medicine to people in her community. She has been in this business for a long time. Abigail is 46 years old and married with three children. Abigail needs the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Murodchon

texts.ru: Муродчон занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов на местных рынках. Ему 38 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей. Основная его работа оплачивается низко и поэтому бизнес хорошее дополнение к его заработной плате. В МикроИнвест пришел недавно и изучив его условия Муродчон решил получить небольшой займ для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Murodchon is in the business of selling dry fruits on the local markets. He is 38 years old, married and has two children. His main job does not pay very much and this is why his business is a good addition to his salary. He has come to MicroInvest just recently and after learning the terms Murodchon has decided to get a small loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru: Абдуджабборова Хуршеда- женщина 31 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается  продажей полотенец и скатерти. Хуршеда торгует а Торговом Центре «Авганбазар» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Она закупает товар с Китая. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Когда она уезжает за товаром место него торгует её сестра. Когда Хуршеда начинала бизнес, у неё были маленькие количество товара. Теперь у неё увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Hursheda A. is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Hursheda sells towels and tablecloths at the Avganbazar trade center, which is located in Panchshanbe section of the city of Khujand. She buys her goods from China, and goes on a buying trip once a month. While she is away making purchases, her sister minds the shop. When Hursheda started the business, she only had a small selection of merchandise, but now her assortment of goods has increased.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico tiene 49 años, vive con su pareja, Flor, quien lo apoya en su negocio, con ella tiene 3 hijos que aun están en edad escolar. Él dedica a la venta de pescado de manera ambulatoria, mientras que su esposa lo hace en un puesto del mercado cercano a su casa. Uldarico es muy conocido en su localidad por la confianza que brinda a sus clientes con respecto a sus productos, ya que siempre vende pescado fresco y de buena calidad, esto ha hecho de su actividad un negocio rentable, ya que cada vez que llega a una localidad, lo reconocen fácilmente y acuden a comprar sus productos. Esta demanda ha hecho nacer en Uldarico la idea de poder incrementar sus ventas y enviar sus peces a otras ciudades. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de trabajar en su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros y compañeras de grupo son cumplidos con sus pagos y muy organizados para realizar las actividades señaladas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando es para comprar más pescado e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Uldarico is 49 years old and lives with his wife, Flor, who helps him with his business. They have 3 school-age children.

Uldarico sells fish as an ambulatory vendor while his wife sells from a stand near their house. He is very well known in the area for the dependability of his products because he always sells fresh, high quality fish. This is a profitable business for him because people recognize him as soon as he arrives at a location and they come to buy his products. The high demand for his products has caused Uldarico to come up with the idea to increase his sales by sending his fish to other cities.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and what he likes about working with the communal bank is that all of his partners are prompt with their payments and very organized in their usage of loans in consultaion with their financial advisor. This money will be used to purchase more fish and increase his sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L., a 44-year-old mother of three children, has owned a rice farm with her husband since the start of their marriage. Their farm income has enabled them to send their children to school. As well, they own one passenger multicab and raise pigs to supplement their income. Elizabeth is now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to help increase their farm yield.

CEVI is reaching out to people to start and maintain businesses, providing their clients not just with loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells drinks in her shop. As a widow, life has not been too easy for her and her four children. Folashade is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Haran

texts.en:
Haran is thirty-one years old and married with one seven-year-old child.  Haran buys new shoes from Kampala, Uganda, and transports them back to Kisumu, Kenya, where he sells them. He will use the loan to buy more shoes.

Haran sells the shoes at the main bus stop in Kisumu. He said that one of his challenges is that his currency loses value; as the foreign exchange rates vary, he sometimes loses money in his business dealings between Uganda and Kenya.

Haran says that his wife helps him with the business sometimes, while their child is in school.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Mrs Saran Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for 24 people living in Preak Ta Kaev village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs Saran P. is 60 years old and the village bank president. She is a mat maker and owns her own business. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money to buy the necessary raw materials to make the mats. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Mrs Saran P. has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer.

Nineteen members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, the borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Being born in a town where rice production is one of the most common livelihood of people, Elena and her 74 years old husband are used to be farmers since they were young. Parents of both were also farmers and that was their main source of income then. Elena has inherited a rice field from her parents however, she didn't have enough capital to maximize the land for a rice production (rice planting) business or any agriculture business. A piece of it was pawned to other people in the village to finance her only child's education until her graduation from college. In 2003, Elena decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)and get a loan to finance her rice production business that had started in 1999. She also dreamed then to get back the land they pawned.

Eventually after Elena's seventh times of loaning from ASHI she has able to have savings and have made their farming business grew. Her 35 years old only child who lives with her and her husband has been so supportive to her. Her loan presently which is intended for getting back her pawned land and finance her rice production business, is supported and agreed upon by her family. They promised each one that they will be helping each other for Elena to be able to payback her weekly payment in ASHI on time.

loans.use: Getting back a piece of riceland they pawned to other people and also to finance her rice production business.

loans.name: Dionisia Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañía.
Leonora es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Leonora junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal cuenta con horno propio, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar y también en la ciudad de Ayacucho según pedido. Además Leonora tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Leonora necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Leonora son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the “Ladrilleros de Compañía” (Brickmakers from Compañía) Communal Bank. Leonora is married, is 43-years-old, and has three children. Leonora, along with her husband, sell handmade bricks and use their own oven. They sell the bricks from home and also in the city of Ayachucho, made to order. Leonora also has a grocery store in her home. Leonora needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles that will be used to buy rice and sugar. Leonora dreams of buying her own land so she can build a house in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Savrioy

texts.en:
N. Savrioy is a widow and mother of one son. She has been running her own business for five years. Savrioy sells clothes and shoes for teenagers in a store that is located in a densely populated part of the city. She is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Savrioy has been a client of IMON for three years and has managed to pay all her loans accurately and precisely. She now requests $1,100 dollars (USD) in order to purchase some new inventory of goods.

Savrioy deeply appreciates your support and sincerely thanks all of you.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and was once ruled by Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new inventory in order to increase the range of resale goods.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 46 year-old mother of four. For the last two years, she has sold vegetables and building materials such as sand in Nairobi. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 in order to add to her stock of building materials. She plans to buy a lorry for transporting sand and other building materials and to have at least four other outlets. She describes herself as diligent and determined.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional building materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells bags of maize in Kwamikrom. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married and has four dependants. She is responsible for payment of the utility bills and providing food for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more of the bags of maize to be distributed to her customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more of the bags of maize

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  She is 39 years old and lives in Cruz Pata with her husband and and six children.

Margarita splits her time between growing cereal grains and buying and selling products like barley, potatoes, corn, beans, and wheat.  With this loan, she will buy more goods to sell.

Margarita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Maria Julgencia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Julgencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Susana Galdos”, Distrito D. Zapatero, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

Con el fin D. contribuir con los ingresos económicos D. su hogar, le nace la idea D. aperturar un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, donD. poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con su rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas y con  la amabilidad que le caracterizado siempre.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Maria Julgencia, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
María Julgencia, 54, is a member of the "Susana Galdos" communal bank, which is in the Zapatero district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is a widow and mother of four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. In order to contribute to meeting household expenses, she came up with the idea of starting a small business selling prepared meals from her home. Little by little she gained more experience and became very well-known and liked among her customers. Currently, she is still in this business taking care of her customers daily in her eatery. It is she, personally, who takes care of them with the delicious taste of her meals and with the kindness that has always characterized her. With this 2,500 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, assorted vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also buy some cooking utensils to replace some of the ones she has now in order to offer improved service and attention to her customers. María Julgencia feels secure and with the desire to continue forward insuring a tranquil life for herself. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Basic Food Products

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 29 years old, is married with two children, and takes care of two dependents. Both the children and dependents are aged between 4 and 8 years old. Benon and his family live in the Rwamagana district, which is approximately a one-and-a-half hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

For the past two years, Benon has been in the business of selling packed foodstuffs that include soft drinks, cheese, sardines, etc.. He employs one person as an assistant in his daily business activities and the working hours are 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.

Benon is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a fridge to be used in keeping his products safe and for a longer period. With these new funds, he hopes to provide quality goods to his customers and thus satisfy their needs.

Benon also plans to save a portion of his profits earned, and reinvest the rest in his business expansion. In addition, he will be getting more food for his family.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for his store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
N. K. Betty is a 48-year-old businesswoman and the mother of four children. She has a poultry farm in her area. She started the business six years ago. 

She is using the loan to purchase more chickens, feed for her poultry, medications, etc. She wants to extend her poultry structure so that she can manage to rear different breeds, that is to say, layers and broilers. Her aim is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens, feed for her poultry, medications, etc.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO  SAN MARTIN DE PORRES SE COMPONE POR UNA MESA DIRECTIVA : 

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SEÑORA ANA QUE SE DEDICA A LA RESPOSTERIA Y VENTA DE PLASTICOS, QUE VIVE EN CASA DE ANTICRETICO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO Y SUS 3 HIJOS EN LA ZONA DE SANTA ROSA NORTE.LA PAREJA TRABAJA FUERTE PARA SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE YA QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA COMO SER: JARRAS, VALDES,PANEROS,ETC. TODOS DE PLASTICO 

LA SECRETARIA  ES LA SEÑORA SUSANA QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO ELLA TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILICARA PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA YA QUE CUANDO HAY PROMOCION DE PRODUCTOS ELLA HACE PEDIDOS POR MAYOR PORQUE ES A UN COSTO BAJO Y LO VENDE AL PRECIO ORIGINAL, LA SEÑORA SUSANA VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PAPAS EN EL BARRIO CANADA.

LA TESORERA ES LA SEÑORA KAREN QUE SE DEDICA  A LA  VENTA DE COSMETICOS DURANTE 2 AÑOS TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PAPAS EN LA ZONA DE JUAN XXIII, EL BANCO SE ENCUENTRACON CERO MORA  SE APOYAN ENTRE ELLAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, DINAMICAS Y TRABAJADORAS. 

EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SE UTILIZARA PARA EL INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA DE MERCADERIA.

ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
The San Martin de Porres Enterprise Bank has a board of directors. The president is Senora Ana Maria, who bakes and sells plastics. She lives with her husband and 3 children in the Santa Rosa North area. The secretary is Senora Susana, who sells cosmetics from Monday through Saturday and lives in her parents' home in the Canada neighborhood. The treasurer is Senora Karen, who has sold cosmetics for two years from Monday through Saturday; she lives in her parents' home in the Juan XXIII area. The bank has no permanent location, they depend on one another. They are all dynamic, hard-working, and responsible persons. They are grateful that Emprender and Kiva have the confidence to grant them this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: M.g.

texts.en: S. is a married woman living with her husband and two daughters in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is 47 years old. Her husband is a bus driver, and she runs her small tailoring business at home. She currently has just one sewing machine and provides tailoring services for her neighbours and relatives as they place orders with her.  She wants to develop her business and in the future hopes to buy more machines and create employment opportunities for other women as well.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other accessories for designing dresses

loans.name: Roxann

texts.en:
Roxann A. is from the town of Sitio Pagasa Anupul Bamban, Tarlac. She is 21 years old and married, with an infant. To make a living, Roxann provides transportation services in the local community. Roxann has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

This year, Roxann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roxann is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support members of her extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 50 year-old married man. He has been selling livestock to the residents of Masii and its outskirts for ten years.  He also farms to earn additional income. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya to add more stock of cattle for sale.  He hopes that this loan will improve his business thereby increasing his sales and profit margins.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: En la comarca san miguelito municipio de somotillo el señor Mario Alberto M. H., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de las cuales destaca la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y ovino también realiza el establecimiento de cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que le aseguran la alimentación de sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, dichas actividades las realiza según las estaciones de la zona ya que en su mayoría solo existen dos invierno que es donde establece sus cultivos y verano que asegura la alimentación para su ganado, dichas actividades son realizadas en la mayoría de las horas del día, se le han financiado siete créditos con los cuales ha aumentado su hato ganadero y mejorado su sistema de producción de uno menos tecnificado a uno mejor y mas productivo con este financiamiento pretende comprar tres vacas mas con las que espera aumentar la producción láctea y cárnica con las que espera mejorar la mantención de su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, in the San Miguelito region, Mario Alberto M. H. works in agricultural production. Among his activities are raising cattle, pigs, poultry and sheep. He also farms subsistence crops, such as corn, sesame and sorghum, which allow him to provide a steady food supply for his wife and four children. He carries out these activities according to the seasons in his area, since usually there are only two: winter, when he establishes his crops, and summer, when he secures the food supply for his livestock. These activities take up most of the hours of his day. He has received financing for seven loans, which he has used to expand his livestock herds and improve his production system, from simpler methods to more technologically advanced ones. With the current loan, he plans to buy three more cows, so that he can increase his production of milk and meat and thus provide improved sustenance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three dairy cows

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 52 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, del cual tiene un puesto en un mercado céntrico de su ciudad. Es así que su actividad comienza todas las mañanas, ofreciendo a sus asiduos clientes desayunos y almuerzos, ellos muy gustosos de consumir los platos típicos que prepara Leonarda. Algunas veces sus hijos la apoyan en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes, puesto que este negocio que ha elegido requiere de mucho esfuerzo, ya que para lograr las ganancias que necesita, debe levantarse a las 4 de la madrugada para preparar la comida,.  Ella ha sabido conquistar a sus clientes por la buena sazón y la atención cálida que ofrece, es por ello que su negocio es rentable. Con el tiempo espera mejorar la fachada de su negocio, por el momento continuará trabajando hasta concretar sus objetivos. Esta es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus, manifiesta además que éste aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de ingredientes e insumos, así como alimentos no perecibles, para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 52, lives with her 3 children in a house that she owns. For 15 years, she has made a living selling prepared meals from a stand at the city's main market. That's where she starts work every morning, providing breakfast and lunch to her loyal customers, all of whom are eager to enjoy the traditional dishes that Leonarda prepares for them. Her children help her sometimes, waiting on customers, because this is a business that requires a lot of hard work. To make the money she needs, she has to get up at 4 in the morning to prepare her meals, but she's learned to win over her customers with good seasoning and attentive service that have helped to keep the business profitable. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her stand but, for now, she'll continue working on meeting her goals. This is Leonarda's seventh MFP loan and she is committed to using it responsibly. She says, too, that this help will be very useful in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy wholesale stocks of the ingredients she needs along with other supplies for making her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio S. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Florencio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Florencio has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Florencio joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne à accra. Voulant agrandir son commerce elle  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  poudre à visage, vernis, diluant, shampoing et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who has an income-generating business involving cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2006, and she gets her supplies in Accra. Wanting to expand her business, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying face powder, nail varnish, thinner, shampoo, and various cosmetics. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics and more

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 30 year-old metal worker.  He primarily makes metal gutters for customers in the surrounding area.  He has been in this business for eight years and has three employees. Festus is married; his wife is a tailor.   The primary business challenge he faces is competition.

Festus plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase iron sheets and other metal for his business.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Festus hopes to own a big piece of land and build on it.  In five years, he dreams of having many workers and being a famous supplier of his products and materials.

Festus describes himself as intelligent, hardworking, and committed.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and other metal for his business

loans.name: San Juan De San Roque Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal SAN JUAN DE SAN ROQUE, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Justa L. de 37 años, es casada y madre de 6 niños. Ella se dedica al tejido de  prendas de vestir y vende en Desaguadero. En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar hilos y tejer mantas. 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios como la venta de material escolar, comida, condimentos, verduras, víveres, cosméticos y abarrotes.
texts.en:
The SAN JUAN DE SAN ROQUE communal bank has 8 members and meets in one of Pro Mujer Panamericana’s focus centers. One of the group members is Justa L., 37. She is married and has 6 children. She weaves clothing items to sell in Desaguadero. She is asking for funds to buy yarn with which to weave blankets. The other group members have a variety of sales businesses such as: school supplies, food, spices, vegetable, groceries, cosmetics and prepared meals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (yarn).

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her commitment to her business. She is a very hard-working woman who is determined to achieve a better life.  Despite challenges and hardships caused by poverty, Violeta is dedicated to her mission of improving her family’s standard of living and she is supported by the love and care of her husband.

To earn a living, Violeta makes bamboo furniture and barbecue skewers. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. She joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2005,  During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent participant with respect to regular attendance at center and group meetings, loan repayment, and projects. She is now seeking her sixth loan, in the amount of 25,000 PHP,  to purchase raw materials needed to produce bamboo furniture (such as varnish, nails and bamboo shoots) and more stock for barbecue-skewer production.

With access to additional working funds through Kiva supporters, Violeta is optimistic that her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete college degrees will be achieved.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make bamboo furniture and barbecue skewers

loans.name: Mrs. Nhar Ith Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eighteen people who live in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo province. Mrs. Nhar I. is a village bank president who is 63 years old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Chork Gnem, are farmers who own one-hectare plot land to cultivate rice to support their family living and he is also a rickshaw. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Nhar I. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she wants to buy a sewing machine to start a new business for her children. She is a mother of two children whom all are seamstresses in garment factory and they are also learning sewing. All the members are shown in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger L. is from the village of Eastern Looc. He is 34 years old. Roger is single. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Roger has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roger joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roger from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de Quezalguaque, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y venta de leche, producción que sacan del ganado que tienen en conjunto con su marido desde hace varios años, inventario que han venido formando por esfuerzo propio, ya que su marido es de oficio albañil y trabaja donde lo buscan, quedándose siempre con la dirección del manejo del hato ganadero con su hijo quienes se involucran de manera familiar siempre en busca de mejorar su nivel de vida, dicho crédito lo utilizan para el alquiler de pasto   ya que todavía no tienen terreno propio, y de esa manera han sacado a sus hijos adelante y han mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en:
This client is from the town of Quezalguaque. She sells cosmetics and milk, which she gets from the cattle she has had with her husband for several years. They were able to obtain the cattle by their own hard work. Her husband is a bricklayer and works where ever he is needed. She manages the cattle herd with their son and as a family they are always looking to improve their quality of life. They will use the loan to rent pasture since they still don't have their own land. In this way, they have gotten their kids ahead and improved their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pasture rental expenses

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children who all attend school.  She owns a house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Her husband is a doctor and he supports his family financially.

Mejumaa has been operating her business of selling short cakes, flat bread (chapati) and sweet dumplings for the last ten years, selling to her neighbors and to passersby. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

Mejumaa faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a cereals shop in future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to obtain financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Shernazar

texts.en: A. Shernazar is 24 years old and is married. Ever since he was young, he has been raising animals with the support of his friendly family. At the time of our visit to his business, Shernazar was absent and that’s why his mother is pictured instead. Shernazar raises cattle and, little by little over time, he has been improving and expanding his business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living. IMON International has been a fundamental part of Shernazar’s business for the fact of having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves. Today, once again, Shernazar faces this need, and he trusts that his loan will be granted so that he can help his business and his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to raise in order to expand his business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling women's, men's and children's clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Betty is 24 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and also continue with her business.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlie Joy

texts.en: Arlie Joy F. owns and operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rattan-made general household furniture like cabinets and sofas to local businesses and community members. Arlie Joy is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Arlie Joy has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Arlie Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to make additional furniture. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Vibol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 16 people from Kong Noy village, Kandal province. The group members will use their portions of the loan for varied purposes.
Mrs. Sok V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the group members. She was born in 1960 and is the mother of one child who is 19 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also works as a tailor from her home while her husband, Mr. Hey Or, is a construction worker. It is now the season to grow rice, but Mrs. Sok V. does not have enough money to do this. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Sok V. is applying for a loan to farm rice this year.

loans.use: To farm rice this year

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan M. is a married man with two children, one who attends school while the other is still too young to do so. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is his rent.

Ramadhan has operated a meat roasting business for over a year, selling his meat at retail to his neighbors and passersby. Ramadhan’s major business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Ramadhan decided to join Yehu to get loans to modify his business. With 40,000 KES he wants to purchase furniture and fittings for his food stall. He hopes to own a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and fittings for his food stall

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 40 años y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropas, la socia viaja hasta Bolivia para comprar su mercadería para luego ofrecerlo a sus amistades, y personas que le solicitan, también compra cuadros para las salas de las casas de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank named "My Peru". The bank is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Victoria. She is 40 years old and she is a single mother of 1 boy. Her business is the buying and selling of clothing. She travels all the way to Bolivia to purchase her merchandise to resale to her friends and all those who have placed orders. She also purchases framed pictures for the living room. She is able to provide for her family through these businesses. 

She requests a loan to purchase more merchandise for her business. 

She is grateful to all of those who have become part of her dream and she is committed to the payment terms established for her loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos.  La señora estudió educación superior pero no pudo concluirlos.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la fabricación de muebles y artículos artesanales.

Con éste crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará lanas y maderas para la fabricación de muebles en general.  Nelly trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión a futuro es tener una barraca y una tienda artesanal donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de las socias y de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Las Kantutas” (national flower of Peru and one of two national flowers of Bolivia) communal bank located in Puno district and province.  She is 29 years old, has a live-in spouse and two children.  She did not finish higher education.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her furniture and crafts making business.

With this 1000 new sol loan she will buy wool and wood to make furniture.  Nelly works together with her husband.

Her vision for the future is to have a booth and artisanal shop where she can sell her products.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of its members and of Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy wool and wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old. To make a living, Merlyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She also planted coconut trees on part of her land. Merlyn plans to raise pigs soon.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Isabel Reyna

texts.es: Maria Isabel Reyna H. M., tiene 47 años, es casada, tiene 9 hijos, y reside en la comunidad de la Abisinia a 16 kilometros de la ciudade de Tocoa, Colon. Tiempo atras Maria y su esposo se dedicaban a la venta de leche hasta que FAMA les brindò su primer prestamo. Dicho prestamo fue invirtido en la compra de medicina natural y ahora ella se dedica a venderlas en su domicilio. En la aldea donde vive Maria no hay otro negocio igual que el de ella asi que eso le garantiza la clientela total. El prestamo que actualmente solicita lo necesita para comprar vitaminas, jeringas, desparasitadores, panadol, iboprodol, etc y asi surtir mas su pequeño negocio. Con el apoyo del prestamo Maria mantendrà una entrada de dinero que le permite ayudar a su esposo a sostener la familia. Su sueño apoyar a sus dos hijas menores con el estudio para que ellas se graduen y tengan una mejor oportunidad de vida. Ha sido cliente por cuatro ciclos y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 47 years old, married and has nine children. She lives in the community of Abisinia, 16 kilometers from the city of Tocoa, Colon. Previously Maria and her husband sold milk until FAMA provided them with their first loan. This loan was used to buy natural medicine. She currently sells this medicine from her house. In the area where she is located, there is not another business like hers, so she has a guaranteed clientele. With the money from the loan that she is requesting she will buy vitamins, syringes, medicine to remove parasites, acetaminophen, ibuprofen, etc. In this way she will provide a larger variety of products for her small business. With the help of this loan, Maria will be able to assist her husband with the support of their family. Her dream is to help her younger children with their education so that they graduate and have a better opportunity in life. She has had four loans and has always paid her payments responsibly

loans.use: She will buy vitamins, syringes, medicine to kill parasites, acetaminophen, ibuprofen.

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Mr. Peng P. and his wife (pictured together) live across the Mekong River and about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children, four sons and two daughters.

Peng is a fisherman, and he also sells cows. He hopes to continue expanding his business selling cows, so he has applied for a loan of 600 USD to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth D. is from the village of Mmabuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Lilybeth is married with five school-aged children. She owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Lilybeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 18000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lilybeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilybeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Lilybeth is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be her seventh loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
