Mercelita is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  charcoal sales, vegetable vending and farming. Her husband Orlando, who is 38 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 10 and 11 years old. Mercelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy more stock so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education & household improvements. Mercelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the important musical equipments for his business

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet K. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Som-ol Chab, are silk weavers. Besides weaving, Som-ol is also a construction worker.  They have eight children - two sons and six daughters. Four are married and live in their own family homes, one is a garment factory worker, two weave silk at home, and another one is a construction worker. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Savet K. asks for another loan of $1,100 to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk and cotton materials.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo forma parte del banco comunal “Premio al esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Él tiene una rosticería, ésta es una tienda de alimentos, en la cual vende  carne, cecinas, bebidas, está surtido y abastecido de muchos productos. Bernardo se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 7 meses. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras, vega y proveedores de sus productos que llegan a su local.   
Su local lo tiene ubicado en la casa de su madre, ya que ella le cedió una parte de su patio, su local está muy bien ubicado por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela. Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 11ºº de la noche.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería y sus metas son ampliar su negocio, por lo que está siendo asesorado por un arquitecto para concretar su proyecto. Ya que necesita más espacio para ubicar sus productos.
Su sueño es comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería.
Bernardo vive junto a su madre, quien recibe una pensión de viudez. Por esto su motivación de comenzar éste negocio, ya que ha podido colaborar con los gastos del hogar económicamente.
Bernardo está muy agradecido del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que sin ésta ayuda no hubiera sido posible, comenzar su negocio. Además está muy contento de la orientación y motivación recibida. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal él se siente muy cómodo en las reuniones realizadas, ya que estas son muy gratas.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the communal bank named "A Prize for Effort", located in the city of Concepcion. He has a rotisserie and this is a food store. There he sells meats, jerky, and drinks. The store is stocked with a variety of many products. Bernando has had his business for 7 months. He usually purchases his merchandise from distributors and sales people that come to his store. 

He has his store installed in his mother's house. She has given him a part of her patio and his store is very well located, which is why he has so many clients. His works schedule is from Monday to Sunday from 8am to 11pm. 

With this loan he will purchase merchandise and his goal is to expand his business. An assessment by an architect is being done to materialize his project. He needs more room to place his products.

His dream is to purchase a pick-up truck with which to transport his merchandise. 

Bernardo lives with his mother and she receives an old age pension. His motivation to start his business was to be able to financially contribute towards the household expenses.

Bernardo is very thankful for the loan he obtained through Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner).  Without this support it would not have been possible to start his business. He also is very happy with the training and motivation he has received. With respect to his communal bank he is very comfortable with the meetings, especially because they are so enjoyable.

The city of Concepcion is nestled at the mouth of the Biobio River. It is one of the largest in the country, at Chile's south, and in the region of Biobio. It has had an important function in our history, being the site of important battles and relevant settlements, especially during the War of Arauco, for being at the border of the Mapuche territory. The city is currently seeing an important economic and demographic development. It is now considered to be one of the most relevant urban centers in Chile, pertaining to demographics, administration, economy, and commerce. It is second only to Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for his store

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas 1 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is one of the members of the “Mujeres Virtuosas 1” (Virtuous Women 1) group, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. Their principal economic activities are the sale of food in 'colmados' (small grocery stores) and the sale of sweet pastries. 

Lucia is the mother of 7 children, 5 of whom live with her as she is a divorced mother. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is still having sufficient money to cover the needs of her family. Her favorite activity is serving in her business.

Lucia is very moved by receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for around 5 and a half years. She set up her business when she received a family inheritance. She became successful through her own initiative for creating income and being useful. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase rice, oil, flour, canned food, vegetables, etc. for her small grocery store.

She plans to use her profits to save because she is planning to buy a new freezer for her business. Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house. Thank to these loans helping with extra income, she has been able to have an improved business and improved standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, flour, canned food, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38, married, and runs a green grocery. She has been in this business for five years. Mary, a mother of three, works hard in her business so that she can provide for her family. She says that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable. In the future, she hopes to have a well-established business. She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy bananas, oranges and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges and vegetables

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 56 year old single lady. She has two children who are 27 and 24 years old. She has a video show business which she has been running as a primary business. She has been running it for a period of three years with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

She is taking the fourth loan with KADET, after repaying the previous one successfully. She will use the loan amount to start a cosmetic shop as a secondary business and later on, to expand the business. Her hope is to succeed in her business and to improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: to start a cosmetic shop, as a secondary business.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Ercilia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, tiene 38 años, es conviviente, y tiene tres hijos. Ercilia tiene una bodega. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su mercadería. Ercilia vive cerca de la urbanización Magisterial y se dio cuenta que por ahí no había muchas bodegas y decidió abrir lo fue implementando poco a apoco ahora vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carnes y pollo. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia con cierta duda, pero le gusta se puede ahorrar. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca más y sea sólido y que su hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Ercilia is a member of the Winarisun Community Bank. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Ercilia has a general store. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase groceries to increase her merchandise. Ercilia lives near the Magisterial development, and she realized that there were not a lot of grocery stores around. She decided to open [the store] and has been growing it little by little. Now she sells a general variety of groceries - vegetables, fruits, meats, and chicken. She joined Kiva partner FINCA Peru at the invitation of one of the members. She had some doubt, but now she likes that she has been able to save. Her dream is that her business will grow more and be stable and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Maritza Mirtha

texts.es: La señora Maritza tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad que esta en el colegio, maritza se dedica a vender productos de belleza de distintos catalagos, los desafíos que enfrenta maritza es trabajar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo ya que ella es madre solera y no tiene el apoyo de su pareja, el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoramiento de vivienda, ponerle piso a su sala y comprar algunos materiales como cemento arenilla entre otros, maritza tiene mucho sueños uno de ellos es hacer crecer mas su negocio, y poco a poco seguir arreglando su vivienda, maritza esta muy agradecida por la confianza que se esta brindando.
texts.en:
Maritza is 34 years old.  She is a single mother and she has a 12 year-old son who is in school.  Maritza's business is selling beauty products from different catalogs.  The challenge that she faces is working to provide a better quality of life for her son as she is a single mother and doesn't have any support from her partner.

Maritza is requesting this money to improve her home, lay flooring in her living room and buy some materials such as cement and [fine] sand.

Maritza has many dreams.  One of these dreams is to further grow her business and gradually continue fixing up her home.  Maritza is very grateful for the trust is being placed in her.

loans.use: to improve her home, lay flooring in her living room and buy cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly is 29 years loan and her husband, Sokkea, is 23 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have no children yet.   

Chhunly sells vegetables. Her husband is a driver; he drives for a company in Phnom Penh. Chhunly is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work. 

Photo: Chhunly and her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Resielda

texts.en:
Resielda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Resielda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Resielda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Agater

texts.en: Agater is a widow. She has six children, five of whom are in school. She took loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and mangoes and expand her business. She will use the loan to pay for school fees of her children and build a new house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and mangoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm fruits to process into oil to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 26 years old and married to Paul. They are blessed with a two-year-old daughter. Annet has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her business and family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  She has been loaned KES 10,000, and she will use the loan to buy clothing materials to add to her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her daughter. Her hopes are to buy a modern sewing machine which will help her increase her monthly income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials to add to her shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia, tiene un punto Internet y cabinas telefónicas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de golosinas (dulces); así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes cuando estén usando Internet y generar ingresos extras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí  en la ciudad de La Paz; es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia has an Internet café and phone booths. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy that she can sell to her customers while they are using the Internet. This will help her generate extra income. Alicia lives in her own home in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz. She is a single mother and has one daughter.

This is the third time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to purchase candy that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Pswerukai is 42 years old and lives in Norton, a town outside Harare. He is married and has three children aged 3, 4 and 10; two are at school.

Pswerukai prepares chickens to sell to butchers in the local market. He also works as a part-time accounts assistant.  

He will use the loan to buy 200 day-old chicks and sufficient feed for them until maturity. In this way he will significantly increase the scale of his business.

In time, he hopes to increase the business to a minimum of 5,000 chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is a married man with two children who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a 49-year-old married woman.  She has five children whose ages range from six years to twenty-one years.  She describes herself to be God fearing and humble.  

She operates a a water distribution services business where she sells water to the local people in Kisumu.  She has been involved in this business for fourteen years.  Her business is located in a densely populated slum area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more water and water storage containers.  Her business goal is to grow it into a big business within five years.  

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more water and water containers.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with ten children, six of whom are enrolled in school, two have completed school, and two are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Hamisi has operated a café for the past three years; his clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough sales due to the low population in his area. He dreams of expanding his business to a hotel in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase furniture for his café and also add more stocks of food for his café. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers loan facilities with low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his café and also add more stocks of food for his café

loans.name: Rosemary Clementina

texts.es: La señora Rosemary es un cliente antigua que esta en su  cuarta secuencia  de su crédito  individual,  es madre soltera con cuatro  hijos que están en la edad escolar dos de ellos están en la universidad, es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora que saco adelante a sus hijos sola, viven en la zona de  Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz su vivienda es alquilada, el préstamo  lo invertirá  para la compra de zapatillas por mayor  para fin de  año, la señora  es muy dedicada a su trabajo ya que desde   muy tempranas horas desde la madrugada  sale  ha vender zapatillas a si mismo  se siente  muy agradecida a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosemary is a long-standing client who is in her fourth individual loan cycle.  She is a single mother with four school-age children.  Two of her children are in college.  Rosemary is a strong and hard-working woman who brought up her children alone.  They live in Alto Tejar district, in the city of La Paz, in a house which they rent.  

Rosemary will invest this loan in buying sneakers wholesale for the end-of-year season.  She is very committed to her work as she gets up very early in the morning to go out and sell shoes.  She feels very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to invest in buying sneakers for the end-of-year season.

loans.name: Mahmadkul

texts.ru: Махмадкул более 20 лет занимается изготовлением и выпечкой лепёшек. Его пекарня находится в центре местного рынка. У него два работника, которым он выплачивает зарплату. Его жена помогает ему в продаже  на рынке готовой продукции. Каждый день они изготавливают и продают по 200-250 шт. лепёшек. Лепешки востребованы всегда. От этого бизнеса он получает хорошую прибыль. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес  и на полученную прибыль отремонтировать свой дом.  Махмадкул запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса, закупа сырья для выпечки.
texts.en: Mahmadkul has been preparing and baking flatbread for over 20 years. His bakery is in the middle of the local market. He has two paid employees. His wife helps him in selling the baked goods at the market. Every day they bake and sell about 200-250 pieces of flatbread. Flatbread is always in demand. Mahmadkul receives a good income from this business. He would like to expand his business and  use the resulting revenues to pay for house repairs. Mahmadul is requesting a loan for expanding his business by stocking up on raw products for his bakery.

loans.use: to expand his business [by stocking up on raw products for his bakery].

loans.name: Njete Women Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Njete Women group. George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

George takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and later educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, George had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, George will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Njete Women group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows George with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is 30 years old and married to Andrew. They have three children.

She has been in the photo business for the last 3 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 50,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 20,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to upgrade the studio section of her business and to open up more photo studios in the future.

loans.use: to upgrade her studio

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with 4 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

She runs a sari-sari store business where she sells items like canned goods, coffee and sugar. She also sells fresh and dried fish to her community. She works hard to provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school.

Leonila has requested this loan to buy more items and fish to sell. She hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lors

texts.en: Mrs. Lors is an honest client of HKL and this is her third loan from our MFI. With the previous loans, Lors has never made a late payment and has repaid successfully. The purpose of this loan is to construct a small house for her married child. Her other two children are single and live with her in Dongkor commune. Lors presently has been involved in a farming project. She cultivates rice to earn a living, while her husband shares his responsibility for the family by providing construction services from place to place. In the future, Lors aims to open a seamstress shop for her single daughter who is now working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: to construct a small house for her married child.

loans.name: Petru

texts.en: Petru has always loved bees, ever more so since he began his apiculture business. In the small village of Sadova he works hard to care for his bees and to use their precious production as efficiently and creatively as possible. A Peace Corps volunteer originally helped him research and set up the foundation of his project several years ago and Petru has not stopped learning and experimenting since. Right now, for example, he is working on a new system for the wooden frame that holds the beeswax foundation inside the hive. Currently his operation has two branches: honey production and candle making. The former involves much attention to the health of his bees. In the spring and summer he takes his hives to the forest above his town to allow the bees to find nourishment from different varieties of trees as they come into season, thus creating differentiated honeys as derived from certain blossoms (separated according to the time period in which the bees were feeding). The honey is sold at the local markets as well as in stores, but it is difficult in Moldova to have a good and steady income from honey sales alone so Petru realized that diversification was important. The candle making side of the business entails many steps, starting with finding a steady supply of good wax. Petru wants to generate more of his own high-quality wax since the stock he recently purchased was in large part impure and brittle, but doing so will take some time and require expansion; he would like to work up to a larger scale, hopefully with around 100 families of bees. He works with his family, especially with his daughter who loves painting the finished candles with special paints to make them even more ornate, and sells the candles at stores specializing in crafts and decorative goods. Many local churches also buy tall alter candles from Petru since they know that he only uses high quality wicks and that the candles will burn well. Petru would now like to purchase more hives, to buy a stock of sugar-derived nutrition for wintertime feeding and to buy a supply of finer wax to ensure superior candles for his customers to use in the holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of new hives, wax for candles, sugar for nutrition

loans.name: Tatuka

texts.en: Tatuka, born on March 24, 1970, is married and a mother of 4 childre. She lives in an isolated area on the outskirts of the city where there are very few shops. Her shop is very popular. She is a very hardworking woman who started her business in 1991 with only US$4. In spite of the political and economic instability of the 1990s in the Congo, which caused the closure of many businesses, Tatuka did not give up her business. It is now providing basic goods to the neighbourhood. With a loan of US$800, Tatuka wants to provide much better services to people and buy a large stock of soap, sugar, salt, milk, spices and storage cans. Tatuka’s shop is very useful for her community which is isolated from downtown. Her other plans include expanding her business by adding cement and beverages in order to serve the community.

loans.use: To add to the stock of her goods and to diversify her business by adding sacs of cement

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has a business selling lottery tickets and magazines. His workplace is situated near one of the hospitals in a suburb of Guayaquil. He works from 7am to 6pm. He obtained his experience in this business working for a relative, selling for him on a very low-percentage commission basis. With this experience and some savings, Pedro started his own business and has managed to keep in business thanks to the constant dedication and effort of Pedro and his wife.

Pedro is asking for a loan in order to expand his lottery sales business, given that many holiday dates are approaching. Thanks to the good quality of his attentive service, he has been able to increase his number of customers, and he wants to make the most of this opportunity for expansion in the lottery sales and magazine market.

Pedro is 37 years old. He is married and his wife works as a CD and lottery-ticket saleswoman, covering the area they live in. They have one son who is studying.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Pedro tiene su negocio de venta de lotería y revistas. Su lugar de trabajo es alrededores de uno de los hospitales del suburbio de guayaquil. Su horario de atención es de 7 a.m. a 6 p.m. Su experiencia la obtuvo porque trabajaba con un familiar que le vendía por un porcentaje el mismo que era muy bajo. Pedro con este conocimiento y un ahorro propio empezó su negocio y lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y empeño que Pedro y su esposa le han dedicado.

Pedro solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio de venta de lotería dado que se aproximan muchas fechas festivas. Dado a la buena calidad de su atención y servicio a sus clientes les han permitido aumentar el número de ellos. Y desea aprovechar esta oportunidad de crecer en el mercado de venta de lotería y revistas.

Pedro tiene 37 años es casado su esposa trabaja como vendedora de lotería y discos recorriendo por el sector donde habitan. Tienen 1 hijo y esta estudiando.

loans.use: Buy more lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Serdar

texts.en: Serdar Z. owns a small fabric stand in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Serdar runs his stand out of the local Bazaar and has successfully paid back two loans with Norwegian Microcredit in the past. Serdar is looking for funding in order to increase the quantity and quality of his fabric inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of his fabric inventory.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mr. Oeun K., 40, is a widower and lives with his six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To cover his family's expenses, he moderately earns around $2 each day from working as a fisherman, while three of his children are employed at a factory and the rest are students. Mr Oeun K. has recently applied for a loan to purchase a boat and a fishing net so that he will be able to improve his fishery business during this coming rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a fishing net so that he will be able to have enough tools to improve his fishery business during this coming rainy season.

loans.name: Jeremia

texts.en:
JEREMIA, age 24, opened his shop three years ago. Before this, he sold items while walking on the street. Now his shop carries luggage, clothes, and shoes. Around 40 customers come by the shop each day and bring in a profit of around $18. With the profits, Jeremia pays the rent and the salary of a shop assistant– his nephew and roommate. He also financially supports his parents and 4 siblings who are in school. Jeremia hopes to take out a loan to increase his inventory.

Jeremia belongs to the group Tujikwamue (Swahili for “progressing from one stage to another”), which consists of 25 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nancy Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Nancy is 50 years old and has three children, all of which depend on her. She has only studied through grade school. She lives in a district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo of the Department of Liberty. Mrs. Nancy dedicates herself to the sale of food from her own home to people of her town. She gives out food to the workers of the various shoe shops in the area to whom she sells her food products. She is very happy because the credits she has received have enabled her to improve and expand her business.

Mrs. Nancy belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Cielo", from which she obtained her first loan of $100. With them she bought products in great quantities like oil, milk, noodles, pulp, and cookies. She uses these for the preparation of the food she sells.

She has just received a loan of $167 to repay in four months. With this money she has bought small benches in order to best accomodate her clients and she has also renovated the glass of her liquidator that was in bad condition. Mrs. Nancy dreams of having a big restaurant someday. She also wishes to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy tiene 50 años de edad, estudió solo primaria, tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Nancy se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa a personas de la zona pero además reparte comida a los trabajadores de diferentes talleres de calzados a quienes vende sus productos al crédito. Nos cuenta que antes de participar en su grupo mientras tanto vendía en menor cantidad ya que no tenía capital para realizar venta al crédito, ahora se siente muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han permitido crecer y mejorar su negocio.

La señora es socia fundadoras del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Cielo” en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con ellos compró al por mayor productos que utiliza para la preparación de los alimentos que vende como: aceite, papa, fideo, leche y galletas.

Acaba de recibir un crédito de S/.500 (aproximadamente $ 167) para cancelarlos en 4 meses, con este dinero ha comprado banquitos para darle mayor comodidad a sus cliente y además ha renovado el vaso de su licuadora que estaba en mal estado. La señora Nancy sueña con tener un restaurante grande y con terminar de construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture (benches, seats) and repair of liquidator

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Veronika M.. She is married with five children, ages 3, 6, 8, 10 and 13. In 2002 Veronika established a grocery, poultry, and milking machine rental business. Veronika has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $1050 in order to purchase additional chickens, and stock for her grocery store. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell, as well as additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia lives with her own nuclear family in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widow and has 4 children. Her husband died in a explosion last year in Kabul, but she is managing to support her family by working as a tailor. She has good experience in sewing traditional Afghani clothes in Kabul and selling what she sews to shopkeepers in the bazaar.

Razia needs to expand her business so she wants to take an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and complete her necessary business materials. This will allow her to make a good income and better support her family. She is happy with all the members of her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
42 year-old Mrs Sokhna Sene, married and a member of the Ngollar Village Bank, runs a business selling brooms made from twigs by local craftsmen. She has been a customer of the Program for many years and has always respected her commitments. Her income enables her to support the needs of her family. Sokhna is requesting a 12th loan that she plans to repay after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Sokhna SENE, mariée, 42 ans membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar mène une activité de commerce de balaies de fabrication artisanale fait à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle est cliente du programme depuis des années et a toujours respecté ses engagements. Ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir au besoin de la famille. Sokhna sollicite un 12ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en un seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Saletagaloa Salelologa Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 11 women of Saletagaloa Salelologa on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women will use their loans for the following purposes:

Faaiviivi F. (54, married, 5 children) to purchase a spade, pesticides, knives, a planting stick, a filing, and a wheelbarrow for her fruit and vegetable (taro, yam, cocoa, bananas and other produce) business.

Luisa I. (43, married, 5 children) to purchase chemicals, knives, weed killer, a sack of sugar, plastic, and concentrate for her vegetable (taro and banana) and ice cake (ice cream) businesses.

Nive F. S. (21, married, 1 child) to purchase chicken legs, corned beef, fish, spam, noodles, sugar, rice cheese, gel, tea, and other items for her retail shop.

Ana E. (52, married, 8 children) to purchase pesticides, a knife and a wheel barrow for her fruit and vegetable (taro, bananas, cucumbers, pumpkins and tomatoes) business.

Tusiga T. (54, married) to purchase a fishing net, a hook and a spear for her fish business.

Malie S. (42, divorced, 6 children) to purchase a weed killer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, and a knife filing.

Pelita F. (62, married, 9 children) to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, a wheel barrow, seeds, and a bush knife for her fruit and vegetable (cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers) business.

Mema Tautua (50, married, 6 children) to purchase fertilizer, a filing, a knife, pesticides, and a fishing net for her taro and fish businesses.

Lulu T. (34, married, 4 children) to purchase an elei board, x-ray designs, brushes, threads, material, paints and shelves for her clothing business.

Rosa F. P. (28, married, 2 children) to purchase barbed wires, rice, nails, hammer, and knives to raise chicken chickens and make handbags.

Siutu L. (21, married, 3 children) to purchase a weed killer, pesticides, planting stick, a knife, a filing, and a spade.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, a filing, etc

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel started the business because her job as a teacher did not bring in enough money to cover her family's numerous expenses. For this reason she began her own business hoping to generate extra income. The business started eight years ago and it has been doing very well. She first started selling merchandise to people that she knew and they, in turn, recommended her service to others, increasing the total number of clients. Up to this day, she is still sought after by a great number of customers that want to purchase shoes and clothes. They know she makes split-payments deals that makes it easier for them to obtain what they want.

She requests a credit line in the amount of US500.00, that will be paid off in 2 months, to purchase more of the season's merchandise because she has many orders that she has not been able to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

María Isabel inició el negocio debido a que su trabajo como maestra no le dejaba suficientes ingresos y tiene muchos gastos en su casa, por esa razón se decidió a emprender mi propio negocio para sacar un ingreso extra. Comenzó hace 8 años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, en un inicio vendía únicamente a personas conocidas pero después la fueron recomendando con otras personas y su círculo de ventas se fue incrementando. Al día de hoy ya cuenta con un buen volumen de clientes que la buscan para comprar ropa y calzado, como saben que les da algunas facilidades de pago, la gente no tienen gran problema en conseguir lo que andan buscando.

Solicita un crédito por $500 que pagara en 2 meses para conseguir mercancía de temporada porque tiene varios pedidos pendientes que no ha podido surtir por falta de recursos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Magsad

texts.en: Magsad has been in the farming business for  5 years. He was born in 1964. He is married and has 6 children.   Magsad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. He needs a loan of $975 to buy the fertilizer and seedlings needed to improve his farming business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Lan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lan Thi V. is a 35 year old woman. She has been a TYM partner since 2006. Her husband is a construction worker, whose income is about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Before her participation in TYM program, the family income was mainly from her husband’s income and revenue from farming. Becoming a partner, they have been using the loan to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then reselling it to manufacturers. This business brings in frequent revenue of 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to use a proportion of the next loan of 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand the business and buy some breeding pigs. Family's frequent income is about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Lan năm nay 35 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.Chồng chị là thợ xây thu nhập khoảng 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu dựa vào lương của chồng và làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị đã bàn với chồng vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc này hiện nay cho thu nhập đều đặn 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán phế liệu chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ. Chị dự định sẽ dùng một phần nhỏ trong số vốn vay tới để mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi.

Thu nhập bình quân3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy back scrap-iron and invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Nosir.

texts.ru:
Nosir B. lives in the area of Khuroson, in the settlement Pakhtaobod. He works as a teacher at the high school. He also rent land, which he uses to sow cereal cultures. He sells the crop a the local market. He plans to receive a loan, which he plans to use for agriculture to buy seed and fertilizer. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоев Носир житель районеа Хуросон , поселка Пахтаобод. Работает учителем в средней школе . Кроме того арендует землю , которую использует для посева злаковых культур. Получаемый урожай реализует на рынке. Планирует получить кредит , который хочет использовать в сельском хозяйстве , для приобретения семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Monsieur B. Yawo est né en 1984 à Wagba. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a ouvert depuis 2002 sa boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Le premier crédit qu’il a obtenu lui a permis de réaménager sa boutique et de bien s’installer. 
Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de spaghetti et 5 sacs de riz et 8 cartons de laits. Avec ce nouveau stock, il pourra mieux vendre et tirer de revenu afin de pouvoir prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yawo B. was born in 1984 in Wagba. He is married and has three (3) children. In 2002, he opened a store selling basic need goods in the Agoè district north of Lomé. The first loan he obtained allowed him to reorganize his store and to set it up properly. This second loan that he is asking for will allow him to buy 10 cans of oil, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 5 bags of rice, and 8 cartons of milk. With this new stock, he will be able to sell better and earn enough income to be able to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell basic need goods

loans.name: Roukéya

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1976, dame I. Roukéya est une femme dynamique mariée. Elle a trois enfants et a pour activité la vente de l’oignon au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce à l’âge de 19 avant d’être mariée.
Ayant pour objectif d’agrandir son activité et de bien servir ses clients, elle désire vendre en gros et en détail afin d’écouler ses marchandises.
A cet effet, après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce second pour acheter 14 sacs d’oignon. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Roukéya I. is a very energetic woman who was born in born in Lomé in 1976. She has three children, and her work involves selling onions at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She started this business at the age of 19 before getting married. Having the goal of expanding her work and serving her customers well, she would like to sell at the wholesale and retail levels in order to move her merchandise on the market. For this reason, after having promptly repaid her first loan, she is requesting this second one to buy 14 sacks of onions. With the income from her work, she will be able to cover the cost of schooling her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 14 sacks of onions

loans.name: Unidos Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidos Por Siempre, fue conformado por tres señoras que tienen en común la venta de víveres en un popular mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia.
La Señoras se dedican a la venta  de víveres los cuales venden a crédito, desde su primer drédito demostraron responsabilidad, son un grupo antiguo y a la fecha se encuentran en su sexta secuencia crediticia. La señora Marilyn es madre soltera, por lo cual su negocio es el único sustento que tiene para mantener a sus hijos, es la lider del grupo al ser una persona muy responsable, refiere que en el negocio y gracias al microcrédito le va muy bien. Por su parte las señoras Vilma y M., tambien ayudan económicamente en sus hogares, por lo cual se sienten muy útiles en el mantenimiento del hogar, todo ello gracias a su trabajo. El crédito solicitado lo utilizaran en la compra de una mayor cantidad de viceres que venderán en ocasión del dia de los muertos, fecha en que las familias de clase humilde hacen repostería en sus hogares para celebrar este día.
texts.en:
The group “Forever United” was formed for three women who all sell supplies in a popular market in La Paz, Bolivia. The women sell supplies on credit. Since their first loan, they have demonstrated responsibility and are an experienced group who are requesting their sixth loan. Marilyn is a single mother. Her business is her only source of income to support her children. She is the leader of the group and is very responsible, thanks to her business and the micro loans that have been successful. Vilma and Magna also contribute financially to their homes, making them feel very useful and appreciative of their jobs. The loan they are requesting will be used to purchase supplies at wholesale that they will sell for the Day of the Dead holiday, a day when low class families make baked goods in their homes in order to celebrate.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es soltero, vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura, en especial al cultivo de café actividad que viene realizando por 3 años, tiempo en el que decidió independizarse económicamente de sus padres y sobre todo, poder ayudarlos. Dentro de su trabajo como agricultor  le agrada  realizar las cosechas, porque es hermoso ver maduros los cafés y listos para su debido procesamiento y venta, siendo lo más difícil para un agricultor el sembrar las plantas, lidiar con el clima y con el sol de medio día. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Daniel invertirá este dinero en la compra de  plantas de café, las cuales  son muy costosas, pero productivas.
texts.en:
Daniel is single and lives with his parents. He has dedicated himself to coffee farming for 3 years now so that he could become financially independent and could actively contribute to the household income. As a farmer, Daniel loves the harvest most of all. It is is beautiful to watch his plants mature and become ready for processing. On the other hand, the most difficult part of the cultivation process is sowing the seeds, and having to contend with the climate and the midday sun. This is his first loan from MFP. Daniel will use the money to buy coffee plants, which are very expensive at the outset but very productive over time.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of coffee plants

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, estado civil soltera, tiene tres lindos hijos que son independiente. Los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida. Doña Juana tiene su negocio que es una  pulpería desde hace diez años de experiencia en el servicio al cliente, inicio con fondos propios ya anteriormente vendía nacatamales, leña y otros productos de consumos diarios, sus objetivos  para el negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta con la introducción de nuevos productos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: granos básicos, enlatados, frutas, verduras y golosinas, aumentando el volumen de venta y generando utilidades que benefician al hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 45-years-old and lives in the district of Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three beautiful children, who are independent. Her plan is to raise her family’s standard of living. Juana runs her own business, a small grocery store in which she has gained experience serving her customers for the past ten years. She started out with her own funds and previously sold nacatamales (Honduran tamales), firewood, and other everyday consumer products. Her goal for her business is to grow her sales by introducing new products. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC she will be able to purchase goods like basic grains, canned goods, fruits, vegetables, and candy, allowing her to increase sales and generate profits for the benefit of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem S. lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her child. She sells groceries to earn a living and is able to make $4 a day. She is helped by her child, who works as farmer growing rice and some vegetables. Her child grows rice two times a year during the dry and rainy season.

Kem S. would like a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Cresensia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 32-year old Cresensia O. from Mwanza. She is married with three children who are between the ages of three and 10. Additionally, she is also mother to one orphan.

Cresensia has been running a furniture business since 2007. She sells beds, chairs and tables. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Cresensia currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy 40 pieces of timber so that she can continue to make furniture. In the future, she plans to increase her timber stock. Cresensia thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy pieces of timber to make furniture for her business

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marlon vende juntos con su mama granos básicos, productos de cosméticos y refrescos, el tiene 24 años de edad, reside en el barrio el pilar en la ciudad de Managua, el vende desde que tiene 15 años ayudaba a sus padres y inicio con ayuda de su mama, para obtener sus propios ingresos, y poder mantener a su familia ya que su esposa le tiene dos hijo uno de 4años y el otro de un mes de nacido. Sus planes para su familia es fortalecer la unión, y poder dar buenos valores a sus hijos. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para incrementar el volumen de mercadería variada  para ofertar a sus clientes, a si como atraer a más clientes para tener una estructura sólida con el negocio. Que afuturo beneficie a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon sells basic grains. cosmetics and soft drinks with his mom. He is 24 years old and lives in the Pilar district of the city of Managua. He has been selling since he was 15 years old. He helps his parents and his mom helped him when he was starting out so he could earn his own income and be able to provide for his family. His wife has two children: a four-year-old and a one-month-old. His plans for his family are to strengthen their unity and to be able to raise his children with good values. This loan is to increase the volume and assortment of merchandise to offer to his customers, which will attract more customers and let him have a solid basis for his business. This will benefit his family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cosmetics and other prodcuts to build up inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and married with three children. Mary sells drinks, juice, and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona P., 26, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the pancake and pork buns business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about US$104).  SPBD loans are Mona’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used only on her business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, sugar, onions, salt and yeast

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза - молодая девушка 28 лет. Не замужем. Занимается продажей женской обуви, платков и женской одежды. Наргиза закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром примерно два раза в неделю или когда в этом есть необходимость. Она торгует на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Наргиза старается самостоятельно сформировать свой бизнес. Она помогает родителям. Свой новый займ она потратит на закупку летней партии товара.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a young woman of 28. She is single, and sells women's shoes, shawls and clothing. Nargiza purchases her goods at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She goes on a buying trip approximately twice a week, or whenever necessary. She trades at the Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. Nargiza is trying to develop the business independent of her parents, whom she assists. She will spend her new loan on the purchase of a batch of goods for summer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, shawls and women's clothing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. is a 43-year-old divorced mother of two kids who are both still in school.  She lives with her family in Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. For the past six years, Esi has been baking bread and pastries to help take care of her household.  She bakes sugar bread and meat pie and sells them to her customers.  Her customers place their orders in advance and she makes sure it is ready when they come to pick it up.  She also sometimes sells her baked goods by street hawking them herself.  Esi says that the price of ingredients is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market.  Esi needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood.  She said your assistance would be much appreciated.  Esi belongs to a group called St. Peters.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera C. is from the village of DUMAGOC. She is 47 years old. Elvera is married and has 3 school-aged children. Elvera owns & operates a fishing business. She sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elvera has been in this business for 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elvera has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This 2nd loan of PHP 7000 will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Her business financially supports the immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. All are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Martha is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning to evening. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Martha buys her goods from Kumasi and has been in business for five years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Davy S. is the group leader of six members who all live in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a 30-year-old housewife who takes care her four children. Two of her kids are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Mrs. Davy S.'s husband, Mr. Suon Sokha, is a car repairman who needs more materials to work effectively. Thus, Mrs. Davy S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. They hope to increase income and improve his work with this loan.  

One member in this loan group has an end-of-term loan while the rest have monthly payment loans. No members are required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more car materials for her husband's work.

loans.name: Hadiango

texts.fr: Hadiango B. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle achète des moutons qu’elle revend dans sa localité et aux environs. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hadiango B., age 36, is married and the mother of 4 children. She buys sheep that she resells in her village and in the surroundings. Her goal is to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell sheep

loans.name: Joses

texts.en:
Joses M. is a single young man who is 25 years old. He lives in Uthiru where he operates a video shop. He sells and rents video tapes, DVDs and CDs. 

Joses was introduced to KADET by his friends. He had never borrowed elsewhere. This will be his sixth loan and his repayment history has been good for all the previous loans. His business is unique because there are no similar ones in the area. Therefore, he stands a high chance of succeeding. 

He plans to spend approximately Ksh 50,000 to purchase a new motorbike, and use the balance of Ksh 30,000 to diversify his video library collection. The motorbike business is a new venture in the area and, because not many people have ventured into it and because the services are needed in the area, it is a very promising pursuit.

loans.use: Buying another motorbike for his new transport business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El Sr Oscar Z. es un cliente nuevo que llego a nuestra institucion por recomendación de una buena clienta . El Sr Oscar es dueño de una vagoneta, ahora el necesita el credito para comprar llantas nuevas , El Sr Oscar Nacio  en santa Cruz al igual que su esposa la Sra Gabriela con la cual tiene 2 hijos,  Actualmente  viven en la casa que le dejo su madre al irse a España.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Z. is a new client that came to our institution through the recommendation of a good client. Oscar is the owner of a taxi and needs the loan to buy new tires. Oscar was born in Santa Cruz like his wife Gabriela, with whom he has two children. They currently live in the house that his mother left him when she moved to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four tires for taxi

loans.name: Malap Group

texts.en:
This is Adama K., Sallay K., Fatmata K., Rugiatu K. and Sallay K. . They named their group Malap. These entrepreneurs have gained access to several loans from SMT/Kiva.  Previous loans have had meaningful impacts into the lives of these entrepreneurs. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Having successfully repaid that loan, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000.00 for each to enable them further strengthen their businesses.

Adama K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Adama is thirty-three years of age. She was born in a village called M’Boleh, about four miles from Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a carpenter and they have six children who are attending schools. Adama sells market food -- rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil. She also sells cigarettes, soft and hard drinks and clothes.  With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more items to add to her current stock of goods. Adama has been in this business for more than twelve years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Santos Alberto G. Sánchez  tiene la edad de 63 años habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos,  ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene siete hijos ya todo independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que a pesar de su edad no ha logrado terminar de construir su vivienda. Don Santo desde hace 35 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ya que sus padres le heredaron para que trabajara las tierras junto a sus hijos, durante este tiempo la mayor afectación que se le presenta es la variación de precio de piña ya que hay temporadas que se logra vender muy bajo. Agradece a Afodenic por las oportunidades de crédito y asistencia técnica lo cual ha mejorado sus cultivos y ha establecido una manzana más de piña y ½ de pitahayas .Pero esto lo logro gracias a los intereses bajos. Con este préstamo invertirá en fertilizantes necesarios para mejorar la siembra
texts.en:
Santos Alberto G. Sánchez is 63 years old and lives in the neighbourhood San José de los Ríos, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, together with his wife who works as a shopkeeper to support him with home expenses. They have seven children who are all independent. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions, because in spite of his age Santo has not finished building his house. For 35 years Santo has worked in agriculture after being left an inheritance by his parents to work the land with his children. During this time the greatest problem he has experienced is the variation in the price of pineapple as there have been seasons where his sales have been very low. He gives thanks to Afodenic for the opportunity of the loans he has previously taken out and technical assistance which he has used to improve his crops and establish another block of pineapples and half a block of pitahayas. However he only managed to do this because of the low interest he paid. With this current loan he will invest in the necessary fertilizers to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to add to crops

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela C. D. G. resiD. en Sacacoyo en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Estela D. 16 años D. edad y Lidia D. 13 años D. edad. Blanca lleva once años D. administrar y trabajar diariamente en su negocio su comedor ubicado en la carretera que conduce a Sonsonate que lleva por nombre “Comedor Estelita”, Blanca goza D. una clientela muy estable, pero últimamente la producción D. su comedor no ha alcanzado con la demanda D. clientes que vistan el lugar, es por ello que solicita D. un crédito para comprar cereales, verduras y otros insumos para la cocina.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela C. D. G. lives in Sacacoyo in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and her two daughters, 16-year-old Estela and 12-year-old Lidia. Blanca has been working daily for 11 years in her restaurant business which is located on the freeway o the way to Sonsonate. It is called Estelita Restaurant, and Blanca has a stable clientele. However, recently her restaurant's production has not been able to match the clients' high demand, and she wants to buy grains, vegetables and other ingredients for the kitchen with the the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to increase production

loans.name: Kathy Elizabeth

texts.en: Kathy dreams of building up her business so that she can help her son build his own business. She sells a variety of merchandise: mostly clothing, cosmetics and footwear. Senora Kathy is a very capable client and businesswoman; she will use this loan of 7,700 córdobas to increase her inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Kathy is 52 years old, married and has a 15-year-old son in high school. Her association with Fundacíon León 2000 has helped build her business and increase her income.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda S. is from the village of Dawo. She is 47 years old. Rosenda is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosenda owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to cover the education expenditures of her child.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Akossiwa Nyawodo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 01 enfant, son époux est un transitaire, pour apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion de son foyer, elle a commencé depuis 2006 le commerce de pagnes et de tissus, ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle veut l’agrandir raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat d’une trentaine de pagnes Hi Target et 15 pagnes de marques Phoenix.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child.  Her husband is a shipping expediter.  To do her financial share in managing the home, she started a business in 2006 selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and fabrics.  This business is successful for her.  She wants to expand it.  This is why she's requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy about 30 Hi-Target pagnes and 15 Phoenix-brand pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying quality "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano R. R. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su madre. El posee una carpintería en su propia casa, negocio en el cual trabaja por encargos y así mismo realiza trabajos por su propia cuenta para poder ponerlos en venta. Feliciano solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más madera para la elaboración de su trabajo. El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el cual goza de muy buena reputación y es por esta razón por la cual el cuenta con mucho clientes.
texts.en:
Feliciano R. R. is 45 years old, he lives in the department of Ahuachapán with his mother. He has a wood shop in his house, he takes on commissions or builds his own pieces of furniture and sells them. Feliciano asked for a loan to be able to buy more wood so that he can continue working. He is a very hard working and responsible person and he has a very good reputation and because of this he has a lot of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B., 48, is doing all that she can so that all of her family's daily needs are provided for. Married to Elmer B., a car mechanic, they are blessed with eight children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been busy managing her own variety store for five years.

Teresa has been a regular member of the Kiva field partner, Center for Community Transformation* (CCT), for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times through the CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to add stock to her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of about $200 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for an 8,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying prime commodity products.

She dreams that her store could eventually become a mini-grocery and prays for a peaceful and blessed family life. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy prime commodity products like shampoos, laundry detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes R. R., vive en el Barrio Waspan Norte tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida el cual es carretonero del Mercado oriental, tiene una hija la cual le apoya incondicionalmente en el negocio, ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras a las orillas del mar  en una camioneta prestada, desea que le apoyen con este crédito pudiéndose comprar una camioneta debido a que se le han presentado problemas con el dueño del móvil por tal razón decidió comprarse una propia que le permita una mayor movilidad y decisión, esto le aseguraría un aumento en la ventas garantizándole una mejora en sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Mercedes R. R. lives in the neighbourhood of Waspan Norte. She is 41 years old and lives with her life partner who is a driver at the Oriental Market. She has a daughter who is a wonderful help in her business selling fruit and vegetables on the seashore from a rented pickup. Juana wants a loan so that she can buy a small pickup. She has had problems with the owner of the rented vehicle and so has decided to buy her own. It will give her greater mobility and decision-making capacity, ensuring more sales and guaranteeing an improvement in her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a pick up truck

loans.name: John

texts.en: John does photography in Nairobi.  He has been running this business for the past thirteen years.  He is 45 years old, married with three children in school.  He also has a tailoring shop which his wife runs.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  He requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy a sewing machine and to increase their stock of fabric.  He hopes to buy a piece of land and develop it in the future.  He dreams of having his own studio and a residential house.  He describes himself as focused, hard-working and God-fearing.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and increase stock of fabric

loans.name: Viema

texts.en:
Viema L. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Viema is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living Viema operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Viema has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Viema joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Viema successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Viema is requesting her fifth loan from HSPFI, for 17000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: K. is a 32-year-old God-fearing man. He runs a cafeteria where he sells food and drinks to his neighbors.  He has two employees to assist him in the business.  He also keeps animals to earn extra profits. He dreams of building his own hotel in the future. He has requested a loan of kes 30,000 to purchase flour, sugar, soda and other food stuff in the cafeteria.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey F. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon Bukidnon. He is 22 years old. Rey is single. To make a living, Rey owns & operates a service-based business providing transport services to local community members. Rey has been a "habal-habal" driver for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transport service.

loans.name: Isha Allah Group

texts.en:
M. Lawuratu is also a wife and the mother of three children who are ten, nine, and two years old. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. Her husband is also hard-working.
