She wants to buy peanuts to transform into peanut butter to sell. Her income will enable her to help cover family expenses. Tiguida is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Lilliam Haydee

texts.es: Lilliam Haydee  T. tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Los Meléndez, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Esta señora habita con su esposo Manuel Rivera Vilchez, este señor le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, se desempeña como personal encargado de servicio al cliente en una empresa de Managua; ellos tienen a cargo a dos hijos que estudian actualmente en primaria , los sueños de doña Lilliam es darle una condición de vida mejor a sus pequeños ya que ha pasado muchas dificultades para poder logra lo que hoy en día tienen , esta señora es comerciante tiene una pulpería  ubicada en su casa , y solicita el apoyo del crédito para aumentar su inventario ya que quiere lograr tener una miscelánea en el futuro
texts.en:
Lilliam Haydee T. is 33 years old and lives in the Los Meléndez neighborhood of Ticuantepe city. She lives with her husband Manuel Rivera Vilchez, and he helps her with the household expenses. She works as a personal courier for a business in Managua. They have two children who are in primary school. Lilliam dreams of providing a better standard of living to her little ones as they have overcome many difficulties to be able to have what they have today. This woman has a small grocery store located in her home, and she is asking for a loan to increase her inventory as she wants to have a general store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning and personal use products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, vive con 2 de sus 6 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, desde muy joven ha disfrutado de vivir en el campo y respirar aire puro, por lo que decidió establecer su hogar y criar ahí a sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, hoy solo vive con los 2 menores que la ayudan también en cuidar sus tierras de cultivo, siembra papa y maíz, también alfalfa, la cual le servirá para venderla en el mercado y alimentar a sus animales, tiene dos terrenos, en uno de ellos siembra y el otro lo hace descansar por varios meses para que la tierra recupere sus nutrientes y de una buena producción cuando se vuelva a sembrar, es así que ella trabaja, y también con sus animales, principalmente con su vaca, la lleva  a zonas lejanas para pastearla a parte de la alfalfa que le da de comer.  Carmen trabaja para seguir manteniendo a sus 2 últimos hijos, que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Solicita este préstamo para su próxima campaña de siembra en la tierra de cultivo que se muestra en la fotografía, desea comprar sacos de abono, semilla y alquilar tractor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old. She lives with two of her 6 children. For more than 15 years now, she has made a living in agriculture and livestock. She has enjoyed living in the countryside and breathing clean air since she was very young. This is why she decided to make her home there and raise her six children. Today, she only lives with her two youngest who also help her take care of the farm. She plants potato, corn, and alfalfa which she sells at the market, and also uses to feed her livestock. She owns two properties; in one of them she plants while the other rests for several months so that the earth recovers its nutrients and can yield a good crop once it is cultivated again. This is how she works; she also works with her livestock, especially her cow, which she takes to far off pastures to feed in addition to the alfalfa she gives her to eat. Carmen works to continue to support her two youngest children, who are the reason for her great efforts. She asks for this loan for her next crop; she wishes to purchase fertilizer, seed and rent a tractor.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her next crop

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sr. Dominga de 52 años de edad, habitante del memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Madre soltera tiene cuatros lindos hijos de 9, 11, 14 y 17 años todos  estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Trabaja en su negocio de venta de mariscos desde hace 20 años en un de los mercados de la cuidad. Como  planes tiene vender variados productos como: frutas, carne, pescado. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra cumplir con sus planes  de crecer como pequeño negocio y generar mayores ventas con sus nuevos productos. También aumentaría sus ingresos y cumplirá con la remodelación de su casa para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida y seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. A single mother, she has four beautiful children aged 9, 11, 14, and 17 years, all of whom attend a school in the capital. She has worked selling seafood in one of the city markets for the past 20 years. She has plans to sell a variety of products such as fruit, meat, and fish. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic she will be able to accomplish her plans to expand her small business and earn more money from her new products. She will also increase her revenue and finish renovating her home to make it safer and give her children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seafood, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida M. is thirty years old. She is a married woman with three children who are all currently in the basic school.

Rashida has been trading since her infancy with her mother. She went into business right after completing elementary school. Rashida trades cereals such as maize and groundnuts, along with beans and other food items. She buys these foods directly from the farmers at relatively low prices and sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also treks some of her goods to nearby markets to sell. Rashida says she wants to use this loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a number of customers.

Rashida belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cereals like maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Hobly N’Dokpo

texts.fr: Agé de 57 ans, Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Couturier de formation, il est très dynamique au travail. Afin de s’acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre et mieux équiper son atelier, il sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. is 57 years old, married and father of eight children. Trained as a tailor, he is very dynamic in his work. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new sewing machines and better equip his workshop. This will allow Mr. A. to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and work equipment

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 31 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa. Ghada has owned a grocery store for five years. She is an active women, who also sells clothes and flowers. She has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fish because she wants to start a new business. 
This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time.
Her previous loans helped her diversify her merchandise and improve her business. Her clients are people from her region.

loans.use: Ghada will use the loan to purchase fish because she wants to start a new business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana M. is 42 years old. She is married and has six children. Currently three are in school while the remaining three have completed junior high school. Her husband works with a rubber manufacturing company. The family lives together in a rented apartment in the community.

Diana loves selling goods, the business through which she earns a living.  She has been selling yams for four years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy yams from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Diana belongs to the village bank called ‘Adom Akyede’ meaning the Gift of Grace. She is grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS800 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My name is Parveen A. and I am a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years.  I am an uneducated lady because I belong to a poor family and my parents were not in a position to send me to school. My husband died at the age of 60 of a heart attack.  I am a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters.  My eldest son drives an ox cart for delivering items (crops, fertilizer) from one place to another and my younger son is a loader by profession.  My daughters help me in my thread chain making business.  We collect the orders from the goldsmiths because they used the thread chain to tie up jewelry.  We make 12 dozen thread chains in one week and earn good income.  I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying for a loan to buy an ox for my younger son so that he will be able to do his loading work easily.

loans.use: Buy an ox for son's loading business.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka S., 45, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public five days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $83). SPBD loans are Eka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, knives, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares A. lives in Gaza city in Palestine. He is 32 years old, married, and has seven children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding which is the only source of income for Fares and his family. He believes such a business will provide his children a better life and the opportunity for a good education. He has applied for this loan to purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.use: purchase more sheep and fodder

loans.name: Akpenamawu

texts.fr: Akpenamawu T. est responsable d’une boutique de prêt-à-porter à Wome. Agé de 37 ans, il est mariée et père d’un enfant. Akpenamawu est un bon gestionnaire d’entreprise car il a considérablement augmenté ses recettes en ces derniers temps. Il est bien organisé et très rigoureux. Il espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise afin  répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Il augmentera par la même occasion ses revenus qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akpenamawu T. is the owner of a clothing store in Wome. He is 37 years old, married and the father of a child. Akpenamawu is a good business manager, he has considerably increased his business revenue recently. He is well organized and very thorough. He hopes to use this credit to increase the size of his business to meet customer demand. He plans to use the increased revenue from his growing business to support his family.

Translated from French by Ryan Jones, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Grow his clothing business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 47 years old and married with five children. She sells tailoring materials like zippers, landings, etc.  She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells drinks and juice in her shop. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. Justina is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun C., aged 39, is a builder who often travels long distances to find work at a building site. He typically earns an income of US $3.50 per day to cover his family’s expenses. He has to work hard for many hours to ensure a good quality of life for his family. His wife is unemployed, but she is responsible for any household tasks.

They are blessed with four children, two of whom are students, and the rest are employed with reasonable wages. C. plans to purchase a motorbike to operate an additional business of providing transportation services to generate more income, so he really wants to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. One is schooling and her last-born is breastfeeding. She is a petty trader and trades in salt and bags of rice. She supplies them to food vendors, among others. She travels to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. She buys few bags of salt and rice because she does not have enough money to buy more. This makes her travel frequently to Kumasi, because her capital is not sufficient to buy in bulk.

Philomena spoke to her husband and to some family members for financial assistance but to no avail. She is requesting the loan to buy bulk supplies of salt and bags of rice; this, she believes, will reduce the frequency of travel. She dreams of saving more to cater for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of salt

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vỳ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1958. ( ID number: 010117130033). She lives in Xom Trong, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and her son. She has three children. Her First son and girl were married. Present, she and her husband have to raise a son. They have a store in the market. They sell clothes. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 vnd. This time, she wants to borrow 4.578.000 vnd ( or 265 USD) to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.use: to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie N. is from the village of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Jovie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovie makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Jovie just started this business.

In 2009, Jovie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jovie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
'Success' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Emmanuel S., 31 years old, a high school graduate, married with 3 children aged 3 months-3 years; the older ones are still in nursery (academically). Emmanuel also cares for 2 brothers. He lives and sells on Lynch Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. This community was destroyed by the civil war, so people live in old and burnt houses.

 Emmanuel’s business is brick making. He molds bricks and sells them retail to those that are into renovation, since Lynch street was destroyed by the civil war. 

After making bricks during the daytime, Emmanuel’s night business is operating his little tea shop. He also serves as a photographer to the residents of Lynch Street. Emmanuel started as a brick contractor and raised some money which he used to start up his own business and he has been working at this business for 9 years. He always has goods on hand and sells at an affordable price, so him has a lot of customers.

Emmanuel’s main difficulty is during the rainy season when the rain damages his bricks because he does not have a shelter. Emmanuel needs this loan to purchase more cement in order to produce more bricks that can serve his customers and also to build a shelter to work under and that can also protect his bricks. He hopes to have a big business, if possible a company in the future.

Emmanuel dreams of having access to funds that can help other people through his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement to produce more bricks and also build a shelter

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj T. is a 62-year-old widower. He currently lives alone in Arhangai, one of the central cities in Mongolia.

Dagvadorj owns an old truck that he uses for his business. He mostly travels to different parts of the province and sells various household products to families in the countryside. He has been in the drive-and-retail business since 2001 and has grown this business into a main source of his income.

Since the start, Dagvadorj has been quite successful and his capital has increased from 220,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 800,000 MNT. He hopes to expand his business and would like to open a small store in the most demanded area of the province.

Dagvadorj requests a loan to fix his truck and purchase some household products to sell.

loans.use: To fix his truck and purchase some household products to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora Maritza C. tiene 49 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos, dos menores y uno que está estudiando en la universidad. La señora Maritza se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, juguetes y zapatos usados. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cobertores, sabanas, colchas y mosquiteros para la época que se acerca, ya que desea aprovechas los precios bajos de estas fechas. Es importante mencionar, que la señora además trabaja como enfermera en el hospital, y también allí ofrece sus mercancías a sus compañeros de trabajo. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza C. is 49 years old, is married with three children -- two young children and one who is studying at a university. Mrs. Maritza sells general merchandise, primarily clothing, toys and used shoes. 21 years ago when she started her business, she began with a small amount of capital and was saving little by little until she had enough clients. The loan will be invested in the purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets during the upcoming season because she wants to take advantage of the low prices during this time. It is important to mention that the lady also works as a nurse in the hospital, and there she sells her merchandise to her fellow workers. Her goal is to have a variety store that can be maintained by members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets for sale

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pedro está ubicado en la parroquia Victoria del Portete  al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, la parroquia lleva este nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, sus fiestas patronales se celebran en el mes de Octubre donde se  realizan diferentes actividades como la quema de castillos, juegos pirotécnicos, concursos de danza y música folklórica, su gente es alegre y siempre piensa en surgir personal y económicamente con sus familias.

La señora María  D. vive en Zhizho una comunidad que pertenece  a la Parroquia Victoria del Portete; ella  tiene 45 años de edad se encuentra casada y tiene siete  hijos de 24, 18, 17, 14, 12, 9, 6 años, sus hijos primero, tercero y cuarto  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos de la  casa, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio Miguel Moreno, mientras que sus últimos hijos estudian en la escuela San Joaquín y su esposo trabaja como carpintero;  la casa en la que habitan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de toda la familia.

María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y comparte con otras actividades como la costura y bordados desde hace diez meses y también a la cría de pollos y cuyes  que son tanto para  el consumo de su hogar  y para la venta cuando se presenta una  necesidad  económica.

Nuestra socia lleva un año y medio trabajando con la fundación y nos asegura que los créditos le han ayudado para mantener su hogar y negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más animalitos como pollos y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estar estable emocional y económicamente.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank is located in the parish of Victoria del Portete south of the city of Cuenca. The parish has this name in honor of the battle that occurred on its countryside. Its patron celebrations are held in October, with fireworks displays, dance competitions, and folklore music. The people are very happy and always think about moving ahead personally and economically with their families. Mrs. María D. lives in Zhizho, a community that belongs to Victoria del Portete Parish. María is 45 years-old, married, and has seven children, ages 6, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, and 24. Her first three sons work and help her out with the household costs. Her daughter, the second oldest, studies in Miguel Moreno high school, while her youngest children study at San Joaquín elementary school and her husband works as a carpenter. They own the house they live in, thanks to the effort and work of the whole family. María takes care of household chores and began with other activities such as sewing and embroidery ten months ago. She also works raising chickens and guinea pigs, which are enough to provide for her home and can also be sold in times of economic need. Our member has been working for a year and a half for the foundation and she assures us that previous loans have helped her maintain her home and business. With the new loan funds from ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more young animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, to increase her stock. Her dream is to see her children emotionally and economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and guinea pigs to increase livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. The demands for her used clothes is high because there are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. 

This is the high season for Elizabeth's business, and she hopes to make more profits during and after this season. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a printer. She is a focused, hard worker. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Azalia Graciela

texts.es:
la sra. Azalia Graciela Z. tiene una pulperia desde hace 1 año la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería y Variedades  "AZALIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos dependen su matrimonio, 3 estudian en la secundaria
y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli. 
La  Sra Azalia es una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superacion ya que es una madre soltera y como madre, quiere dar todo lo mejor para sus hijos para que ellos se preparen y sean personas de bien en su vida. 
Su negocio le genera los recursos finanacieros para cumplir con las obligaciones en el hogar. Gracias a este credito el negocio de ella crecera un poco mas.
texts.en:
Señora Azalia Graciela Z. has had a convenience store for 1 year, which she operates under the name of "AZALIA Store and Varieties". Her business is located in her home. She is married and the mother of 4 children, all dependant on her. Three of her children attend secondary and primary schools of the city of Danli. Señora Azalia is a very enterprising woman who wants to improve herself, since she is now a single mother. As a mother, she wants to give the best to her children so that they will be prepared to be successful in their life. Her business provides her with the financial resources to meet the household obligations. Thanks to this loan seh will be able to grow her business a little more.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk products, juice, canned good, churros, bread, crackers, beans, butter, cheese, fat, margarine, oil, rice, coffee, toothpaste, toilet paper, soup, etc for resale in her convenience store.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ANTONIO tiene 67 años es casado y tiene tres hijos que son independientes. El socio es chofer, tiene su propio automóvil para hacer el servicio de transporte turístico. EL socio hace el servicio por todo el Valle Sagrado de los Incas pues las agencias de viajes turísticos son los que solicitan sus servicios. Ya son varios años que hace el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al carro y desea adquirir repuestos para el carro que son muy importantes para su mejor funcionamiento. El socio nos cuenta que el principal medio para el sostén económico familiar es el carro por lo tanto tiene que estar operativo todos los días.
      
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto el socio aparece acompañado de su nieta.
texts.en:
Antonio is 67 years old, married, and has 3 children who are independent. He is a driver; he has his own automobile that he uses to provide transport services for tourists. He conducts his business throughout the Valle Sagrado de los Incas (Sacred Valley of the Incas) for the tourism agencies that seek his services. He has been providing this service for a number of years now, and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work. He is an enterprising father who works hard to advance his family economically in spite of the difficulties of life. He needs a loan in order to carry out maintenance work on his car, and he also wishes to buy spare parts for the car that are very important to keep it running optimally. Antonio tells us that this car is the principal means through which he sustains his family economically, so he has to make sure that it is operating every day. He belongs to the communal bank "Huayna CCAPAC," which is part of the Arariwa Association in the province and department (region) of Cusco. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule. In the photograph, he is accompanied by his granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his automobile.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: N. Rachael is a 38-year-old businesswoman and mother of four children. For the past two years she has run a clothes shop in Abaita Ababiri trading centre. Rachael is using her loan to purchase more stock to sell in her shop. Her intentions are to work very hard to obtain a plot of land on which to build rental houses for monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her clothes shop

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 36 años de edad es casada tine 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, su conyugue es profesor de educacion fisica, cuentan con casa propia de material noble el cual recien esta en construccion. La Sra. Maria cuenta con negocio de la venta de  productos de piñateria, vta de abarrotes,  alquiler de sillas para eventos. Ella se inicio hace 10 años, en este negocio. La Sra. Maria es una persona muy activa con muchas metas y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener otro negocio mas y tener su casa ya construida.Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo para invertir en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She is married and has two children who are 15 and 13 years old. Her spouse is a physical education teacher. They have their own brick home, which was recently built. Maria has a business selling piñata products, groceries and renting chairs for events. She began this business ten years ago. Maria is an active person with many goals and objectives. One of these is to be able to have another business and own her existing house. With the money she is requesting, she will invest in her business (as working capital).

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implementation of her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is the 39-year-old married mother of two children. She lives with her family in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa where she sells secondhand clothes. Mercy's secondhand clothes business has been in operation for five years and has been doing well.

Mercy joined KADET recently and is taking out her first loan. She intends to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes for reselling. Her main customers are the area residents of Mikoroshoni.

In the future Mercy hopes to open a secondhand store in a more urban area to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng Vouen, 32, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Takeo province. He works to collect palm juice and refine it to palm sugar. On average, he makes $4 a day. His wife has a business selling desserts in the afternoon and porridge in the morning from her home. With this business, she is able to make $3 per day. 

Seng Vouen would like to create a new business so that his family can get more income to improve their standard of living. He will take this money to raise cows and resell them.

loans.use: Raise cows

loans.name: Kamalova Olmas` Group

texts.en:
Olmas is a 63-year-old woman. She lives in Nookat with her family. She is married with 9 children, although only one daughter lives with her. The other 8 live separately. Her husband is a pensioner. Three of her children have a common business cultivating sunflowers. This loan will be used to buy seeds and to rent agricultural land. Her seasonal income is about 3,000 dollars. She has more than 2 hectares of land. 

Gulzada, 46, is a widow with 8 children. Five young children live with our client. She is involved in a livestock trade business. She began this business with just 2 sheep. At the present time she has 20 sheep, 1 horse, 2 cows and 1 calf. This loan will be used to buy a few sheep to sell later. 

Mayranhon is 63 years old. She is married and has 7 children. Most of her children are working in Russia. Her husband is a pensioner. They cultivate wheat. This year they are planning to sow wheat in 7 hectares of land. Loan will be used for fertilizers and seeds. 

Inoyat is a widow. She is a mother of 8 children: 4 daughters and 4 sons. All daughters are married. She has land where she cultivates wheat. This loan will be used to buy seeds. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah D. P. is from the village of P-15, Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 49 years old. Leah is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, lotion, cologne and others in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leah is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20-year-old young woman from Ramallah. Her family runs a carpentry workshop where they produce furniture, wooden structures, cupboards, tables, chairs, etc. Since the workshop is the only source of income for the family, Wisam took the second loan from FATEN to purchase a wood-cutting band saw to replace the old one.

Wisam tells us that her father started the project 12 years ago, and he established an excellent reputation for his great work quality and ability to meet deadlines, which is reflected in the workshop's number of customers. She hopes that by purchasing the band saw, she will help her father do his work faster and more efficiently, and improve the family's financial situation. 

Wisam's father appears in the picture above in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting band saw

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Alfred is a married father of six children, aged 14 to 27 years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been farming for 10 years and mainly depends on the income from the maize, vegetables, and beans that he sells to the local market to cater for his family's needs.

Alfred recently completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES, which he used to set up his poultry project. He has requested this loan from Juhudi for 40,000 KES to expand his poultry project. His biggest challenge in this business has been the fluctuation in the market price of their produce and the high cost of drugs and poultry feed. He believes that this loan will help him expand his project, hence increasing his overall produce, which will earn him more income and enable him to educate his children. In the future he hopes to set up a store that will be a major supplier of eggs in the area.

He says that he is "grateful to Juhudi for empowering him economically."

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tables, chairs

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas: Grupo 5 Group

texts.en:
Yessica is the coordinator of her group, Renovacion Las Aguilas: Grupo 5 (Renewal: The Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, in the center of the country in an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Yessica is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small ambulatory clothing-sales business. She will use the profits to expand her business and work towards establishing a small store in a fixed location. She hopes this will generate better living conditions for herself and her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, perfume, accessories, undergarments and other articles to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio (55) y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente junto a su esposo ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos unos de los más productivos de su poblado. Todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta las ciudades de Pichanaki y La Merced. Y con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción, y así planea que obtendrá mayores ganancias.Es el  tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, y  en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra.Victoria tiene planeado invertir  los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria, 46, lives in her own house with her husband Antonio (55) and their two small children, to whom she wants to give a better quality of life. Working hard with her husband, she has managed to make her crops some of the most productive in their town. Every morning, no matter what the weather is like, they go out to work their fields, since they know that the income they will receive from the sale of their crops depends on it. What Victoria likes most about her work is working the fields. She has been doing this work for 30 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the cities of Pichanaki and La Merced. And with time, she wants to buy more land to increase her production, and in this way she plans to have more earnings. This is the third loan that Victoria has had with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual with her payments. In her communal bank, she is a very respected member due to the responsibility she demonstrates. Victoria plans to invest the three thousand new soles she is asking for in the purchase of more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 42-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He is married and has four children.

Fadi has been working in the business of stone-cladding since 1986. He has many years of experience and is proud of that. Over the years, he has built a good reputation in his region.

For the second time, Fadi has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. With his loan, he plans to purchase iron tools for his work. His previous loan allowed him to improve his work. His clients can be anyone from his region.

Fadi hopes, in the future, to keep on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron tools for his work

loans.name: Amouhouè Laurent

texts.fr: A. Amouhouè Laurent est né le 02 Septembre 1972 et vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Laurent est marié à ABLESSI Appoline, une couturière, et est père de trois enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Laurent vit ensemble avec sa famille et assure leurs différentes charges, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Laurent est un couturier, ayant son atelier à son domicile. Laurent désire confectionner un nombre considérable de chemises pour le vendre et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Compte tenu du peu de ressources financières dont il dispose, Laurent sollicite un premier prêt de ALIDé, ce qui lui permettra d'atteindre son objectif.
texts.en:
Amouhouè Laurent A. was born on September 2, 1972 and since his birth has lived in the Agbalilamè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Laurent is married to Appoline ABLESSI, a dressmaker, and is the father of three children, some of whom attend school. Laurent lives together with his family and provides for their various expenses, thanks to the income he obtains from his business. Laurent is a dressmaker with a workshop in his home. He would like to make a large number of shirts to sell and to increase his sales. Given the few financial resources at his disposal, Laurent is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, which will enable him to reach his goal.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric for shirts.

loans.name: Djamadjigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygamiques, les six membres du groupe Djamadjigui 1 ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent b toutes dans le village de Moudjirila dans la commune urbaine de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies à cultiver, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Le mil, le fonio, l’arachide et le riz seront cultivés par les membres du groupe.
Madame Alimata   Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 25kg de semence d’arachide, 3 bidons d’herbicide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage  dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles au grand marché de Ségou, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes et des femmes du village. 
Elle compte produire 15 sacs d’arachide et 10 sacs de mil avec sa superficie de culture de 2 hectares. Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu afin de prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants et des condiments du foyer. 
Madame Alimata   Traoré espère réaliser 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djamadjigui 1 group, married and living for the most part in large polygamous families, are on the average 42 years of age and have 4 children. They all live in the village of Moudjirila in the township of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as relatives by blood or marriage or as neighbors. In order increase their workable land, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second agricultural loan. The group members will cultivate millet, fonio [ a millet species common to West Africa], peanuts and rice. Mrs. Alimata Traoré plans to use her loan to purchase 3 bags of complex fertilizers, 25 kg [55 lbs] of peanut seed, 3 cans of herbicide and to recruit manual laborers for working and weeding the fields. She purchases agricultural inputs at the big market of Ségou and recruits laborers through the local young people’s association and the women’s association. She plans to produce 15 bags of peanuts and 10 bags of millet on her land plot of 2 hectares [about 5 acres]. Part of the produce will be consumed by the family, and the remainder will be sold to provide for the children’s healthcare expenses and household condiments. At the end of the season, Mrs. Alimata Traoré hopes to earn 75,000 West African Francs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing complex fertilizers, peanut seed & herbicides and paying for manual labor

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is the wife of M. I. and they reside in a city called Kasur, in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and dairy businesses. A very vigorous lady, Shahida is involved in the decorative embroidery business. She prepares each dress in  a 15-day time-frame. She gets orders from different boutiques and clothing shops and earns income. She charges them according to the work. For example if she gets an order for a fully embroidered dress then she charges approximately 1500 PKRs for each dress, and if she gets an order for a little embroidery (only on sleeves and on neck) then she charges approximately 400-500 PKRs per dress.  

When she gets big orders from her customers, to complete them in time, her husband helps her with her work. He is also a very talented man who learned to do embroidery from one of the persons living in his community.  

Shahida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her decorative embroidery business. With the loan amount she will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, sketches, needles and cloth in larger quantity. 

The bulk items will help her to fill the larger orders on time with the support of her husband. She is hopeful that she will be able to manage better financial conditions for her house and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery items in bulk

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. Ruth owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like steamed cake in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of more clothes materials and sewing machines

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia a sus 56 años es madre D. 10 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos, puesto que los demás, ya tienen sus familias, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Felicia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, arvejas y maíz, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que arar la tierra, puesto que su esposo falleció hace 11 años y ella tiene que realizar el sembrado y cosechado sola. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas D. papa y arvejas, para la nueva la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Felicia, 56, is the mother of 10 children but only lives with one of them since the rest have their own families.  She lives in her own house and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life.

By working hard Felicia has raised her crops.  She gets up very early every morning to water and care for her potatoes, peas and corn which she subsequently sells in Tarma because that’s where she gets the best prices for her products.

What she likes best about her work is the freedom she enjoys working in the fields.  She has been a farmer for 26 years and considers plowing the fields to be the most difficult part because since her husband died 11 years ago she has to do the planting and harvesting by herself. In time she hopes to make her fields adequate for pea cultivation because that’s what sells best nowadays.  

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is aware that the loan will be of much help for the progress and development of her business so she is more than willing to repay on time.  She is a responsible member of her communal group which makes her very well liked.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more potato and pea seed for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seed.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia G. currently sells clothes and uses a sewing machine to design clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes like bedsheets to sell. G. is 28 years old and married to a business man. She has only two children who both attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more clothes like bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Saidikrom

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Саидикром проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее. Окончил университет Предпринимательства и сервиса. Занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает топлива (бензин и солярка). В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота во время осенних посевов, так как в это время года спрос на его товар увеличится.
texts.en: Saidikrom A. lives in the Farkhor region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He has higher education and graduated from the university of business and service. He is in sales. He mainly sells fuel such as gasoline and diesel. He has been in this business for four years now. He is taking out the loan to increase sales during the fall crop season as during this time the demand for his product increases.

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods during the fall crop season

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L. is from the village of Barangay Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Elena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Elena has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be Elena's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma se dedica a la venta de tortillas y cuajadas. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. Hace más de 35 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una actividad que le gusta mucho pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para realizar las cuajadas para ofrecerlas a sus clientes. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan las tortillas bien calientes para comerlas con sus deliciosas cuajadas, ella se siente muy contenta de ofrecer un buen servicio. El crédito es para la compra de mail, leña cuajada entre otros.
texts.en: Irma sells tortillas and 'cuajada' (a compact, cheese-like product).  She has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and has been in this business for more than 35 years.  It is a business that she enjoys a lot.  Every day she must get up very early to make her 'cuajada' to offer to her customers.   Her customers always request their tortillas nice and warm so that they can eat them with her delicious 'cuajada'.  She feels very happy that she offers a good service.  This loan will be used to buy corn, firewood and 'cuajada', amongst other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita D., from the village of Rizal West San Isidro, is 58 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector directly selling Avon products. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Warlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having  repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 13000 PHP for the same purpose.  Warlita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem Y., age 40, is married with three children, all of whom attend school.

Hem Y. is a domestic rice trader in her community. She always buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill. She then sells her finished rice to others so she can earn an income. Usually Hem Y. generates around $3 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family.

Her husband is a local farmer as well as a cow trader. He earns a profit on average of $2 per day. He shares responsibility with Hem Y. for meeting their family's needs.

This rice harvesting season Hem Y. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice.

loans.name: María Epifania

texts.es:
La Señora Epifania T., es conserje del Instituto Nacional Tecnológico (inatec), desde hace 11 años.
Ella es soltera tiene 2 personas a su cargo los cuales son mayores de 15 años.
Ya ha pagado 5 créditos en CEPRODEL, siendo una persona responsable con sus pagos, agradece a CDEPRODEL porque estos préstamos le permiten mejorar poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Epifania T. has been a janitor at the college named "Instituto Nacional Tecnologico (Inatec)" for the past 11 years.  

She is single and she has 2 individuals in her care, both are over the age of 15. 

She has successfully repaid 5 previous loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). She is a very responsible person with her payments. She is grateful to Ceprodel for these loans. They have permitted her to carry out improvements to her home.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. After having 10 years of experience in the clothing field, she started to sell lingerie from her house in 2004. She contributes to the family income with her husband, who works in a locA. company. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new products to enlarge her business operation and get higher profits.

loans.use: To purchase new products

loans.name: Bevita

texts.en:
Bevita T. is from the village of Mambatangan, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Bevita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Bevita sells bananas and coconuts in the local community. She also makes and sells broomsticks. Bevita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Bevita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bevita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Bevita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell, like bananas and coconuts for copras. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Bevita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Dame  Adjowavi    a  3 enfants et  est   mariée.     Elle  a  54  ans.  Pour   améliorer  les  conditions  de  vie  de  ses  enfants,  elle fait  la vente  de produits  d’alimentation et sodabi une boisson locale du  Togo.  Elle a débuté  son  activité  en  1981 et s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.   Elle  a reçu   4 crédits  qui  ont  été  bien remboursé.   Elle  sollicite   un  prêt  pour  acheter  25 fûts  de sodabi.
texts.en: Adjowavi is a married 54 year old, with three children. In order to improve her standard of living, she sells food products, and sodabi (a locally produced drink from the Togo). She entered this field in 1981 and sources her wares from the large market in Lomé.   She has received four loans which she has paid back successfully, and is seeking a new loan in order to buy 25 containers of sodabi.

loans.use: purchasing containers of sodabi (a locally produced drink)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married to a businessman and they have one child who attends school. Agnes operates a food stall, selling different kinds of foods like cooked beans, chapati, and cooked rice to her neighbors and to her close friends. She has operated a food stall business for the past one year. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her food stall. She needs this purchase to supplement her inventory especially for the foods that are in high demand, such as beans, maize flour, cooking oil and coconuts. These food are eaten on a daily basis in the stall. With this investment she wants to satisfy her clients. She also wants to add to the line of products that she offers to better satisfy the needs of her clients.

Agnes’s objective is to have a strong business that is profitable and that is supported by many clients. She hopes to expand her business to enable her to start another business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of beans, maize flour, cooking oil and coconuts.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn  is 44 years old and married with two children.  One of the children is in school.  Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock for her general store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sardines, sugar, curls etc. 

In the future, Jenelyn  would like to expand her business and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Tranca Sasape del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Gladys se a la crianza de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, pavos y cerdos, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años por eso cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 47-year-old mother who lives with her famly in the Tranca Sasape rural area in Mórrope.  This is an agricultural district located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Gladys raises small animals, especially chicken, turkey and pigs, in a farmyard near her home.  She feeds them natural grain and when they are fully developed sells them to merchants who visit the area.  She has been in the business for six years and has a loyal customer base.

She wants to buy more animals and balanced feed to expand business and increase income.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Choestancia 2 Group

texts.en:
Doña Elida, Doña Maria and Doña Modesta have joined together to form a solidarity group named Choestancia 2. The group leader, Doña Elida, would like to use her portion of the loan to purchase food ingredients and packaged snacks for her food stall. She has been cooking and selling snack foods for over twelve years and would love the opportunity to grow her business and expand the variety of goods that she offers her customers. One snack which Elida prepares is atol, which is a delicious hot corn based beverage which is very common in the highlands.  Doña Elida started making and selling atol when she was 26 years old. 

Elida is 38 years old, is married, and has nine children. Her husband works as a merchant and helps support the family. She would love to run a large eatery one day with many clients and a diverse menu.

The other two members of the Choestancia 2 Group are involved in traditional clothing sales and animal raising. Both will use their portion of the loan to help grow their respective businesses. This is the group´s first loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Josephine works hard to support her family.  She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear clothing.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to renew tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to renew tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 43 ans,  elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Fatoumata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, alors elle s’est intéressée  aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans la vente des bois de chauffe il y a  des décennies.  Madame Fatoumata trouve que cette activité lui procure bien de revenus et que ça marche très bien, puisqu’elle  parvient à vendre un chargement de remorque par semaine.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elle est a son 3eme  prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été correctement payés.   
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter,  2 chargements de bois de chauffe dans un  village de Koutiala et effectue tous les jours sa vente  devant sa porte à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children, Madame Fatoumata is 43 years old. She lives with her spouse and their children in the Koko neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). 

For social reasons, Fatoumata did not have the opportunity to study, so she became interested in business at a young age. After trying several businesses without success, she began selling firewood decades ago. Madame Fatoumata finds that this business makes a good revenue and is going very well, as she is able to sell a trailer-load each week.

To satisfy her clients with more wood and increase the size of her business, she decided to seek assistance from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. She is on her third individual loan, and the two preceding ones were duly repaid.

With this loan she plans to buy two loads of firewood in the village of Koutiala. She sells daily in front of her home, for cash and credit to both men and women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA, which will be used to repay interest on the loan, help with the family's daily expenses, and invest in other income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Silvia Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia vive por la parroquia de Turi, parroquia que es conocida por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y cordiales.
 
La Señora. Silvia es muy joven tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como ebanista, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su abuelita con a quien le hace compañía y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Silvia labora en su negocio propio, ella confeciona delantales, trabaja en su casa y lleva en esta actividad 2 años y labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para seguir con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Silvia lives in the parrish of Turi, which is known for its views of the city. Its people make a living in commerce, raising livestock and agriculture, and are very friendly and cordial. Silvia is a young woman of 23 years old, lives with her partner and has a 2-year-old son. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker. They don't have their own home, so they live with a grandmother, who keeps them company and helps with household expenses. Silvia works at her own business, making aprons at home for the past two years. She works from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. This is her first loan with a community bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. With the loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of fabric to keep moving forward with the business. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Saruul-Erdene

texts.en:
Saruul-Erdene is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His older son is a disabled man who stays home all day. His younger two daughters are in secondary school, while the youngest one is in kindergarten. He manages an auto parts repair business with the help of his wife. His wife is responsible for the financial management part of their business operation. He attributes his business success to his wife's good accounting skills. He started his business 3 years ago after working as a driver and repairer for 22 years at a public transportation office. At first he used to have only tire repair, but then expanded into an auto parts repair business. With his earnings, he has been able to build his own workshop. 

The loan which he received from Xacbank, one of the biggest banks in Mongolia, helped him to expand and stabilize his business operation. Now he is one of the reliable and trusted loan recipients of Xacbank. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I must work hard, because my business earnings are the only source of income for my family. Now I have many regular customers who are happy with our service. I like to think that one can achieve success if he works hard to fulfill his dream." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 38-year-old Mrs. Pok's daily routine in Prey Chor district. Rice is an essential product, vital to Cambodian people. She learned to grow it from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Mr. So, assists her with the farm work as well as providing horse cart services in the marketplace. They have four children, one of whom is employed as a garment factory worker and has a formal salary to contribute to the family's financial expenses. 

Mrs. Pok will be using her loan to help her husband to buy a new horse in place of the old horse which is becoming older and older and cannot support her husband in transportation services well.  She will use any remainder of the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Pok, her husband, and their two young kids appear in the photograph together.

loans.use: to buy a new horse to replace their old horse and also buy insecticides, fertilizers, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm nuts and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric for sewing and a bale of second hand clothes

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él es  un hombre lleno de aspiraciones y muy trabajador, se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano como taxista y/o colectivo, lleva trabajando así por más de 5 años, el Sr. Wilfredo quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida es por ello  que el crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de accesorios para el motor de su auto y darle un mantenimiento en general, para que así el vehículo no sufra ningún desperfecto y pueda seguir laborando en el, tiene un sueño el cual es tener más adelante una casa bonita, grande para él y su familia. El Sr. Wilfredo está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Sr. Wilfredo lives with his wife and children.  He is an ambitious man and very hard-working.  He operates a taxi business, his livelihood for more than 5 years now.  Sr. Wilfredo wants a better quality of life so he has to keep his vehicle in good order.   That's why he is applying for a loan to buy car parts and pay for general vehicle maintenance.  The vehicle has to be in good shape so that he can continue to work.  For the future, he would like to have a nicer house, one big enough for him and his family.  Sr. Wilfredo is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and buy parts for his taxi business.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 23 years old and a rice farmer. He is single but supports his mother and siblings. He has been a farmer for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family and his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will purchase another piece of land. His hopes are to do large scale farming, buy land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
She is a 33-year-old woman who is single and a mother of one child who is below 15 years of age. She lives with her child in a single room below GTTC Nkwen, a quarter in Nkwen, in Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The death of her father is something that makes her very sad each time she thinks of it. Poverty, ill health and suffering are some of the very difficult times she has gone through. She was not able to receive an adequate education due to poverty, which makes her feel very sad.

She is a trader and specializes in the sales of raw food items like beans, gari, and maize. It is from this business that she struggles to feed and provide her family with the basic necessities of life like clothing, food and basic education. She strongly believes that if she increases her stock, she will attract more customers and make more profit. Then she will be able to buy in bulk and sell items like maize to the poultry farmers in her locality. Foodstuffs are in very high demand now that the children are going back to school.

She believes this business will be of help to her community because it will increase the availability of foodstuffs in the market, which will lead to lower prices. She intends to use the profit from her loan to educate her child with other family members who are in need and to help the needy in her community.
    
She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rate on the loans, the installment repayments, and the training she receives from GHAPE before loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase beans, garri, corn and maize

loans.name: John De Jesus

texts.es:
Jhon de Jesús tiene un negocio donde le ofrece a sus clientes mecato y gaseosa, allí tiene una mesas de billar, una cancha de fútbol y una piscina deteriorada.

Su sueño es poder hacer de su negocio un espacio recreativo para la zona y para iniciar quiere restaurar la piscina y las mesas de billar, además así podrá ofrecer mas productos comestibles.

Al iniciar estas nuevas atracciones en su negocio podrá mejorar sus ingresos para poder darle a su hijo recién nacido una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jhon de Jesús has a business selling packed lunches and soda.  In the same location, he also has pool tables, a soccer pitch and a swimming pool which is in a bad state of repair.

Jhon de Jesús' dream is to turn his business into a recreational space for the area.  To start off with, he would like to restore the swimming pool and the pool tables.  He would also like to be able to sell more food products.

By starting to provide these new attractions as part of his business, he will be able to improve his income and provide his newborn son with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to build a swimming pool

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a widowed woman with six children; one still attends school while five graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has owned real-estate houses. Her potential customers are her tenants from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to pay for installation of electricity in her real-estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To pay for installation of electricity in her real-estate houses.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his relatives' yard in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife is a teacher in the public school. His elder two kids go to school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

He started his transportation business in 2002 by buying his own truck. During the summer, he does construction transportation. During winter, he transports coal from a mining site and sells it in the market. He goes to the mining site 3-4 times a month. His profit from the coal business is about 300,000-400,000 MNT. He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to repair his truck and to buy new winter tires.

loans.use: To repair his truck and to buy new winter tires.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
