This borrower is from Iraq. She is 33 years old, married and a mother for four children.

Haifa has been a tailor since 2007. She makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer and she has good experience and is well-known in her area.

Haifa decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to rent a shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: rent a shop for her tailor business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La señora Dolores, es nacida en la ciudad de Yacuiba, Ella se dedica a la producción de pan casero y empanas, y los comercializa en su mismo domicilio y también reparte a diferentes tiendas de su zona se dedica a esta actividad hace 3 años, la Sra. Dolores se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar sus productos,  tiene dos hijos, La señora demuestra ser una persona responsable y trabajadora, ahora el crédito otorgado a la señora es para compra de horno  que le facilitara el trabajo en el horneado de sus  panes y empanadas, el deseo de la Sra. es el de tener una pastelería y poder vender y entregar sus productos a muchos mas clientes.
texts.en: Señora Dolores was born in the city of Yacuiba. She is a baker and makes homemade bread and pies and sells them from her home. She also distributes them to different stores in her area. She has been doing this for 3 years. Sra. Dolores rises in the early hours of the morning to make her products. She has 2 children. Sra. Dolores has proved to be a responsible and hardworking person. With the loan provided, she will buy an oven which will make her job of baking bread and pies easier. Sra. Dolores' wish is to have a pastry shop and be able to sell and distribute her products to many more clients.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Maluki

texts.en:
Maluki is a married man with five school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Maluki has operated a poultry business for the past fifteen years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of starting a business selling goat meat.

With the loan of KES 20,000 he wants to purchase goats for his new business selling goat meat. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for his new business selling goat meat.

loans.name: Abdilat

texts.ru: Абдилат 57-летний фермер, живущий со своей семьей  селе Алике, что на юге Кыргызстана.  Абдилат работал водителем на автобазе, но зарплата не позволяла покрыть расходы семьи, и Абдилат решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Абдилата, начатое с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Доходы от деятельности позволили Абдилату провести ремонт дома и провести свадьбы своих детей. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Абдилат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и баранов. Доходы от кредита Абдилат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины.
texts.en: Abdilat is a 57 year-old farmer, living with his family in the Alike village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Abdilat used to work as a driver at an auto park, but his salary did not allow him to cover his family expenses, so he decided to open his own business of animal husbandry and farming.  Thanks to his persistence and hard work, Abdilat's business that started with 20,000 som (KGS), now brings in about 20,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of dairy and meat products.  Earnings from the business allowed him to make repairs at home and hold weddings for his children.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Abdilat requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase cattle and sheep.  He plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 28 years old.  He is married with five children and owns a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda where he lives.  Ronald is responsible for looking after his family and he desires to educate his children.  He grows tea and has been farming for five years.  His main challenge is the high cost of production and his dream is to venture into mechanized farming.  Ronald is requesting this loan in order to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Madleine

texts.en: Madleine is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and five children who are still attending school. She collaborates with her husband, who has been working in a local school since 1988 in order to enhance their way of living. As for her, she has owned a bookstore for the past ten years. In parallel, she teaches in one of the local schools and has seven years of experience. Today, she’s looking to borrow $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a photocopy machine, stationary, and books for her bookstore. This will definitely develop her business and help her earn superior income. In the future, she plans to focus on one job and better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopy machine, stationary, and books for her bookstore

loans.name: Tamarakhan

texts.ru:
Тамарахан 61 год, разведена. Тамарахан  работала бухгалтером в местном сельском хозяйстве, в данное время на пенсии.  
В поиске дополнительного  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1981 году Тамарахан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, использовав для этого стартовый капитал в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS).   Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день хозяйство Тамарахан приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.    В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Тамарахан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота и кормов. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство и приумножить поголовье скота, сделав, таким образом по ее мнению, наилучшее капиталовложение.
texts.en: Tamarakhan is 61 years old, and divorced. Tamarakhan worked as an accountant at the local collective farm, and is now retired. In 1981, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Tamarakhan started her own business in animal husbandry with a starting capital of 10,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to hard work and perseverance, Tamarakhan's farm now brings in about 5,000 somi per month. To increase her quantity of livestock, Tamarakhan has come to Bitushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to purchase more livestock and forage. This will enable her to expand her farm and increase the quantity of livestock, thus making it, in her view, the best capital investment.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and forage

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
Don Roberto Jose  habitante de colonia Los Laureles, labora en su unidad de produccion realizando actividades agricolas y pecuarias las cuales se convierten en su principal fuente de ingreso, para el bien socioeconomico del nucleo familiar, trabaja en conjunto con su papa en sus diferentes actividades.

Necesita este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de 2 mzs del cultivo de yuca, actividad que le permitira incrementar su produccion de tuberculos, de manera que pueda elevar la rentabilidad para el bien comun de su familia, referencias en su localidad lo consideran como una persona responsable  y de buenas culturas.

loans.use: Cultivo de yuca

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Jorge no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ir de pesca con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas más concurridas y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas y hacer el mantenimiento general de su vehículo, de esta manera tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá atener de más clientes, así pues Jorge seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Jorge is 29 years old and single, and lives in the city of Camana.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire for improvement.  Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and a need to work to pay his expenses he was unable to study for a professional career, although he would have liked to do so.  In his free time he likes to go fishing with his friends and sometimes cook a delicious "lomo saltado" [a Peruvian beef dish] to share with his family.  On his own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Jorge works as a taxi driver providing transportation services.  He works every day starting early in the morning, and can work for about 10 hours.  He is happy doing his work and believes that it is going well for him because he knows the most popular areas and because of the friendly service that he provides to his customers. Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing he will be able to buy tires and do general maintenance on his vehicle.  Thus he will have his work tool in better condition and can serve more customers.  He will then be able to continue working and trying to get ahead, to achieve his great dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
La  dame   Fatou   est  mariée  et   habite  au  Sénégal    depuis  plusieurs   années.   
Elle     évolue   dans   le   secteur   des  services et exerce l’activité de femme de ménage   depuis  bientôt  2 ans. Grâce à son salaire elle supporte les charges de nourriture et de transport pour sa famille. Elle sollicite un  prêt   de   500000 frs  au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre. Ce financement   lui  permettra  d’acquérir des sanitaires   pour    sa   maison.  Son intention est d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.  Son projet dans le futur consiste a équiper sa maison.

loans.use: acheter des sanitaires pour sa maison

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 26 years old and married, with 1 child.  She has operated a retail shop business for 2 years, and will be using the loan to purchase retail goods such as sugar, soap, and tea-leaves to sell.

Winnie hopes this loan will enable her to make more income to provide for the needs of her family.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make additional income, and educate her child up through the university level.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods such as sugar, soap, and tea-leaves to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
My name is Ruth M.. I sell products that are popular in demand. My business is about 4 years old. My clients are from my neighborhood and business is very good because I’m located in front of a public school. My business helps me support my family and I would like in the future to be able to hire other people to improve customer service for my clients. With the profits I would remodel my one room house, support my family and provide good schooling for my children.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ruth M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son de mi localidad y son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en frente de una escuela publica, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría en mi futuro poder darle trabajo a otras personas para una mejor atencion a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mis dos hijas.

loans.use: To buy oil, butter, churros, rice, beans, sugar, corn, coffee, sodas, eggs, juices, toilet paper, feminine pads, poultry, sausages, spices, salt, margarine, candy, cookies, bread, soap, toothpaste.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Mr. M. is 67 years old and in his second loan with PEMCI, but his first with Kiva. Robert is married with sixteen children. Some children are in school, and others are even married.

He is trained in business management and tailoring services by the promise land in Kakamega. His first loan of $150 was used to buy fabrics for his tailoring business. He has been in business since 1968 and has solely depended on his business for sustaining his family.

With the proposed loan from PEMCI of $300, he plans to increase his fabric stock and buy an additional sewing machine. Mr M. is full of life. Even at his age, he looks forward to opening up a local youth training centre in business and tailoring skills.

A staunch Catholic, Mr M. is an active member of his local church and the community. As a senior member of his community he has a lot to share with the young generation. He is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.

loans.use: To boost his tailoring business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
“After a great deal of effort and work, I have finished the construction; only the exterior and interior finishes are left. I will then be able to live there with my family and have a more decent life. I am asking for $1,200.00 to complete the construction.”

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

“Ya termine de construir con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, ya solo me faltan los acabados exteriores e interiores para poder habitar los cuartos con mi familia y tener una vida más digna” Solicito $ 1,200.00 para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: Finish construction

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta A. F. is 59 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives with her brother, 56, and a friend. She owns a convenience store that she started more than 20 years ago. She opens her store every day from 6 am until 8 pm. Her store is connected to her house and located in the entrance. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She sells food products and domestic products, such as brooms, toothpaste, and shampoo.

Sixta buys her merchandise from the market in Carapegua. She is seeking a US$100 loan to increase her inventory at her store. She needs to buy more food snacks for her store. With the loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise in greater quantities at lower prices and increase her profit margins.

loans.use: Purchase food snacks.

loans.name: Ragibe

texts.en:
The lady featured in the photo is A. Ragibe.  She is 30 years old and the mother of three children.  She is from the Sumgayit region and currently lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  She started her business in 2002 when she purchased a small variety of fruits and vegetables.  

With this business she earns little money.  This money is enough for only some of her family's basic needs, and she has difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.
 
In 2005, Ragibe borrowed $400 to expand her business and add to her monthly salary.  With this loan she increased her supply of fruits and vegetables and improved the livelihood of her family.   

Now, she needs a $700 loan.  She wants to lease a selling place in the market.  She believes this will improve her business and, as a result, considerably increase her income.  She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To lease a selling place in the market

loans.name: Raquelina Francisco

texts.pt:
Raquelina is single but lives with a man with whom she has 2 children. Raquelina’s partner is unemployed but gets by doing small jobs and working on the family's farm. Raquelina also works on the farm with her partner. However, she would like to improve her family's life and, in particular, guarantee schooling for her children. For this reason she decided to enter the loan program this year. If the business does well, she plans to make improvements on her house together with her husband. In order to cover the household expenses, Raquelina sometimes sells vegetables that she gets from her farm.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquelina e solteira mas vive com um homem de quem tem 2 filhos. o marido de raquelina nao esta empregado ele vive de pequenos expedientes e trabalha na machamba da familia. raquelina tambem trabalha na machamba juntamente com seu marido. mas porque quer melhorar a vida de sua familia principalmente garantir a escola para os seus filhos, ela resolveu entrar para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa juntamente com o marido melhorar a casa onde vivem. para alem de pagar as despesas da casa. raquelina as vezes tambem vende legumes que tira de sua machamba.

loans.use: Raquelina would like to use the money to buy more wrap skirts for the business

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir has been in business for over 15 years. He is married and has 3 children. His business place is located in the central market in Istaravshan, Tajikistan.

He is an engineer, but after the collapse of the government, he tried for two years to find a job with a good salary so he could meet the needs of his family. His friend helped him rent one little trading place in the market and he started to sell seeds of different kind of leguminous plants. He made very little profit because he had limited money.

When Nasir heard about Microinvest, he became a client and used his first loan to purchase seeds in lots. It was a first step in expanding his business. Today he offers a wide assortment of seeds and also he has many customers.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva so he can purchase a large batch of seeds while the price is lower because it is the season of gathering the harvest from the fields.

loans.use: Increasing the quantity of seeds to sell

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Mrs. Eseosa I. is 35 years old, married with three children, and lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions. She is soliciting a loan of $1050 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale. She learned the trade for a period of three years and started her business in 2001. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.ru:
Umaraly N. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has four children. He has no education. He makes his living by remodeling apartments and building custom homes. He has been also in the animal husbandry business which provides him with fresh milk and extra income by selling milk and breeding calves. Umaraly plans to use the loan to buy a calve as the prices for cattle go down in February, but in the fall he will be able to sell it for a higher and profitable price. The pay off term for the loan is 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурматов Умарали проживает в районе Рудаки.Женат имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет.Зарабатывает деньги путем ремонта квартир и построек жилых домов на заказ. Так же клиент занимается животноводством, что дает возможность получать свежее молоко, а также получить дополнительный доход, путем продажи молока и откормленных бычков..На кредит Нурматов Умарали планирует купить бычка , так как в феврале цены на скот падают, а осенью сможет продать по более высокой и выгодной ему цене.Срок за который клиент планирует погасить в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calve

loans.name: Narda's Group

texts.es:
Narda, Esther, and Ronalda have been part of “Banco Comunal Atinchik” which means “We are able to” in Quechua for 2, 7, and 6 years respectively. In their “Banco Comunal” they learned to be punctual, responsible, supportive and good colleagues. Narda lives with her partner, she is 29 years old and has a 6 year-old daughter. For the past 2 months she has been selling candy at her house which is close to the zoo, previously she sold food at an urban transportation stop, activity she stopped doing as it was very exhausting. Esther is single and 27 years old. She sells vegetables and groceries in the Ayacuchana jungle where she travels every two weeks to do business. She also sells shoes and anything her clients might need. Ronalda lives with her partner, she is 37 years old and has a 9 year-old daughter. She sells used spare parts and started her business as her husband is a mechanic and there was demand for those products.

Narda, Esther, and Ronalda need loans for 1000 soles, 300 soles, and 600 soles ($675) to be invested in buying soft drinks, gum, cookies, sugar, noodles, salt, and spare parts. The savings will be used to build their house and to cover emergencies. Their dream is to own a wholesale store, a vehicle to transport their merchandise and to improve the life standard of their mother, and to support their children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Narda, Esther y Ronalda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa “Podemos” en Quechua hace 2, 7, 6 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, solidarias y compañeras. Narda es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Narda vende golosinas en su casa hace 2 meses, que esta ubicado cerca de un zoológico, anteriormente vendía comida en un paradero de transporte urbano, actividad que dejo de realizar porque era muy forzado. Por otro lado Esther es soltera y tiene 27 años, Esther vende verduras, abarrotes en la selva Ayacuchana, a donde viaja quincenalmente para realizar su negocio. Además Esther vende zapatos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes. Mientras que Ronalda es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hija de 9 años, Ronalda vende repuestos de segunda, inició su negocio porque su esposo es mecánico y había demanda de estos productos.

Narda, Esther y Ronalda necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, chicles, galletas, azúcar, fideo, sal y repuestos. Sus ahorros son para la construcción de su casa y alguna emergencia. Los sueños de Narda, Esther y Ronalda son tener una tienda mayorista, un carro para transportar su mercadería, brindarle todo lo mejor a su mama y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, gum, cookies, sugar, noodles, salt, and spare parts to increase business.

loans.name: Mosi's Heri Yetu Group

texts.en:
Mosi is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18,12, and 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 76 years old. Mosi has a small business that she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $33 from her sales.

In the past, Mosi has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Elly

texts.id:
Elly and her husband, Joko Sutanto, sell motorcycle spare parts for several makes of motorcycles. Including selling spark plugs, oil, bolts, and tires of several brands. By and large the buyers are from the community living within the store or incidental passerby. Usually the motorcycle spare parts sold are purchased in Denpasar and also from sales person who are his customers. From this business, he is able to set aside money to cover his home lease for an extended period and also use as further funding. Elly intends to expand her store, thus requiring additional funding.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Elly menekuni usaha jual suku cadang (spare part) sepeda motor untuk berbagai merek sepeda motor bersama suaminya Joko Sutanto. Adapun barang yang dijual antara lain Busi,Oli, Baut, dan Ban yang tersedia dalam berbagai merek. Umumnya pembelinya adalah masyarakat yang tinggal di sekitar tokonya atau yang kebetulan lewat. Biasanya suku cadang kendaraan bermotor yang dijualnya dia beli di kota Denpasar atau ada juga yang dibeli dari sales person yang menjadi langganannya. Dari usaha ini, ia bisa menyisihkan uang untuk membayar perpanjangan kontrak rumahnya dan juga dipakai sebagai modal lagi. Elly berkeinginan mengembangkan tokonya, karena itu dia membutuhkan tambahan modal lagi.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San M., and his wife, Mrs. Phan Long were married in 1980. They have two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, one is a motorcycle taxi driver, and the youngest one is in school. The family lives along National Road number two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. San has been a motor remoque taxi driver for two years. A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh, while Mrs. Phan cuts grass to sell as cattle feed. Mr. San is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani M., 27, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the ice cake (popsicle) business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (~150 USD).

SPBD loans are Leilani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business while her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, sugar, concentrate

loans.name: Khadija's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 26 years old and married. She has four children -- ages 4, 6, and 14 years old and an infant. She became a chicken seller in 1993 and works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Khadija and Nadhifa, who have businesses in clothing sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell in her business

texts.en:
This is Tawopaneh Nu group. Mariatu K. and Fatmata Kamara make up the group. This will be their third loan from Kiva through Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT). 

Previous loans brought a lot of changes into the lives of these people. Their businesses grew to new heights and their living conditions also improved. With continuous access to loans, Mariatu and Fatmata believe that they will gradually move away from poverty. 

Thus, they have come again for the third time to SMT to seek a new loan. They want a loan of Le 1,600,000.00. 

Fatmata Kamara (right) is this group's leader. She is 36 years of age. Fatmata was born in Magburaka and she is married with 3 children. She has been selling dried fish for the past 5 years. Mariatu told me that her previous loan helped her a lot, she was able to pay her children's school fees and feed and clothe all of them with the proceeds from previous loans. With this new one, she will buy more baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy more baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Gese

texts.en: Gese F., 43, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the produce business. She sells her produce in the village 2 days per week while her husband does all the farming.. This is her first loan with SPBD.  Gese would like a loan to purchase knives, weedkiller and pesticides.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Gese's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knives, weedkiller and pesticides

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Anteriormente trabajaba ofertando su fuerza de trabajo en las duras tareas de una fábrica de ladrillos, pero decidió emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, que le permitiera disponer de su propio tiempo para también poder atender a sus hijos, es así que hace medio año  compró un torete, lo ha engordado y lo ha vendido, de esa manera pudo obtener una ganancia considerable con la que pudo adquirir cerdos, para luego venderlos a un precio más elevado a parte de ello, ha comprado cuyes, y ahora está aumentando su población. Estos progresos la animan a seguir trabajando de esta forma, por la cual va todas las mañanas a cortar el pasto necesario para alimentar a sus animales. Vicenta trabaja de esta manera porque desea que sus hijos se superen a través del estudio.  Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más toretes para venderlos luego.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children. Until recently, she worked offering her efforts to the hard work of a brick factory, but she decided to start her own busines so that she could arrange her own schedule and attend to her children. About 6 months ago, she bought a cow that she raised and then sold to obtain funds to purchase pigs that she could sell at a higher price. Additionally, she has bought guinea pigs and is now increasing the size of the litter. These advancements encourage her to continue working this way and to get up every morning to cut the grass to feed her animals. Vicenta works because she wants her children to have a good education. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more cattle to subsequently resell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle to raise and subsequently resell

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
Papa G. sells clothing and fabrics. Papa attended school through junior high. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader.

Papa has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2005. He is responsible for paying his children’s school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy more clothing and fabric to sell. He hopes to use the new profits he generates to reinvest in his business. This will allow him to increase his income and enable him to give quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and fabric to sell

loans.name: Ilda David

texts.pt:
Ilda David S. é natural do bairro da Machava no distrito municipal da Matola um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 53 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Ilda estudou até 4ªclasse e não continuou por ter tido problemas sociais quais não quis revelar ao nosso repórter. Teve a sua infância junto dos pais com 7 irmãos. Tem sua casa própria.

Ilda dedica se ao negócio de vende de produtos de mercearia é dona e tem um estabelecimento que abre as 6:00h e fecha as 22:00h  tem a destacar das mercadorias que tem mais saída é o peixe carapau que compra uma caixa por 1050,00mr e vende por 1350,00mt. Com isso tem lucros mensais de 8000,00mt e poupa algum. 

Para Ilda este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no kiva, pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Ilda tem planos futuros a aquisição de um estabelecimento para venda de carne de vaca.
texts.en:
Ilda David S. comes from Machava (a city that belongs to the district of Matola located in the Maputo province). She spent her childhood with her parents and 7 other siblings. Currently, this 53-year-old widow does not support anybody else besides her 5 children -- she owns the house where they live. She attended school up until the 4th grade, but social motives she did not want to share with our reporter cut her education short. Ilda owns a grocery goods retail establishment that opens from 6:00am until 10:00pm. She states that one of her best selling products is the carapau fish that can be bought for 1050,00mt per box and sold for 1350,00mt, enabling her to produce 8000,00mt in monthly revenues and to save a part of that. This will be Ilda's first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and she wants to increase her stock merchandise. In the future she wants to purchase a commercial establishment that will be used to sell beef cattle.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of assorted products

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Mme Pauline E. est née en 1957 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle a su vite se prendre en charge en créant sa propre boutique de vente en gros et en détail de riz, de sucre et d’œufs. Aujourd’hui sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante, ce qui l’oblige à s’approvisionner fréquemment pour faire face à leur demande. Pour y faire face, elle sollicite un financement pour ravitailler en stock important de marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra accroître considérablement ses chiffres d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Pauline E. was born in 1957 in Tsévié. Married and the mother of five, she quickly discovered how to make it on her own by creating her own shop selling rice, sugar, and eggs at the retail and wholesale levels. Today, her customers are more and more numerous, and this forces her to get supplies frequently to cope with the demand. To address the situation, she is requesting financing to replenish her stock signifcantly. She will then be able to grow her sales figures and profits considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retaile and wholesale commerce in rice, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Ciobanu

texts.en: Ciobanu N. is 37 years old. She lives in the Cimislia district and grows grain and vegetables. Her neighbors also work in agriculture but they recognize that N. works hardest and has the richest harvest. She has three children who are students in Chisinau City. N. is determined that they attend university and to reach this goal she would like to expand her business with a loan from MicroInvest. With the loan, she plans to purchase more seeds and increase her yield of vegetables, which will boost her profit.

loans.use: To buy vegetable and grain seeds for farming

loans.name: David 3 Group

texts.en:
The four members of Group 3 from David Bank of Hope in La Romana will begin their second loan. They hope this new loan will help them strengthen their businesses, several of which were started with their first loan. 

Lavila P. is the group coordinator. She has two children, ages 4 and 7. She sells clothes and will use her entire second loan to buy new merchandise so that she has stock and can produce profits for a longer period of time. Lavila could not get any formal education, but she knows how important it is in order to have better income-generating activities. She dreams of seeing her children graduate from college from a career of their choice. This is why she works very hard to take her clothes-selling business to her ultimate goal, which is to have her own boutique. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Simbiat

texts.en: Simbiat is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene and foodstuffs like rice, garri, yam etc.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Simbiat requests a loan of $550 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and she promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 24, is a garment worker in the garment industry. Her husband Seng, 23, is a domestic building worker. The young couple live with their one young child, who is enrolled in school.

Because the family's house is too old and small for them, they both have decided to look for a loan to repair their old house. The family lives in Phnom Penh, while they are pictured here.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Madame F. exerce depuis 1994 le commerce de pagnes, son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’elle le maîtrise. Aussi elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle exerce son activité au marché local de Kégué  et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où le commerce de pagnes est très développé. Son stock de pagnes est épuisé, pour  se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes de grande qualité. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. F. has been selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) since 1994 and her experience in this business means that she knows it well. She also has a lot of customers. She sells her fabric in the local market of Kégué and buys her merchandise at the big open-air market of Lomé where a great deal of African print fabric is sold. Her stock of "pagnes" is expended and to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 15 bolts of high quality "pagnes". She is married and has 2 children; with the income from her little business, she assists her husband in paying household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Amélida Graciela

texts.es: Doña Amélida Graciela cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Típicas” cuenta con un taller de  Telares, habita junto  con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Amélida Graciela is 35 years old, married, and has a weaving workshop. She lives with her husband and their 2 children. She and her children work in the same shop (which is run from her residence), and have two employees. She has been doing this in for the past 10 years in the Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa area of the Totonicapán department in Guatemala. Currently, the demand of her clientele has grown, but the economic conditions are not sufficient enough for her to increase her capital, which was why she went to the Association ASDIR to apply for a loan. Doña Amélida intends to buy raw material with her loan and thus increase her sales, and also hopes to help her children move ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James O. is 41 years old and married with 5 children. He sells palm oil retail to his customers. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Lucia es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Lucia se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos como el queso, la leche lo adquiere de productores, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche.
Los sueños de Lucia son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the “Llapanchik” communal bank, which means “Everyone Together” in Quechua. Lucia is married, she is 39 years old, and she has 4 children. She makes dairy products, such as cheese. She buys the milk from milk producers. She sells her products at markets in the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 1500 PEN, which she will use to buy milk. Lucia’s dreams are to build her house and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
R. Nazokat is 42 years old. She is married to an engineer and they have four school-aged children. Nazokat is a kindergarten teacher by profession, however for several years she has sold children's clothing. Nazokat and her husband dream that their children will enter higher education, so the income from Nazokat's business will be spent on educating their children. Nazokat has received an IMON loan once before and proved to be an accurate and reliable client. Now she is requesting 5000 TJS for purchasing new goods to sell. Nazokat and her children thank you sincerely for your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods for resale to increase the range

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou F. est une mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait un élevage porcin et du petit commerce de poisson sec et fumé. Elle aimerait renforcer cette activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Codou F. is married and the mother of 5 children. She has a pork farm and also does some small business selling dried and smoked fish. She would like to increase her business in order to better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her pig farm and selling dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
64 years old Lolita and her husband live with their two sons and three grandchildren. Through Lolita's membership in ASHI, she has been able to purchase, six years ago, a tricycle (sidecar attached to the body of a motorcycle - used as a means of transportation) which her 33-year-old son is managing and getting his income from. Her loans have also financed her husband's farming. Most of all, it had made her an entrepreneur.

Lolita sells rice, gasoline for motorcycles, and dried fish in their own village. She chose to sell these items because they are the most salable to people, considering the village, which is very poor, lacks  accessibility to any kind of transportation and the market is very far. The fare alone when buying things people need in the market is already expensive. At least with Lolita's business, people don't need to go to market for the basic things they need.

Through loans she is able to get from ASHI, Lolita wants to expand her business and sell more items for the accessibility of her neighbors and other people in the village. She also wanted to help her children and sustain the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy commodities such as rice, gasoline, and dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing of the young cattle

loans.name: Josiane Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Josiane Clarisse est mariée à MITCHOZOUNOU Jean. Josiane Clarisse est mère de quatre  enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Josiane Clarisse vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille.  C’est des sacs de charbon de bois que Josiane Clarisse vend chez elle à domicile. Josiane Clarisse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché International du Bénin. Josiane Clarisse est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Josiane Clarisse a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de charbon de bois. C’est la raison pour laquelle Josiane Clarisse demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. 1380

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: S. is 52 years old married woman and mother. To earn a living, S. sells rice and soup to sewing workers from her shop nearby garment factory and is normally earning $5 per day. She is married to Samouen, age 51, who is a vehicle repairer. This older couple has given birth to four children, most of who are garment worker. S. requests a loan to buy necessary ingredient to cook food for sale. Note: S.'s husband is shown in the picture here.

loans.use: To buy necessary ingredient to cook food for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es mujer trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, Rita se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y alquiler de motocarro, actividad que comparte con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” desde hace ocho años, Rita recibió un crédito de 300 soles la primera vez, dinero con el cual pudo invertir en ropa para niños.
Actualemente ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar zapatos, billeteras, correas y prendas de vestir que serán comercializados a sus clientes. La meta de Rita es tener un establecimiento propio, para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Rita is a hard working woman with a spirit of perseverance. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 57 years old and the mother of two sons who are now of age. Rita sells clothing articles and is involved in motor-cart rentals. She shares this responsibility with her husband. She has been a member of the Banco Communal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Working Women”) for eight years now. The first time, Rita received a loan of 300 soles which she invested in clothing articles for children. At the moment, she needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will use to purchase shoes, wallets, belts and clothing articles which will be sell to her clientele. Rita’s goal is to have her own store from where she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, wallets, belts and clothing articles.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Calaran, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Myrna owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling baked products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment for food processing. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for food processing

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to make more profits this season. She is 46 years old and married with 10 children. Her children are in primary and secondary schools and they are doing well. With this combined businesses, she is able to put food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Glendi Carolina

texts.es:
Glendi es una joven  emprendedora  que vive con su madre y su mayoria de tiempo se dedica al negocio,  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer sus obligaciones en la casa y luego se va para el mercado a vender su ropa, Glendi es una joven soltera, su madre le ayuda a vender en el mercado
con el credito que esta solicitando va a crecer su negocio y va a tener mejores utilidades, mas ahorita que viene la navidad y muchas personas de escasos recursos compran ropa de segunda mano, ya que es de buena calidad y el precio es muy comodo.
este tipo de producto se vende muy bien en esta zona de Choluteca.
texts.en:
Glendi is a young entrepreneur who lives with her mother and spends most of her time engaged in her business. She wakes up at 5am to take care of her household duties and later goes to the market to sell clothing. Glendi is a single young woman. Her mother helps her make sales in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to grow her business so that she can generate better revenues. Right now Christmas is coming, and many low income people want to buy secondhand clothes because of the high quality and affordable prices. This type of product sells very well in the area of Choluteca.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José cuenta con 55 años de edad, es casado con Serafina con quien tiene 4 hijos, los mismos que estudian en establecimientos fiscales en nivel de primaria y secundaria. Cuenta con casa propia dotado de los principales servicios básicos. Su principal actividad es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia vagoneta, contando con ruta y parada fija, sin embargo la línea de transporte es alquilada. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte, siendo sus inicios con el transporte de moto-taxi en la ruta local de la localidad para luego pasar al transporte de taxi con su vagoneta propia. En el sector del transporte de pasajeros existe fuerte competencia, sin embargo su fortaleza radica en que trabaja en una ruta fija y cuenta con una parada fija perteneciendo a una Asociación de transportistas, quienes por su estabilidad y el buen servicio cuentan con bastante clientela que requieren de sus servicios, y cuya parada está estratégicamente ubicada cerca al mercado central de la localidad. El crédito lo destino a la construcción, ampliando una habitación más para sus hijos. José cuenta con 5 créditos en la institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, además de contar con experiencia crediticia en otras financieras.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old, his wife is named Serafina and they have four children, all of their children are in elementary and middle school. He owns his own house that is equipped with basic services. His main work is as a taxi driver and he has his own vehicle, he relies on fixed routes and stops, though the taxi license is rented. He has 20 years of experience in the field of transportation, be began as a motorcycle taxi on a local route in an area but later he became a taxi driver with his own vehicle. In the taxi business there is strong competition, however, however, his strength lies in working on a fixed route with fixed stops. He also belongs to an association of taxi drivers who are known for their reliability and good service. They have a lot of clients who require their services and they are strategically located near the central market of the area. This loan will be used for construction, José will expand a room for his kids. He has five credits with this institution and has demonstrated excellent management of his payments, he also has experience with other financiers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room for his children

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en: B. Fariz is single. He was born 1986 and lives in the Fuzuli region. He has been in the livestock business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 8 sheep to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 26 años, que vive con su esposo Marcelino, de 29 años, y con sus dos hijos; Liden de 5 y Hugo de 1 año. Ellos viven en una humilde casa (propia) bastante antigua donde vivieron 3 generaciones de su familia.

El trabajo sacrificado que ejerce a diario ha hecho que ella aparente una edad mayor a la que tiene, puesto que se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra papa, arveja maíz y flor de gladiolo desde hace 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposo. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar arveja porque le resulta de poca inversión y puede cosechar hasta 3 veces.
Ella considera que la agricultura una actividad rentable porque le permite cubrir los gastos de su casa y las primeras necesidades de toda su familia.
Por tal motivo, para el futuro desea tener una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad y para ello ya está buscando un local adecuado para alquilar. Sin embargo, Carmen no quiere dejar de sembrar, sino por el contrario quiere aumentar su producción.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son bastante unidos y solidarios. Para cubrir esta campaña agrícola y en busca de ganancias económicas, invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la comprar de una bolsa de semilla de arveja,  2 sacos de fertilizantes y una botella de insecticida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Marcelino, age 29, and their two children: Liden, age 5, and Hugo, age 1. They live in a humble house that they own; the house is quite old, and three generations of their family have lived there. The self-sacrificing work that Carmen carries out every day has made her appear older than her true years. She works as a farmer, growing potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolus flowers for the past 10 years, with her husband's help. What she likes best is growing peas, because they do not require a large investment, and they can be harvested up to 3 times. Carmen considers farming a profitable activity, because it allows her to cover her household expenses and obtain the basic necessities for everyone in her family. In the future, she would like to open a food store in the city, and she is already looking for a suitable building to rent for this purpose. However, Carmen does not intend to stop farming; on the contrary, she wants to increase her production. This is Carmen's third loan with MFP, and she likes to work with the members of her communal bank, because of their strong unity and solidarity. To cover the expenses of this farming season, and in pursuit of greater economic returns, she will invest the funds she is currently requesting to purchase a bag of pea seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, and a bottle of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Her customers are usually women and young ladies. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 90,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Gift is 36 years old and married, with two children. Her children are in school and this makes her happy. She hopes to give her children a solid and sound education. Her husband is a sailor and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Thim Heal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan comprises sixteen people who live in Sdok village in TaK. province. Mrs. Thim H. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purpose. 

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Buos Yorng, is a trailer driver. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Thim H. decided to apply for a loan to buy a bicycle for her children to use to go to school. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a television and pay for electricity for her house. She has two children, both of whom are enrolled at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for her children to go to school

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia  tiene 58 años, es madre soltera de dos hijas. Es modista desde hace más de 30 años, su taller lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija, quienes constantemente acuden a ella para solicitarle algún tipo de ropa que está a la moda. Según relata la señora este oficio también requiere estar actualizada en las nuevas tendencias, esto le permite interpretar los nuevos gustos de su clientela.
Eladia confecciona ropas para uniformes de empresas, colegios y algunos pedidos especiales como ropa para fiestas, quince años, entre otros. Esta sabiduría y el arte de transformar las telas la señora Eladia lo está transmitiendo a sus hijas y sobrinas, quienes en algunas ocasiones la suelen ayudar según la cantidad de trabajo y  pedido que recibe.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar, telas, hilos, botones, entre otros productos para poder hacer frente a los numerosos pedidos que tenia.
texts.en:
Eladia is 58 years old and is a single mother of two daughters. She has been a dressmaker for more than 30 years. Her workshop is in her home and she has regular customers who always return to ask for the latest style in clothing. For this reason, she has to stay informed about the newest trends in fashion. Eladia makes uniforms for businesses, schools, and some special orders for parties, quinceañeras (15th birthday celebrations for girls), and others. She is passing this knowledge and art of transforming cloth to her daughters and nieces, who help out when there are a lot of orders. With the loans she obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to buy cloth, thread, buttons and other supplies to keep up with her many orders.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies such as cloth, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou S. is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling firewood, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and beans, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Thou S. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 375 to purchase a machine to grind rice. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a machine to grind rice

loans.name: Levenent

texts.en:
Levenent is an industrious married father of two. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, rice, cooking fat and cereals. He has been in the business for seven years and has two employees.   He also rents his residential houses to earn extra income.  He is in a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya called Amahesa who meet on weekly basis to save their money.  

Levenent has previously taken out a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to expand his business, and he successfully repaid it.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of rice, sugar and cereals and also to build more houses to rent out.  He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To add to his inventory of rice, sugar, and cereals and build more houses to rent.

loans.name: Bekha Maiya

texts.en:
Bekha Maiya M. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three sons. Her husband, Mr. Chandra Man M., works as a taxi driver. All of her sons are now in school.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop five years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting NPR 15000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food in her shop, such as noodles, rice, biscuits, etc. She wants to use her income to provide a better education for her sons.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Santiago Valentin

texts.es:
Santiago de 43 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales, El tiene una tienda de verduras y vegetales trabaja con su esposa, este negocio lo comenzó vendiendo arroz por libre en su casa, pero como la demanda de productos era mucha, decidió comprar mas víveres para vender. 

Trabaja todos los días con su esposa, veden verduras, legumbres y víveres. Vende al por menor y en ocasiones al por mayor aunque no mucho.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Santiago is 43 years old, lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil, and has 2 children who study in the public schools. He has a store that sells greens and he works there with his wife. When the business began, they sold rice by the pound from their home, but since demand for other products was high, he decided to buy more foodstuff to sell. Santiago and his wife work every day, selling greens, vegetables and other foods. He sells at retail and, occasionally, though not often, at wholesale. With this loan he wishes to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar to stock his business. In the future he wishes to open a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, SUGAR, AND COOKING OIL TO SELL

loans.name: G.s. Las Unidas Group

texts.es: Las tres Señoras que conforman este Grupo solidario llamado Las Unidas en Cristo. Rosario Patricia, Josefa Bernarda y Carla Patricia. La actividad económica de cada una de ellas. Carla se dedica a la venta de mariscos, frijoles cocidos y leña. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es muy variado pues a Carla se le conoce por ofrecer diferentes productos siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo, con la ayuda de sus otras compañeras. Es así que decidieron realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio pues las tres viven en condiciones muy humildes. Desean es proporcionarle mejoras a sus respectivas vivienda.
texts.en:
The three ladies who form this group, called “Las Unidas en Cristo” (United in Christ) are Rosario, Josefa, and Carla. Carla sells seafood, cooked beans, and firewood. She has been doing this for more than four years and is known for offering a variety of items. She has always enjoyed helping her three children get ahead with the aid of the other members. They have decided to ask for this loan in order to buy supplies for their businesses. They each live in humble homes and would like to improve them.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales ya son independientes y no viven con ella, tiene 4 nietos. 
El negocio de Felicitas es la venta de aserrín, es la única distribuidora de este producto en Huamanga, Felicita trae en triciclo los sacos de aserrín a su negocio y de ahí los distribuye a sus clientes, reparte un aproximado de 700 a 800 sacos, el aserrín es utilizado para la fabricación de ladrillos, transportar ganado, pescado congelado, sus ventas los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1100 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de aserrín de diversos tipos, por sacos y al por mayor. 
El sueño de Felicitas es tener un carro para transportar sus productos a otros lugares, incrementar su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She has 4 children, two of whom are independent and do not live with her. She has 4 grand-children. Her business is the sale of sawdust. It is the only distributor of this product in Huamanga. Felicia brings bags of sawdust to her business by tricycle and form there distributes them to her customers. She distributes approximately 700 to 800 bags. The sawdust is used for brick-making, livestock transportation and seafood freezing. She sells with the help of her children. Felicitas needs a loan of 1100 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sawdust of various types, in bags and wholesale. Her dream is to have a car to transport her products to other areas; to expand her business and get ahead with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of various kinds of sawdust

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity S. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal from her home. She  is requesting a loan in order to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Charity is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build her own shop.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights services, and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is paticularly targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hripsik

texts.en: Hripsik M. is a widow living with her son and daughter. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. Hripsik’s family shares their living space with her sister and mother-in-law. Hripsik has been successfully running a beauty salon since 2009. Both Hripsik’s children help their mother in running the business. To create comfortable conditions and meet her clients' needs Hripsik needs to purchase some necessary beauty salon equipment and install air conditioning.

loans.use: beauty salon equipment and air conditioning installation

loans.name: Nyètaa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyètaa 2 est composé de six femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Balamissala dans la commune rurale de Sébougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Le riz, l’arachide, le mil et le gombo seront cultivés par les membres du groupe Nyètaa 2 du village de Balamissala.
Madame Mariétou  D. veut utiliser son prêt  pour acheter 30kg de semences de riz,  deux sacs de complexe céréale, 2 bidons d’herbicide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de repiquage et de sarclage dans ses champs. Le labour est réservé aux hommes alors que le sarclage et le repiquage sont l’œuvre des femmes dans le village. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). 
Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espère produire 8 sacs d’arachide, 10 sacs de riz et une trentaine de sac de gombo. Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu pour prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants, les besoins du foyer ainsi que les soins de santé. 
Madame Mariétou  D. a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Nyètaa 2 group is composed of six women, all married and living in big traditional families. Their average age is 33 and on average they have 3 children each. They live in the village of Balamissala, in the rural community of Sébougou, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they became acquainted because they are either in-laws, neighbors, or related to each other. Wishing to expand their arable land, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second agricultural (seasonal) loan. Members of the Nyètaa 2 group from the village of Balamissala grow rice, peanuts, millet, and okra. Mrs. Mariétou D. wants to use her loan to buy 30 kg of rice seed, two sacks of fertilizer for grains, two tins of herbicide, and pay for labor to help her prepare the soil, transplant the rice seedings, and do the weeding in her fields. Preparing the soil is work reserved for men, whereas weeding and transplanting are work done by women from the village. She buys her agricultural inputs at the weekly market in Ségou (the big market). With 3 hectares, she hopes to produce 8 sacks of peanuts, 10 sacks of rice, and about 30 sacks of okra. Part of her production will be consumed by her family, whereas the rest will be sold to have money for the children's school fees, household necessities, and health care expenses. Mrs. Mariétou D. aims to be able to raise goats and sheep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizer (a mixture for grains), rice seeds, herbicides, and paying for labor

loans.name: Ket

texts.en: Ket T., 54, is married and lives with her three children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 (USD) each day, while her husband is a taxi driver making $15 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ket T. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $800 to replace an old and unreliable mototaxi for her husband.

loans.use: To replace an old and unreliable mototaxi.

loans.name: Jorita

texts.en:
Jorita R. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Jorita is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jorita owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Jorita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jorita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jorita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jorita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Paulina O. is in her mid-thirties and is married with three children aged 17, 14 and 12. She has been operating a stone quarry as well as a small clothes shop for six years. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her stock of stone for her quarry, a loan which she has successfully repaid. With this loan, Paulina hopes to buy more stone for her quarry in order to expand production. Her dream is to one day start selling her clothes in other cities in Tanzania.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group, Wazo Tegeta, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of their loans.

In the photo, Paulina is in the back row, first on the left.

loans.use: To buy more stone for her quarry

loans.name: Pilar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Pilar Poty se conformó en fecha 24  setiembre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1°ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. 
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Maria Isabel T. quien se dedica a la lavar ropa,  nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.  
Ella  nos comenta que mediante el préstamo su vida mejoro  bastante. 
 Según la Sra. Maria    mencionó que la actividad que realiza  la Fundación  es muy importante ya que ella nunca encontró este espacio en otro lado por  ser muy pobre. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un  lavarropas.
texts.en:
The women's committee called "Pilar Poty" was founded on September 24, 2010, and it is currently in its first loan cycle, working together in solidarity within the program.

A very moving story is that of Maria Isabel T., whose work is washing clothes. She says that through the loan, she has been able to improve her business quite a lot, as well as her income and her standard of living. 

She reports that with the loan, her life has improved greatly. According to Maria, the work of the Foundation is very important because she never found this kind of opportunity elsewhere, since she is very poor. 

She is requesting the loan to buy a washing machine.

loans.use: Buying a washing machine

loans.name: Fredolyn

texts.en:
Fredolyn R. is from the village of Luna. She is 35 years old. Fredolyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fredolyn owns and operates a general store. Fredolyn has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fredolyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fredolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fredolyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken by Fredolyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. C. is a 55-year-old mother from San Angel, San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is already a widow and she lives with her daughter Eufemia, 29 years old and a housekeeper.

Erlinda has been an active member of ASHI Antique South Branch for almost 12 years.  As a member she maintains good performance and that is why she has gotten a bigger loan through ASHI. Because of her good performance, she is able to get an incentive loan from ASHI like House Repair Loans and Educational Loans. 

With her 12 years of membership, the branch is proud to tell you that the life of Erlinda is improving, not only her standard of living but the social aspects of her life. Like other women, she encounters difficulties in life but she is a mother who never gives up because she believes that if there is a will, there is a way. Even at the age of 55, she never stops dreaming, not only for herself but for the future of her grandchildren. She wants to help her children even they  already have their own family.

Erlinda wishes to apply for Php, 45,000 because she wants to buy another tricycle for her children so that they will also have an income to support their family.

loans.use: to buy another "tricycle" (motorcycle transport vehicle)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lilia V. es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió y se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene como atractivos turísticos el sector conocido como el Verde cerro que fue sagrado para los Cañaris y de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.
