Nuestra socia tiene 41 años,  es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17, 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan económicamente en su hogar, su segunda hija pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres y su ultima hija trabaja. Su esposo es maestro albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Lilia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa en donde se dedica a la cría de credos. Trabaja como empleada domestica algunos días de la semana o cuando la llaman.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual se ha beneficiado en la compra de animales y también en su hogar, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar cuyes y pollos para iniciar con este negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia V. is a member of the Paloma communal bank.  She lives in El Valle parish which is a cold climate parish located in southwest Cuenca.  One of its tourist attractions is an area known as El Verde, a hill that was sacred to the Cañaris (ancient inhabitants of the territory of the modern provinces of Azuay and Cañar), from which one can overlook most of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents maintain their traditions and culture.

Lilia is 41 years old, married and has four children who are 22, 20, 17 and 15 years of age.  Her two oldest children work and contribute economically to the home.  Her second daughter stays home helping with household chores and her youngest daughter works.  Her husband is a master builder.  They do not own their house, they rent.

Lilia is a housewife but also raises pigs.  She works as a domestic employee a few days a week or whenever she’s called to do so.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years.  During this time she has benefitted by being able to buy animals and also in her home. She will use the new loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to start this business.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Kimgugi Group

texts.en:
Sara K. is in her early twenties and is single with a baby son. For the past year, Sara has a small fabric and clothing business and she walks door to door selling fabric and young women’s clothing. Sara works daily from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm and earns a low monthly profit.

This will be Sara’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Sara successfully repaid her first loan that was used to increase her stock of fabric and clothing. With her second loan, Sara will increase her stock in order to increase sales. Her dream is to one day have a big shop where she can sell her products. 

In this picture, Sara is in the front row, holding the baby. Sara will share this loan with her 15-member loan group “Kimgugi.” The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric and used clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is twenty-seven years old, married with two children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda and her goal is building rentals for the family. She has been operating a salon for three years and this has generated minimal income to help her provide for the family amidst mishaps of bad debts. Beatrice needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and chemicals for the salon.

loans.use: Buying braids and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of 2.5 USD per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food, 7 USD on the children’s education, and 22 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 30-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. He is a businessman who sells CDs and DVDs in the Kibera slums. He started the business four years ago and employs one person. Joseph previously worked as an office messenger before he went into business. He hopes to open a one-stop music shop in the future. Joseph has requested a 30,000 KES loan to buy CDs, speakers and DVDs.

loans.use: to buy CDs, speakers and DVDs

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean T., 38, is married and resides with her child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. Kay is a farmer and grows vegetables, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 1.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 31 on the other necessary expenses. 

Mean T. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has three children aged 15, 12 and 10. In the year 2001, Mohamed established his cloth business. He began in his business because he took it over from his late father and this is the only business he can manage well to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business.

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy additional wax cotton, "Brillion", and lace. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to get another outlet and also to buy a motorbike for business purposes.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cloth for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 54 years old, married and a mother of four.  She runs a retail shop where she mainly sells wedding gifts and drinks.  She has been engaged in the business since 2002.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business hence improving her standard of living.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy more wedding gifts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more wedding gifts for resale.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Myagmardorj is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. All of his children are married and he lives with his wife in a rented house on a small plot of land. His wife works for a small clothing making factory and she makes leather coats at home in addition to her job. They have an average standard of living. Myagmardorj has a group of people who make construction parts such as floors and windowsills. He has established his own LLC and is trying to expand it. He has been doing construction work for several years that he has his own customers now. He is a polite and hardworking person who says, " I have bought a house with land and I need to fix it". He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Eusmel

texts.en:
Eusmel C. is from the village of Cabol Anonan Tudela. She is 50 years old. Eusmel is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eusmel owns & operates a motor transportation service. Eusmel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eusmel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eusmel has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Eusmel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Eusmel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose  Martínez Mate vive en la comunidad de Cimarrón en Cartago,  y se  ha dedicado toda si vida a la producción de leche.
El en este momento desea aumenta la producción de leche y para que necesita un préstamo de ₡ 500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaquita mas.
Con esto don Jose espera aumentar su producción y así  mejorar la calidad y cantidad  de su producción para mejorar la vida de su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose Martínez Mate lives in the community of Cimarrón in Cartago, and he has been working in the area of milk production all of his life.

Now he wants to increase his milk production, and to do this he needs a loan of 500,000 Costa Rican colones to buy another dairy cow.

With this investment Jose hopes to increase both the quantity and quality of his production, and in this way improve the quality of life for his family.

Jose is a member of the "Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón" Communal Finance Institution, one the 110 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida M. is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. 

Saida faces a major challenge in the high costs of transportation in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and cartons of tomatoes for resale.
 
She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and cartons of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 yrs old.  He is married to Jacinta, who is a farmer and also contributes to the family income.  They have four children.  He has been farming for sixteen years and earns an income of KES 20,700 monthly.

He has taken his second loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He wants use this loan to  spray his crops and buy fertilizer.  His hope is to expand his farm and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: spray his crops and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos tiene 54 años, El señor José es dueño de un negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte personal. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 23 años, con una ruta que se dirige del viejo a Chinandega, pero como no estaba resultando decide ofrecer el servicio de transporte personal a una empresa es así que ha logrado salir adelante. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de llantas, focos, mantenimiento entre otros. El sueño de José es mejorar su servicio ya que la competencia es bastante grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 54 years old. He owns a private transportation business. He established this business 23 years ago when he provided transportation on the road from “Viejo” to “Chinandega”. When this wasn’t successful her decided to change his business to a personal transportation business. This business has been successful.  He is a very responsible man and enjoys his work. 
This loan will be used to buy tires, headlights and to maintain his vehicle. His dream is to improve his service as he has a lot of competition.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlights and generally maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy, age 31, is a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker, and he sells cow collars. Their income is 10 USD per day. They have two children, ages 12 and 6. Every month, Dy has to spend 70 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 10 USD on school fees, 40 USD on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 800 USD to buy more ropes to twist into cow collars to sell. She wants to sell more cow collars to get more income and to extend that business with her husband. With her profit, she would like to send both of her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy more ropes to twist into cow collars to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 41 and single is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all the family members are at home to partake of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of  PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Rowena is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rowena dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients and products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mrs. Tong, 44 years-old, is living in the Reussey Keo Commune of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow and her occupation is a farmer.  She has a net profit of $2 per day. 

She has six children, four are unmarried and two are married and live in their own houses. Two of them are working, one is a local construction worker, and another one is a garment factory worker. She requests a loan in the amount of $250 to use in her farming business by purchasing seed and fertilizers so her crop can grow well.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizers so her crop can grow well.

loans.name: Veronica Ines

texts.es:
Verónica Inés tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 4 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Verónica se dedica al comercio de legumbres, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio de legunbres y pagas un transporte para el traslado de las legumbres para llevar al mercado a vender. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es adquirir una casa propia en el sector donde vive. 

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar.
texts.en:
Verónica Inés is 22 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her four year old son in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar provence.

The members of the Alli Kausay Communal Bank can be found in the Tolapungo community, Veintimilla sector, Guaranda canton.  The members of this communal bank devote themselves to farming, raising ainimals, selling vegetables, and other business activities.

Verónica sells vegetables, and her husband works in construction. She buys and sells her products at the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her vegetable business and pay for the transportation of the vegetables to take them to the market to sell.  The loan will be a help to supplement her financial necessities and to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to get her own house in the sector where she lives.

She likes doing housework.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of her vegetables to market

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Margarita. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Artesanías en calzados, tienda de barrio, venta de Herbalai, nimibus, peinadora, negocio de Internet, venta de películas.

La señora Margarita, indica que este es el primer año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas para formar un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, etc.), que comprara de la distribuidora de la Ceja y lo comercializará en la misma zona. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la constante capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Margarita. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as making handcrafted shoes, operating a neighborhood store, selling Herbalife products, driving a minibus, hairdressing, managing an Internet café, and selling movies.

Sra. Margarita said that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by friends who wanted to start a group. Margarita currently manages a neighborhood store that she established three years ago. She learned this trade from her parents.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, sugar, noodles, and other products. She buys her merchandise from a distributor in the neighborhood of La Ceja and sells in the same area. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Margarita is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Margarita said she enjoys the constant availability of training seminars.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Sonia Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Sabina; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, ella es propietaria de una agencia de viajes, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar e implementar el negocio de agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia como repuestos de computadoras para comprar sillas para la agencia.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “CUSCO.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of  Cusco.

The member is Sonia Sabina. She is 41 years old and is married with three children. The member alternates her daily activities with her travel agency business. She is the owner of a travel agency. She works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. Through this business she is able to raise her children. The member would like expand and establish her travel agency. The member asks for a loan to buy computer spare parts and chairs to keep her business up and running. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts and chairs to keep her travel agency up and running.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, tiene la edad 38 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa e hijo que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el credito comprar el equipo para aserrar madera. El cuenta con varios años de experiencia en al aserrado de madera y lo que el quiere es complementar mas su herramientas para así facilitar aún mas su trabajo. El pretende con esa compra aumentar su rendimiento en el trabajo y así generar mayor ganancias para su bienestar familiar. El quiere generar suficientes ganancias  para salir con el credito y mejorar su calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roy is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his main priority. With the loan, he intends to purchase sawmilling equipment. He has several years experience in the sawmilling industry and what he wants to do is supplement the tools he already has to further facilitate his work. He wants to generate sufficient income to cover the loan and improve his future quality of life. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had any loans from state banks. However, FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy sawmilling equipment.

loans.name: Hever

texts.es: Hever tiene 34 años, convive con Maribel de 28 años, con quien tiene 04 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. Él se destaca por ser un hombre emprendedor y talentoso, desde muy joven siempre estuvo interesado en el negocio. Es así que se inicio en la agricultura cultivando y comercializando café y cacao, donde recaudo ganancias y con ese capital, logró comprar y acopiar más cacao, café  palillo y maíz, para así comercializarlos en mayor escala; siendo el café y cacao los que más demanda tiene. Los meses que más producción tiene, son los meses de abril a agosto, es por esta razón que solo acopiara café, pero en pocas cantidades. Por ello es que recurre a solicitar un crédito, para incrementar su capital y así no dejar de vender. Sin embargo, uno de las cosas que también lo perjudica es la demora de pago, pues mayormente son llevados al exterior. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, comprará más café.
texts.en:
Hever is 34 years old and lives with Maribel, who is 28.  The couple have four children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Nueva Fortaleza community, in Pichari.  Hever stands out as an entrepreneurial and talented man.  He has always been interested in business, since he was very young.  He started working in agriculture, growing and selling coffee and cacao.  He made profits and, with this capital, he managed to buy and stockpile more cacao, coffee, turmeric and corn to sell on a larger scale (coffee and cacao being the crops in most demand).  The most productive months are April to August.  For this reason, he will only stockpile coffee, in small quantities.

Hever is requesting a loan in order to increase his capital so that he doesn't have to stop selling.  One thing that proves detrimental to his business is delays in receiving payment as his crops are mainly sold abroad.

This will be Hever's first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use the 1,000 soles that he is requesting to buy more coffee.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coffee

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a single woman with one child who is too young for school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past ten years. Her potential clients are community members. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of starting a goat meat business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and onions to sell at her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and onions to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Adelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  She is 38 years old and a mother to one child.

Leah was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for her business.

In the future, Leah hopes to expand her business to wholesaling and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy  sugar, washing detergents, sweets, and maize flour

loans.name: Nahin Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Nahin tiene 30 años y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ha estado en un unión libre con Brenda por los últimos 5 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 6 años, lo cual asiste a la escuela. Él vive en tranquilidad con su familia pero nota que en Honduras hay mucha necesidad. 

Hace 2 años, Nahin dejó de ser agricultor y empezó un servicio de transporte. Hoy en día pasa entre 9  y 11 horas diarias transportando clientes abonados y no abonados de la zona. Hizo el cambio de profesión por su familia y la necesidad de cubrir gastos y hacerlo de forma propia. 

Solicitó un crédito para L12,000 para la reparación de su vehículo, ya que se ha descompuesto. Su sueño es comprar otro vehículo para su negocio para así crear otra fuente de empleo y ingreso para su familia que tanto se necesita.  Nahin agradece a ODEF y a Kiva por dejarse crecer y la grandiosa labor que hacen por la gente como él.
texts.en:
Sr. Nahin is 30 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. He has been in a common-law relationship with Brenda for the past five years. His partner has a six-year-old son who attends school. Nahin says that he lives peacefully with his family, but that there is great need in Honduras.

Two years ago, Nahin quit farming so that he could start in the transportation business. Today he works between 9 and 11 hours each day transporting his regular customers and random passengers throughout the area. He changed jobs for his family since they need to cover their expenses and make a life of their own.

Nahin is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL so that he can repair his vehicle, which is already falling apart. His dream is to buy another vehicle for his business as a way of creating another job and generating income that his family needs. Nahin is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for giving people like him the chance to grow and do great work.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Big Brother Group

texts.en:
Ann is the facilitator of the Big Brother group. Ann and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ann takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Ann had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Ann was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ann and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ann will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Big Brother group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Ann is pictured with her group members and the Field Officer standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  more slippers and cosmetics  for her business.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica 70, a married woman with six children, all of whom are over 30 years of age, owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her grand children who she is supporting.

Dorica sells farm produce such as sugar cane and maize from her farm. She sells as wholesale, at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Dorica faces the major challenges of price fluctuation and climatic changes. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more people in the future. Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to pay for the transport and employment of workers doing the harvest.

loans.use: to pay for the transport and employment of workers during the harvest.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old, married to Annah. They have one child.

Daniel has been in the business for the last 5 years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 26,000. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Daniel hopes to use the profits to buy more maize, beans to sell and to be a prominent cereals supplier.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Jane farms. She has been farming for more than 20 years. She practices mixed farming. She has employed two people to help her in her tasks.

Jane has improved her farming because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua produces palm kernel oil for sale. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling palm kernel oil for four years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Her loan will be used to buy palm kernel for the production of her oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy palm kernel to produce oil to sell

loans.name: Ndeye Marie

texts.fr: La  dame   Ndeye  Marie   habite  au  Sénégal   depuis   très  longtemps.   Elle  évolue   d	ans   le  secteur   du  commerce  et pratique la vente  de   vaisselles   et  de  fournitures   scolaires.    Elle   exerce   cette  activité  depuis   10 ans. Elle a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs au sein du guichet de l’institution ou elle est membre. Elle  sollicite un nouveau crédit de       200000 frs    qui   sera  destiné  a l’achat de marchandises a revendre. L’amélioration des bénéfices  qui seront générés par son activité lui permettra da mieux participer a la gestion des charges familiales de son foyer, plus particulièrement la nourriture et le transport  des enfants.  Elle   compte  diversifier  les   produits   qu’elle commercialise  et   participer a l’amélioration des  conditions   alimentaires    de  la  famille.  Son   projet   est  d’agrandir    sa   boutique.

loans.use: acheter des vaisselles a revendre

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, one of which attends school.  She is also a very hard working entrepreneur, and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. 

Cristy requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other needed materials.

In the future, Cristy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other needed materials.

loans.name: Benito Andres

texts.es: Benito tiene 58 años y esta casado con Julia, siempre se han apoyado mutuamente y llevan mas de la mitad de su vida juntos. Benito vive en el distrito de Acari del departamento de Arequipa. Se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposa, Benito con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar un terreno agrícola y ahora han sembrado cebolla y quieren darle un mantenimiento, es por ello que solicitan el préstamo para pagar la limpieza de malas hierbas que aparecieron en su terreno a causa de las lluvias esto con la finalidad de asegurar la calidad de la cebolla orgánica. Ademas usara el préstamo para comprar abono orgánico mineral. Su único objetivo es  dar a sus clientes cebolla de calidad sin perder la esencia natural de su cultivo.

loans.use: Para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo orgánico de cebolla

loans.name: Libetha

texts.en:
Libetha is 41 years old, married with four children.

Libetha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other snack foods.

Libetha has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Libetha aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other snack foods

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Maribel S. and I have been selling lottery tickets for Honduras\' small and large lottery drawings in my business for the last 5 years. This allows me to support my family. My customers are great and already a large majority of people in Honduras buy lottery tickets. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales, the profits will allow me to hire someone else to help me in my store.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maribel S. me dedico a la venta de loteria mayor y menor de honduras, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años y este me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en nuestro pais la mayoria de gente compra loteria, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que tenga poder contratar una persona para que me ayude a la venta de la loteria.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickest for both small and large lotteries in Honduras

loans.name: Juliet Grace

texts.en:
Grace is in a very unique business not often operated by women in this part of the world. As such, she is viewed by many women in her community as a role model. Grace is a widow with six children. Five children are in secondary school, and one is working as a teacher. She is a high school dropout and hasn’t undergone any training.

She started her business in 1994 to support her family and school-going children after her husband died. This is her second loan with PEMCI, but her first with Kiva. The first loan of $150 was used to equip her meat shop with essential equipment. With this second loan of $300, she plans to diversify her business into buying and selling cereals such as maize, beans, millet and other fodders.

Through her business, she has been able to promote her church's women's projects in the community. The women's groups are able to plant and export cereals. With time, other members of their A.C.K. church's women's group have been able to gain knowledge and skills and can now impart the skills in their own farms.

Grace is well educated for her community and is concerned in the uplifting of women's affairs. We see her as a key resource person for any other future interventions that PEMCI may wish to undertake with its partners in these communities. Grace is well-worth the support of Kiva partners.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter

loans.name: Parinaz

texts.en: Parinaz lives in Beylagan. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women's clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. Parinaz applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for her first loan in 2005 and borrowed $300 to increase her inventory. In 2006 she took out another loan of $600. Now she is asking for $1000 to expand her business even further.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat H. is divorced and lives with her mother. Her mother is her business partner. They have been selling garments for 20 years. From childhood, Salomat helped her mother to sell garments. Gradually her mother helped Salomat to open her own business place. Thanks to loans from MicroInvest, she was able to purchase goods for her business place. Today her stall is one of the best-known stalls in Chkalovsk.

Salomat has a wide assortment of modern garments and her goods are attractive. She has many constant clients and is always ready to help them to choose garments according their personal style. (She has good experience in that.)

Now Salomat and her mother have rented an additional stall in Gafurov, Khujand. This is one of the clothing markets in Khujand. They need another loan to use for purchasing garments for their new stall.

loans.use: Purchasing garments for a new place of business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Doña Sabina is a farmer and she also breeds cattle. The production of milk from her cattle is commercialized at "PIL Andina", "Planta Industrializadora de Leche", an industrialized milk factory.

She lives in the Community of Chuñochuñini, Laja sector, located three and a half hours from the town of La Paz. She lives with her husband and 4 children, 20, 18, 16, and 14 years of age who all help her out in her daily activities.

The loan will be used to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk.

It is her first loan through Impro and the evaluation qualifies her positively for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Sabina es agricultora y también cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Vive en la Comunidad de Chuñochuñini sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16,14 años respectivamente quienes le colaboran en sus diarias actividades.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to increase production of milk.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram Mamedov is 41 years old. He is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He is married and the father of two children. He lives with his parents. His parents are old. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He began his business with $200 in 2002. He works in the café situated in the Sumgayit. He wants to expand his business, so he would like to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his cafe. He had already gathered some money for it. But it is not enough, so he needs to borrow money.
Bayram would like to receive a $500 loan in order to repair his cafe and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living condition of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to repair his cafe and to buy necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Dima

texts.en: Dima is 36 years old and lives in the region of Lebanon known as Aley. She is a seamstress who makes curtains, and also works as a sales agent who sells different types of products that are popular in her area. Dima devotes her entire income to helping support her family. She has come to us for a loan to buy materials that she will use to make curtains for her customers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make curtains

loans.name: Susanah

texts.en: Susanah, 24, is a mother of 2 daughters. She is married to C., who sells vegetables at the market, and earns $20 a day. To support her family's needs, she sells sandals on credit door-to-door around villages, earning $40 a month. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Maria Ofelia lives in the city of Juarez, Nuevo Leon with her husband and their three children. She started her own business to help support her husband with the house expenses as well as the education of the children. She does catalog sales and slowly all her family (including her husband and kids) started getting involved and helping her by selling to colleagues and acquaintances.

Ofelia requires $475 which she will repay in 3 months in order to buy merchandise for her business. She and her family hope that with the support that they receive they will be able to prosper and make her business more successful.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

María Ofelia radica en la Ciudad de Juárez, Nuevo León vive con esposo quien es soldador y sus 3 hijos, ella inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus pequeños así como en gastos de la casa, se dedica a las ventas por catalogo poco a poco toda la familia se fue involucrando ayudándole a Ofelia tanto sus hijos como su esposo, vendiéndole a sus compañeros y conocidos.

Ofelia requiere US $475 que pagara a 3 meses para invertir en mercancía para su negocio, ella y su familia esperan que con el apoyo que reciban puedan seguir prosperando y hacer este negocio más exitoso.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Folake

texts.en:
Folake Y. is a wholesale distributor of charcoal. She buys her charcoal from Ogun State Market. She makes the three-hour journey by car four times each month. She lives in Ajangbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She acquired the skill of trading in 1½ years and has been in her business since 2001. She needs of a loan of $875 to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Moranak

texts.en:
Mr. Moranak T. works for a private company and lives Kosh Prak Village in Kandal Province. He does not have enough money to build a kitchen in his back yard, so Mr. Moranak T. applied for a loan that would enable him to build one for his family.

Mr. Moranak T. is 40 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend school; the others are too young to work or study. He previously obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to buy a new motorbike. His wife, Mrs. Chantheourn Samreth, is a grocer in the local village. Unfortunately, last year she got a gynecological disease and they spent $175 on treatment. The disease is recurring, and because of this Mr. Moranak T. does not have enough money saved to build the kitchen.

(Mr. Moranak T. is pictured with his wife and two youngest children; the other children were at school when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To build a kitchen in the back yard

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Mr. G. is a metal worker who lives in the district of DIAMAG. DE THIES. He is a specialist in making doors and windows that he sells to customers. For the goal of improving his income, he is asking for this loan in order to buy raw materials for fabricating tents, which he is going place on site for family ceremonies or functions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

mr G. est un menuisier métallique qui vit au quartier DIAMAG. DE THIES.il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes et fenetres qu'il revend à ses clients .c'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il demande ce pret pour acheter des matières premières avec lesquelles il pourra fabriquer des tentes qu'il va mettre en location lors des cérémonies familiales.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make tents to rent out

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Melba R. and I sell candy, snacks, and prepared breakfasts and lunches.  I am a native of Nacaome in the department of Valle.  I am a single mother of three adult children. 

I have 34 years of experience in this business; I started with a small snack business selling tacos, baleadas (tortillas with beans), quesadillas, tortillas with cheese, etc. and currently I run a cafeteria which is growing very quickly.  My cafeteria is located in the Calvario neighborhood, a centrally-located area with substantial foot traffic.  

My current goal is to supply my business in order to attend to my customers better and cover the increase in demand for my goods.  Now that my business has grown, so many customers come that sometimes I’m left without fast food to serve them.  This is why I am requesting a loan in order to continue growing my business since it is my only source of income to support my home. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Melba R. me dedico a la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos soy originaria de Nacaome, departamento de Valle, soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. 
tengo 34 años de experiencia en este negocio, comenze con una pequeña venta de golosinas como ser tacos, baleadas, quesadillas, tortillas con quesillo etc, y actualmente tengo un comedor el cual esta creciendo mucho y rapido. mi comedor esta ubicado en el barrio el Calvario, este es un  lugar centrico y muy transitado por muchas personas,  mi objetivo en este momento es surtir mucho mi negocio asi poder atender mejor mis clientes y cubrir con la demanda de los clientes ya que ahora vienen muchos clientes y me estoy quedando sin comida rapido, por tal razon deseo solicitar una ayuda para poder salir adelante con mi negocio que es unico que me da ingresos para poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, flour, bread, beans, coffee, soft drinks, dairy products, juices, oil, butter, salt, glasses, napkins, plates, rice, sugar, churros, eggs, lard, cheese, cold meats

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

Eulalia is partnered, is 32 years old, and has a 15-year old son. Eulalia lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the district of Carmen Alto. She sells potatoes from a stand at the market in her neighborhood. Eulalia travels to different towns to buy potatoes from producers, which she later sells at the market in Ayacucho at wholesale. The potatoes that she is not able to sell at wholesale, she sells at retail from her stand. In addition, Eulalia dedicates to farming potatoes on her lands in Tambocucho.

Eulalia needs a loan of 1,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of a variety of potatoes.

Eulalia’s dreams incluD. having her own home, running a well-stocked store, and that her children study at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo D. 15 años, Eulalia vive en casa D. sus padres ubicado en el distrito D. Carmen Alto, venD. papa en un puesto del mercado D. su distrito. Eulalia viaja a los diferentes pueblos para comprar papa D. los productores, luego lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho al por mayor y L. papa que no llega vender al por mayor lo venD. al por menor en su puesto. Además Eulalia se dedica a L. agricultura D. papa en sus terrenos D. Tambocucho.

Eulalia necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa variada.

Los sueños D. Eulalia son tener casa propia, una bodega surtida y que sus hijos estudien en L. universidad.

loans.use: Eulalia needs a loan of 1,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of a variety of potatoes.

loans.name: Celia Elida

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del BC “MUJERES TRABAJANDO II”,  vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Cacatachi. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos de pan llevar como plátanos, yuca y limones. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad de Tarapoto, en el cual tiene un puesto de venta. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará frutas como: plátanos en racimos, papayas, menestras de diferentes variedades, yuca, limones en sacos y productos que encuentra en oferta cuando sale a las chacras a comprar los productos para traerlos al mercado y ofertar a sus clientes. Celia manifiesta que tiene que surtir bien el negocio para asegurar las ventas.  

La señora Celia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y la de su suegra, quien la apoya en el cuidado de su pequeño hijo. Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad y surtir más el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Celia is a member of the “WORKING WOMEN II” group. She lives in the Peruvian province of San Martin, in the Cacatachi District. She sells fruits and other agricultural products such as plantains, yucca, and lemons. She sells her goods at a stall in Market no. 2 of the city of Taracoto.

With her loan of 800 soles (to be repaid in 4 months) she will buy goods such as plantain bunches, papayas, different kinds of legumes, yucca, sacks of lemons, and other products offered at the farms where she buys what she sells at the market. Celia declares that she has to properly stock up her stall in order to ensure her sales.

Ms. Celia is 31 years old, and she lives with her husband and their little son. She has the support of her husband and of her mother-in-law, who helps her take care of her young child. Her goal is to buy a house in the city, and to keep adding supplies to her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy goods such as plantain bunches, papayas, different kinds of legumes, yucca, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom N., who was born in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has one child. She is the economist in the Spitamen Khukumat, but she is also engaged in the livestock business to generate income for her family's well-being. In fact, she has been involved in the livestock business for her entire life because she helped her mother take care of home animals from an early age.

Specifically, she purchases and sells livestock for a living, and she has acquired invaluable business skills in operating such an enterprise. Currently, she is applying for a business development loan through Kiva in the amount of 2,100 STJ ($625) over 4 months to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try B. lives in Preak Talai Village in Kadal Province where she and her husband, Mr. Phy Sarin, are vegetable sellers. Since the business is doing well, they want to expand, so Try is requesting a loan to buy more vegetable to resell to her customers.

Mrs. Try B. is 36 years old and the mother of three children. two of whom are attending the local school while the third, at the age of five, is yet too young to attend.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to resell to her customers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George B. has a business where he sells and rents bicycles in Elmina. George attended school through junior high. He is married and has four children. His wife is a trader.

George has been selling and renting bicycles since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.

With this loan, he will buy more bicycles and parts to improve the efficiency of his business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to grow his savings so he can buy a piece of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles and parts

loans.name: Huong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hường  năm nay 55 tuổi, gia đình chị  có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán, kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển và đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Huong Thi P., 55 years old, has two small school-age children. In 2007 she joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in running a general store. The business has been growing day by day and brings the family an income of 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying goods and supplies to serve her customers in the upcoming Tet New Year's festival.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods and supplies to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana I. is 45 years old and she is married with 4 children. Christiana lives in Benin City, Edo state. She sells yams and garri. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs Kiva loan assistance to expand her business. She needs a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and garri to sell

loans.name: Begilia

texts.es: Begilia es una mujer muy querida y admirada en su barrio, tiene 41 años y vive muy feliz con su esposo Raúl de 45 años y con sus dos hijos, Erika de 10 y Alex de 8 años, en la casa que sus padres le dejaron. Begilia siempre fue muy trabajadora y desde muy pequeña aprendió a tejer artesanalmente, ahora lleva ya 13 años en su negocio, donde trabaja todos los días sin descanso, para mejorar su producción de tejidos a contratado a personas que al igual que ella gustan de tejer y así de esta manera hace crecer su negocio. Begilia disfruta de tejer, pero su pasión es hacerlo artesanalmente, aunque le resulta muy dificultoso realizar los acabados a las prendas que teje, anhela posteriormente tener un local adecuado para realizar sus tejidos, ya que actualmente lo hace en su casa. Es el cuarto préstamo de Begilia en MFP, y se siente en la capacidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y tiene pensado adquirir otros préstamos posteriormente. Begilia incrementará su mercadería con el dinero solicitado, gastará todo el dinero en comprar más cantidad de lana.
texts.en:
Begilia is a woman who is very loved and admired in her neighborhood. She is 41 years old and lives happily with her husband Raul, who is 45. They have two children, Erika who is 10 and Alex who is 8. They live in the house that her parents left them. Begilia has always been a hard worker and when she was young she learned how to weave handicrafts. Now she has been running her business for 13 years and works every day without rest. In order to increase production she has hired people who enjoy weaving, allowing her grow her business. Begilia enjoys weaving but her passion is to make handicrafts, even though it is very difficult to achieve the same finish as the garments she weaves. She would eventually like to have a proper location to make her textiles, which are currently made in her house. This is Begilia's fourth loan from MFP and she is confident that she will be able to make the payments on time. She is a very happy member of her community bank and has thought about obtaining more loans in the future. Begilia will increase her inventory with the money from the loan by using all of the money to purchase more wool.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool for her textiles

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
“Genesis” is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International.  This group, as a part of a larger, successful microfinance bank of 35 members, hopes to use their first microfinance loan to finance current businesses, or in the case of the group’s coordinator, Juana, finance a new entrepreneurial activity.  

Juana, mother of four (ages 18, 15, 14, and 12), resides in Santiago and plans to use her microfinance funds to finalize the opening of her variety-sales business.  Juana desires to purchase additional products, especially shoes and lotions, to sell to neighboring communities.  Juana desires to continue to provide for the physical needs of her family and spouse and hopes to see growth in her business throughout the term of her loan.

Other member’s of Juana’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities, including sales of clothing and fried food, or “quipe."

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase inventory for variety-sales business

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de su tío. Desde que tenía 15 años ayudaba a su padre en su oficio de artesano, su padre tejía mantas y frazadas, y ahora él viene realizando esta actividad. Se levanta a las 3.00am para avanzar con sus tejidos, y durante el día se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero solo durante las diferentes campañas en el año, para aprovechar la demanda, porque lo que a él le gusta es tejer. Esta actividad le ha permitido sustentar los gastos de su hogar, pero también tuvo épocas donde pasó malos momentos por la falta de venta de sus tejidos. Actualmente, lo que el produce durante la semana su esposa lo vende de forma ambulante los jueves y domingos a las ferias de la ciudad. Pero los anhelos de esta pareja es contar con un puesto propio para evitar que los estén moviendo de un lugar a otro durante sus ventas. Este es el primer préstamo de Víctor con MFP, y hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas mencionadas en su cronograma de pagos; además espera colaborar, en la medida de sus posibilidades, para el buen funcionamiento de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de lanas procesadas y sintéticas para sus tejidos, con otra parte comprará uniformes escolares para vender, debido a la demanda por el inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Victor is 40 years old, is married, and has 5 children. They are living in his uncle’s house. When he was 15 he started helping his father in his work as an artisan. His father wove blankets, and now Victor is doing the same. He gets up at 3:00 a.m. to work on his weavings. During the day he sells clothes. He only sells during certain times of the year when he can take advantage of the demand because what he likes is weaving. This has allowed him to pay the home expenses, but he has also had some bad times when his textiles did not sell. Now his wife sells what he makes. She works as a street vendor at city fairs on Thursdays and Sundays. The goal this couple has is to have their own stand to avoid being moved from one place to another during their sales. This is Victor’s first loan with MFP. He promises to make all of his payments on time. He wants to work together as best as he can to help his community bank. The loan is to buy processed wool and synthetics for his weavings. Because there is high demand at the beginning of classes, he will also buy school uniforms to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy S., 35, and her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Khiev, 42, who live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have no children. She also has her father living with her.

Chanthy and her husband have been growing rice for ten years. Besides growing rice they also sell vegetables. They buy them from the other villages for resale in the Phnom Penh market.

Chanthy is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the senior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Christiana works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school needs. Her husband is a cocoa farmer while she is a trader.

Christiana trades in foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs such as maize, yam, cassava, plantain, etc. all the way from Techiman in the northern sector. She sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 46 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos. Tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 4 años en su misma casa, aprovechando que está ubicada en una avenida bien transitada, por lo que tiene gran demanda para realizar cortes de cabello, y su destreza para elaborar bellos peinados y tratamientos de belleza es muy reconocida, por lo que su clientela nueva es recomendada por sus clientes regulares. Edith quiere ser una de las mejores estilistas de su localidad, es por ello que se esmera en cada trabajo que realiza; y para el futuro quiere tener un salón de belleza muy grande en una zona más céntrica de su ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual en los pagos y muy responsable en las tareas que le asignen en su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de espejos y productos para los tratamientos de belleza que necesita incorporar en su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Edith is 46 years old and lives in her parents' home with her two children. She has run a beauty salon for the past four years out of the home for the past four years, taking advantage of the location on a well-traveled avenue. For this reason, her haircuts are in high demand and her skill in hair colorings and beauty treatments is well known, so she gets a lot of new clients recommended by her regular customers. Edith wants to be one of the best stylists in her area, and this is why she works very hard on every job she does. In the future she wants to have a much larger salon in a more central area of her city. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments and very responsible with the tasks she is assigned from the group. The money she is requesting will be used for the purchase of mirrors and hair treatment products that she needs to incorporate into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mirrors and other beauty products

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
A. Davron is a married father with two children. Davron has been a farmer for the last 5 years. Farming is a passion for him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing his land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant all his land.

Davron is requesting a loan of 800 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Yudith Mercedes

texts.es:
Yudith es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Yudith es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Yudith es Cosmiatra, tiene un centro de masaje y tratamiento en su casa, tiene clientes fijos, brinda servicios de tratamiento de piel, reducciones, entre otros tratamientos. Yudith además tiene una lavandería en su casa para lo cual tiene un personal que se encarga de la atención.
Yudith necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas para los tratamientos.
Los sueños de Yudith son tener un spa bien implementado y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Violet Communal Bank. She is single, 25 years old and has one daughter. Judith is a cosmetologist. She has a massage and treatment center in her house. She provides her steady customers with skin treatments as well as other cosmetic treatments. Judith also has a Laundromat in her house. She has an employee that manages the Laundromat. Judith needs a loan of six hundred soles that she will use to purchase creams for her skin treatments. Judith’s dreams are to have a well-equipped spa and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams for her skin treatments

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

   Назокат Турсунова добрая и милая женщина 47 лет, проживает вместе со своим мужем и 4 детьми в Зафарабадском районе. Назокат имеет 9 летний стаж работы в предпринимательской деятельности. На данный момент она реализует мужскую обувь и мужскую одежду. В бизнесе ей помогают ее старшие сыновья. 
   Назокат хочет дополнительно к своему товару купить женскую обувь и женскую верхнюю одежду, с этой целью она запрашивает кредит в размере 3000 сомони. Место ее деятельности рынок «Дусти».
texts.en:
Nazokat T. is a kind and sweet 47-year-old woman, who lives with her husband and 4 children in the Zafarabad district. Nazokat has 9 years of experience in the entrepreneurial field. Currently, she sells men’s shoes and men’s clothing. Her older sons help her with the business. Her place of business is the Dusti market. Nazokat wants to add women’s shoes and women’s outerwear to her merchandise. She is requesting a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to achieve this goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Ines C. is preparing to receive her seventh loan with Esperanza. She has been working for several years with her niece, operating a beauty parlor. Her niece primarily cuts and colors hair, while Ines’ main job is providing hair products such as shampoos, conditioners, gels, etc. The business has been successful for the two, as Ines has returned to Esperanza several times, and each time she has requested a larger loan.

Through the fist six loans, Ines has been with Esperanza for almost four years, and during those four years she has maD. significant changes in her life. She recently bought a freezer with her savings, and has maD. other improvements to her home. She currently lives alone, and when I asked her if she wanted to make any other improvements in the future, she told me she wanted to find a husband and then asked me to join her. This led to abrupt laughter from the entire group. She was only kidding, and she reiterated her desire to improve her home and her business. Her next step is to buy cinder blocks to surround her house, because they proviD. better support in the event of a strong storm.

As each day passes, Ines and her niece are expanding their customer base. Ines explained to me that women in the Dominican Republic spend a lot on their appearance, so she believes there is no reason for her business to suffer. She sees an increasing demand for her products and plans on providing the needed supply.

loans.use: The purchase of shampoos, conditioners, gels, and other beauty products

loans.name: Cherry Lyn

texts.en: Cherry Lyn B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Cherry Lyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Cherry Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Cherry Lyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann M. is 56 years old and lives in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She has six children who are still living with her in the family home, and who are working in different occupations.

Chann M. and her husband earn a living as charcoal sellers. The family owns a brick-oven next to their house where they make charcoal for sale. They always go to buy small pieces of carving wood from the forest people and burn them into charcoal at their house.

Chann M. said that her daily living conditions are not so good because she always faces a problem where the roof of her house is cracking frequently. She is therefore requesting a loan to replace the broken parts.

loans.use: To replace the broken parts of her roof

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Actualmente tiene 26 años, es casada y con 2 hijos. Aún son pequeños, su esposo confecciona playeras y los dos cubren los gastos de la casa. Tiene una tienda de consumo diario, pero la mayor venta es de aguas gaseosas ya que ella distribuye en el sector de su casa. El préstamo que necesita es para seguir creciendo en su negocio, ampliar su tienda y comprar más gaseosas y así tener surtido. Sus metas siempre serían agrandar el negocio y salir adelante con el, teniendo más clientes y no quedarles mal por no tener lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
She is 26, married, and has two small children. Her husband makes t-shirts, and they both cover the household expenses. She has a convenience store. Carbonated water is what she sells the most. She distributes in the area of her house. The loan that she needs is to keep growing in her business, to expand her store, and to buy more soft drinks in order to have them in stock. Her goals are always to make her store bigger and to get ahead with it, to have more customers, and not to be in their disfavor by not having what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the store

loans.name: Badamsuren

texts.en:
B. Badamsuren is 27 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in Hovd province in western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Badamsuren operates a transport business in his province. He owns a large truck and is hired by people and businesses to transport goods throughout the province. Badamsuren started his business in 2006 and has found success as a truck driver. Today, he transports a variety of imported and exported goods, such as animal skin, construction materials, consumer goods, etc., back and forth between the Chinese border. In the winter, Badamsuren also purchases and transports coal which he sells to local residents and businesses, with many of whom he has contracts. In the future, he hopes to continue to expand and improve his business so that he can provide for his family. He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts and coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts and coal to resell

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo, la señora María Lourdes L. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías y adornos las que son comercializadas en su propia localidad donde muy amablemente ofrece los productos con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bisuterías y los adornos para continuar ofreciéndolos a sus clientes y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio que poco a poco va en desarrollo.
texts.en:
With great effort María Lourdes tends to her costume jewelry and decorations sales which she graciously conducts from her own home with the purpose of earning income to pay for household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase costume jewelry and decorations so that she can continue to offer them to her customers thereby improving her always developing business' conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and decorations.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 35 years old and married to Teody P.. The couple is blessed with five children: Rafael, 21; Teoderick, 19; Cherry Mae, 19; Jay Mark, 12; Veronica, 7. They live in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. The couple's main sources of income are from farming. They earn 30,000 PHP every cropping, and 2,000 PHP from hog-raising. Teody also cultivates their parcel of rice farm.

Rebecca has a store in their village, which brings her a net weekly income of 700 PHP. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 14,000 PHP as additional capital to maintain the store. According to Rebecca, the principle of her life is "We must do our very best and God will do the rest."

loans.use: As additional capital to maintain her store

loans.name: Ichel

texts.en: Ichel M. is from the village of Lower Irasan. She is 23 years old and is engaged. Ichel owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members such as motor cab for passengers. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ichel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Ichel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase grocery stocks for her new sari-sari (variety) store business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.
