It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her new sari-sari store

loans.name: Rubertina Liucadia

texts.es:
La señora Rubertina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 2 años, del distrito, provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió hasta primaria incompleta, tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Rubertina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, huevos.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For two years Señora Rubertina has been partner in the Communal Bank "Las Kantutas" in the district and province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old and lives with her partner but they don't have children. She did not complete elementary school. She has a grocery store. Rubertina tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for 300.00 nuevos soles, she was be able to increase her working capital to buy rice, sugar and noodles. She will seek a loan of 2200.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy merchandise like: sugar, rice, noodles and eggs. Her dream for the future is to have her own car. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, eggs

loans.name: Yoel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yoel tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y próximamente tendrá su primer hijo. Vive junto a su esposa en el sector Chuin del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace cuatro años, con los ahorros de su trabajo en una empresa agrícola de la zona, compró una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que trabajaba durante sus tiempos libres. Hace dos años fue cesado de su puesto y desde entonces se ha dedicado exclusivamente a trabajar con su vehículo. Por otro lado eventualmente también trabaja como obrero agrícola. Con estos ingresos el sostiene la economía de su familia.

Debido al tiempo de uso la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas, por lo que Yoel se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Yoel desea brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajao con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad  y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yoel is 25, married, and will soon has his first child. He lives with his wife in the Chuin sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. Four years ago he used his savings from working at a regional agricultural business to buy a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). He worked with it during his free time. Two years ago his position was eliminated, and since then he has been working exclusively with his vehicle. He occasionally works as a field worker as well. He supports his family with these incomes. Due to the amount of time he uses the mototaxi it has started to have problems. That is why Yoel has seen the need to ask, for his first time, for a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan for repair and maintenance on his vehicle. Yoel wishes to give his child a good quality of life. He has worked with our Institution previously, and he has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repair and maintenance of his mototaxi

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en: Taleb is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has been working as a farmer since 2000. He cooperates with his five brothers to make a good income for the family. Taleb is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy merchandise, such as fertilizer, tools, and supplies that he needs for his farm.

loans.use: To buy items for his farm, such as fertilizer, tools and supplies

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida es una mujer muy alegre de 33 años, vive con su esposo Manuel, de 35 años, y con sus  2 hijos: Karina de 14 y Arnol de 6 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en un lejano pueblo de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 15 años, junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar maíz, papa, arveja, habas y flores de gladiolo en sus terrenos propios y en otros arrendados.  A Nerida le gusta toda la actividad agrícola, pues considera que es bastante rentable ya que le permite vivir cómodamente sin preocupaciones. Es por eso que para el futuro desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y sembrar en mayor cantidad, también quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad, porque su hija pasará a la secundaria y necesitará estar donde hay colegios de este nivel académico para continuar con sus estudios.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota; a su vez, está contenta de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son sus vecinos y siempre están pendientes de ella.  Nerida tiene pensado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de dos sacos de abono y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Nerida is a very cheerful 33-year-old woman, who lives with her husband Manuel, age 35, and their 2 children: Karina, age 14, and Arnol, age 6. They live in their own home in an isolated village in the Peruvian highlands. For the past 15 years, Nerida has worked as a farmer, together with her husband, growing corn, potatoes, peas, beans and gladiolus flowers on their own lands and on rented fields. Nerida enjoys all of her agricultural work; she considers it very worthwhile, since it lets her live comfortably and without worries. For this reason, in the future she wants to buy more agricultural land and plant greater quantities of crops. She would also like to open a food store in the city, because her daughter will be starting secondary school, and she will need to be where there are schools at this academic level to continue her studies. This is Nerida's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to making every payment on time. She enjoys working with the members of her communal bank, because they are her neighbors and they are always looking out for her. Nerida is planning to invest the funds she is currently requesting to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 46 años, anteriormente había realizado financiamiento con Fundación León 2000 que han sido de muy buena ayuda. Ella se dedica a una pulpería y también a ofrecer el servicio de triciclos, por lo que ha logrado administrar muy bien su negocio ya que es por medio de esto que ha obtenido otro medio de ingresos para sustentar a su familia, pero continúa con su humilde actividad la pulpería. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo como es la compra de jugos, refrescos naturales, golosinas en general, pan, galletas, detergentes, jabón entre otros productos para el hogar. Su deseo es establecer una distribuidora que sea muy reconocida por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is 46 years old and has previously received a loan from Fundación León 2000 which has been of great help to her. She owns and runs a general store and also rents tricycles. She was able to run her first business so well that she was able to start another to receive additional revenue to support her family while still running her first business. She is seeking this loan for working capital to buy juice, natural sodas, soda in general, bread, cookies, detergent, soap and other household goods. Her goal is to establish a full grocery store with a good reputation.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - groceries

loans.name: Cristelyn

texts.en:
Cristelyn S. is from the village of Purok 4, Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Cristelyn is separated from spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cristelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is the wife of a banker. At 39 years old, she owns a bar in Karuguuza, Uganda, which she has operated for the last fifteen years.

Though Christine encounters a challenge of retiring late from work, she hopes to see her business grow into a bigger bar and finally into an established hotel (restaurant) because, through the profits from her bar, she has been able to construct a commercial building to increase her family’s income.

Christine plans to use the HOFOKAM loan to purchase more alcohol to sell in the bar and to add take-away food services, too.

loans.use: To purchase more alcohol to sell and to add take-away food services

loans.name: Pruon

texts.en: Mrs. Pruon L. is 37 years old and raises pigs and vegetables from which she earns a living. Her husband, Mr. Reiy Norb, is a 33-year-old local fisherman. They live together in a commune of Siem Reap Province. With her businesses, Pruon L. typically earns around $2 a day, while her husband usually earns around $3 a day. They have two young kids at home. In order to expand her business and increase their income, Pruon L. needs a loan of $200 to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Zobeida Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Zobeida del Socorro M. M. tiene 27 años es soltera y habta en el Barrio de la Borgoña, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años.

Uno de sus prioridades a futuro está la remodelación de su casa de habitación. Dentro de los principales problemas que han tenido las tierras esta la sequia y el ataque de plagas que amenaza con la producción de la piña, razón por la cual solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos para la siembra así como también fungicidas o plaguicidas, estos materiales garantizaran una cosecha de buena calidad que le permita mejores condiciones financieras para la inversión de nuevos proyectos de vida que les favorezcan económico-socialmente.
texts.en:
Zobeida del Socorro M. M. is 27 years old and single. She lives in the Borgoña neighborhood, and she has worked in agriculture for the past 5 years. One of her priorities for the future is remodeling the house where she lives. Among the main problems she has faced have been drought and attacks of pests which threaten her pineapple crop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy cuttings for planting as well as fungicides or other pest control preparations. These will ensure a good-quality harvest, improving her financial situation and allowing her to invest in new projects which will help her socio-economically.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cuttings for planting and fungicides or pest control preparations

loans.name: Xoljuyup 2 Group

texts.es: El crédito solicitado serán utilizado para ampliación de capital de la actividad a las que se dedican cada uno de las integrantes del   Grupo  por lo que se le considera  una inversión rentable ya que ellas venden ropa tipica, y viendo la necesidad de apliar màs sus negocio acuden a la asociaciòn ASDIR para el apoyo de dicha ampliaciòn y para poder supera y tener màs ganancias tener superaciòn pasar otro nivel de vida,  mejorar relatan las mujeres trabajadoras.-
texts.en:
The requested loan will be used to increase the capital in the activities in which each of the members of the group are involved. It is considered to be a profitable investment because they sell typical clothing. Seeing the need to expand their businesses, they come to the ASDIR Asociación for help with this expansion. They want to be able to do well and have more income. These hard-working women say that they want to excel in order to have an improved standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Family (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Family está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que buscan el bienestar para sus familias viven en la ciudad de Cuenca urbe considerada cuna de artistas y deportistas, tienen varios atractivos turísticos como sus hermosos templos, los ríos que bañan la urbe, sus artesanías, paisajes y calidez de  la gente hacen una ciudad para volver a visitarla. La mayoría de sus integrantes son familias que se agruparon para mejorar su situación económica y familiar.

La  señora Gloria O. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca  con su esposo que es artesano en joyería  y tiene su propio taller y con dos de sus cinco hijos ya que los tres mayores son casados y viven independientes, su cuarto hijo trabaja en una mecánica y  su última hija trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos medio tiempo y por la tarde se dedica a la venta de bisutería, sus dos hijos le ayudan un poco económicamente con los gastos del hogar y pago de arriendo porque aun no tienen casa propia.

Gloria se dedica a realizar quehaceres domésticos hace 10 años, y también elabora tejidos como carteras, bufandas, etc.  Esta labor la aprendió sola y lleva 2 años realizando estas manualidades, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hilo  y lanas para sus tejidos, su mayor sueño es llegar  a tener una casa propia.

María Rosario  Sánchez  es otra de las socias de éste banco, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  es una mujer  muy alegre  tiene 65 años de edad se encuentra viuda hace 10 años a causa de un atropellamiento a su esposo, en su unión conyugal concibió  seis hijos de ellos cinco  son casados y viven de manera independiente, solo su hijo soltero le ayuda económicamente y con el pago del arriendo de la casa. Nuestra socia se encuentra muy preocupada ya que a su hijo le atropello un vehiculo cuando tenida 12 años ahora tiene 29 años de edad y le han detectado un tumor en su celebro.

María Rosario se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de frutas en el mercado 9 de Octubre, esta actividad la realiza hace 42 años trabajando de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., no tiene un puesto propio por lo que es una vendedora ambulante, con su crédito va a comprar  naranjas, manzanas, naranjillas, melón, etc. 

Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Family” communal bank is composed of a group of enterprising women who work hard to secure their families’ wellbeing; they all live in Cuenca, a city considered to be the birthplace of artists and sports heroes. It has several tourist attractions like: beautiful churches, the rivers that bathe the city, its crafts, scenery and the warmth of its inhabitants, all of which make it a city that you want to return to for another visit. Most of its members are families that grouped together to improve their family and economic situation. Gloria O. lives in downtown Cuenca with her husband who is a jewelry craftsperson who has his own shop, and two of their five children since the three oldest are adult, married and living independently. Her fourth son works in a machine shop and her youngest daughter works half time doing domestic chores and half time selling costume jewelry. Both children help a bit financially with household expenses and rent because she still does not own a house of her own. Gloria has been a domestic employee for 10 years but also weaves purses, scarves, etc. She taught herself how to weave and has been making these crafts for 2 years. She will use the funds to buy thread and wool for her weavings. Her greatest wish is to have a house of her own. María Rosario S., 65, is another group member. She lives in downtown Cuenca and is a very cheerful woman who has been widowed for 10 years; her husband was run over and killed. She had 6 children five of whom are married and live independently; her only single son helps out financially and with rent payments. She is very worried because her son was hit by a car when he was 12 years old; he’s now 29 and has been diagnosed with a brain tumor. María Rosario has sold all kinds of fruit in the 9 de Octubre market for 42 years; she is open for business from Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm. She does not have a stall of her own so she sells by wandering through the aisles of the market. She will use the funds to buy oranges; her goal is to have a house of her own some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and fruits like: apples, oranges, melons, mandarin oranges, etc.

loans.name: Martha Agripina

texts.es:
Martha Agripina M. tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada y tiene seis hijos. Reside en Juticalpa en el Barrio Lempira y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Tres Mariposas. Hace tres años Martha comenzo vendiendo tortillas y poco a poco con el apoyo de los prestamos de FAMA a ido creciendo su negocio y ahora tiene una pulperia que funciona en una parte de su casa. Su sueño es que dentro de algun tiempo se convierta en un minisuper y que sus hijos se superen y sigan sus estudios. 

Con los prestamos anteriores comenzo a construir un muro alrededor de su casa pero no tenia suficiente fondos para terminarlo. Con el nuevo prestamo comprara malla ciclon, postes de metal, bloques y bolsas de cemento para terminar de construirlo. 

Con el muro completo Martha y su familia se sentiran mas seguros, la vivienda se vera mas bonita y sus clientes se sentiran en un ambiente mas agradable. Martha ha sido una buena clienta de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha Agripina M. is 51 years old. She is married and has six children. She lives in the Lempira neighborhood of Juticalpa and is a member of the Las Tres Mariposas [the three butterflies] solidarity group. Three years ago Martha starting selling tortillas and little by little with the support of the loans from FAMA has grown her business. She now has a small grocery store that she runs out of her house. Her dream is that soon she will be able to convert to a mini supermarket and that her children will be successful and continue their studies. With the previous loans she started to build a wall around her house but she didn't have enough money to finish it. With this new loan she will buy chicken wire, metal posts and blocks and bags of.cement to finish building the wall. When the wall is finished Martha and her family will feel much safer, their home will be more beautiful and her clients will feel that her store has a more agreeable location. Martha has been a good client of FAMA's and has always made her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken wire, metal posts and blocks and bags of concrete to build a wall..

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan es un joven emprendedor de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su bebe de 3 añitos llamada Fiorela, quien es su gran motivo para salir adelante. Todos ellos viven en una casa  que le cedieron sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica, es el trasporte público, es así que gracias a su gran esfuerzo adquirió una moto en el cual brinda este servicio desde hace 3 años, generándole los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Pero su trabajo no es tan fácil como parece pues requiere de gran esfuerzo físico para poder movilizar su vehículo por las calles de su zona que en su mayoría son muy arenosas, habiéndose quedado estancado varias veces en la arena. En un futuro él tiene pensado con un socio poner un local de reparación de motos pues ha ganado gran experiencia en este rubro, él espera poder concretar sus metas pues quiere darle a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunas herramientas y demás cosas que le son necesarias para comenzar con su sueño de poner un taller.
texts.en:
28-year old Jhonatan is an enterprising young man who lives with his wife and little daughter, 3-year old Fiorela. She is the big reason why he wants to get on in life. They all live in a house which was given to him by his parents. Jhonatan works in transportation. Through hard work he managed to acquire a motorbike which he has used to transport the public for three years and thus earn money to support his family. However, his work isn’t as easy as it seems. It requires a lot of physical effort to be able to drive the bike through the streets of his neighbourhood, many of which are made of sand. He has got stuck many times. As for the future, Jhonatan is thinking of opening a motorbike repair workshop with a partner as he has gained a lot of experience in this line of work. He hopes to fulfill this goal as he wants to provide his daughter with a good standard of living. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP and he expects to pay back the loan on time. With the money he will buy some tools and other necessary items so he can get started on his dream of opening a repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools for his new motorbike repair shop

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana V. is a 56-year-old maried woman who supports her family by engaging in three businesses: a general store, water refilling, and electronic reloading. She lives in Brgy. Dapitan Cordova, Cebu City with her 60-year-old husband, David, who works as a tricycle driver and their 32-year-old child who has a family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since June of 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Luciana is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can expand her general store, water refilling and electronic reloading businesses. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Luciana aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
A. Aziza is a hardworking and responsible woman. Twelve years ago she decided to start her own business to provide for her family. Ever since she has been selling clothes and shoes for women. This activity has also permitted her to make time available to be with her children. To increase her sales, Aziza requests a loan of $1000 US, which she will use to buy merchandise that is on sale; she will then resell it at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base. You can be an important enabler of Aziza's accomplishments. She needs your help to grow her business and improve the quality of living of her family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Clothing and shoe store inventory

loans.name: David Ochieng

texts.en:
David has been in the quarry business in Naivasha town for the last six years. Quarrying is a very common activity in the Naivasha region. He is 35 years old, married to Caroline Achieng, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 1st loan.  He plans to buy another piece of land for stone extraction.

David hopes to own many extraction sites which will increase his output so that he can meet the demands of his clients.

loans.use: To buy another piece of land.

loans.name: Mukhtayaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran is the wife of K. M. and resides in a city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is a city famous for its dairy business.  A very caring lady, Mukhtayaran manages the household chores by staying at home. She gets up early, cleans the house and prepares the breakfast for her family. She is also a very supportive lady. She supports her family members in their work. Her in-laws also live with her. She helps her mother-in-law in her embroidery business by making embroidered dresses to complete her orders on time. 

Her husband is involved in the animal selling business. He buys animals, fattens them up, and then resells them to his customers for meat. He has been in this line of work for the last seven years. He specifically deals with goats.  His clientele is made up of butchers because they sell goat meat in their butcher shops. They give him orders because he has a good knowledge of animal breeds and sells them a quality product.

Mukhtayaran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will buy the animals (goats) and fill the orders of his customers.  Mukhtayaran is hopeful that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to earn a lot on each goat sale.

loans.use: Purchase animals (goats) for reselling

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel T. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old. Maribel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter de 46 años, tiene una tienda de víveres,  vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes. 

Inicio su negocio hace 8 años atrás con unos ahorros que tenia por haber trabajado en una obra de construcción. Ahora trabaja en su tienda de víveres desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, vende bebidas, granos, lácteos etc.    

El quiere continuar con su negocio por es quiere comprar bebidas, arroz y juguetes para venderlos a los niños. En el futuro quiere tener mas variedad en los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Walter is 46 years old and has a general store. He lives in an urban zone called Guasmo, known for its large number of resident merchants. He started his business eight years ago with the money he earned while working in construction. Now he works in his store from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily. He sells drinks, grains, milk products, etc. In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy drinks, rice, and toys to sell to the children. In the future he wants to be able to offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Raggal Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité RAGGAL YALLA est créé à la veille de l'ouverture du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA SUD le 27 septembre 2009. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et proximité et ont toutes le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de leur terroir. 

Madame NDAWA S. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et également tutrice de 02 deux enfants (une nièce et un neveu)

Elle gère une cantine au marché central de son quartier. Une cantine où elle divers produits alimentaires et vestimentaires.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement en marchandise afin d'accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The Raggal Yalla solidarity group was set up the day before the opening of the Banc Villageois in Keur Serigne Louga Sud on 27th September 2009. It is made up of 22 women who all live in the same neighborhood, and who are all friends or neighbors with the same interest of developing local business.

Mrs. Ndawa S., who is standing on the far right of the photo is in charge of the group. She is 40 years old, married and mother to seven children, as well as being guardian to two other children (a niece and nephew). 

She has a van at the central market in her neighborhood, from which she sells various food products and clothing. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her capacity to stock up with goods in order to increase her profit margin.

Her goal is to help her husband to improve the family's living conditions, in terms of food and health for example.

loans.use: To get supplies for her van

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor S. is from the town of Surallah. She is 53 years old. Eleanor is married and has six children. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. She also plants fruits, like pomelo, on some parts of her land. Eleanor is happy to share that she now has a sari-sari (general) store where she sells a variety of different products. She also sells her harvest of rice and fruit at her store.

Eleanor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleanor has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm, and additional merchandise to sell at her general store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice D. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.  Alice is 26 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a member of Faulu Kenya, in the Bidii Traders group.  Since he joined the group, he has become focused on developing his butchery, which currently has three employees.  He has twelve years of experience running the business and hopes to open a meat processing plant in five years.  He has requested 60, 000 KES to buy a freezer for preserving meat.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Shiela Alona

texts.en:
Mrs. Shiela Alona R. is from the Barangay of P8 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married; although, she is currently separated from her husband. They have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. To make a living, Shiela sells fish. She has been engaged in this kind of business for the past five years. She currently earns an average of more than 15,000 PHP per month.  

In 2009, Shiela Alona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Shiela Alona is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be her third loan. She will use the loan as additional capital for her existing business selling fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family (meeting their basic needs), to save for the future, to make loan payments, to educate her children, and possibly to expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

location.town: Ozamis-P8 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta R. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Loreta is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like junk foods & beverages. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Lami

texts.fr: Mme Lami a 5 enfants  et est mariée à un commerçant. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Née à Sotouboua mais habite quartier Agoè. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend les produits dans une boutique à son domicile. Elle cumule 10 ans dans cette activité. L’objet du crédit permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de riz, 15 cartons de tomate, 50 paquets de couche pour enfant et 5 cartons de sardine.
texts.en: Mrs Lami has five children and is married to a retailer. She is 40 years old. She was born in Sotouboua, but lives now in the neighborhood of Agoè. She sells grocery goods. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and resells her goods at home in her store. She has been for 10 years in this activity. The purpose of this loan is to enable her to buy 20 sacks of rice, 15 boxes of tomatoes, 50 packs of diapers and 5 boxes of sardines.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en: Thoem Y. is a married woman living in Kompong Cham province.   She has a knitting business, working from her house to earn income. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop with her husband. They have five children: four are single and one is married. Two of the children worked as goldsmiths, earning about $100 per month, and contribute some of this income to help the family meet its daily expenses.  Most of their finished products are jewelry made from gold. Unfortunately, their existing equipment to make jewelry are broken in the process of daily use, affecting their business.  To help her chilren, Thoem Y. has requested a loan to buy new equipment to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy new jewelry making equipment

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Sido, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire la restauration, le commerce d’arachides grillées, le commerce des glacières et des tasses thermos avec Chata D.. Elles sont à leurs onzièmes prêts de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Chata D., compte acheter, 20 douzaines de glacières (grand, petit et moyen modèle), 10 cartons de tasses thermos, 10 cartons de verre à café et  20 douzaines de cuillères.
Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé capitale de la république du Togo pour les revendre  en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Sido à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma Group is composed of four married women, who on average are 35 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

To better serve their customers and increase their business activity, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They run a restaurant and sell roasted groundnuts; Chata D. sells iceboxes and thermos cups. This is their eleventh group loan and all their previous loans have been repaid on schedule.

Chata D. intends to use her loan to buy 20 dozens of iceboxes (large, medium and small size), 10 boxes of thermos cups, 10 boxes of coffee glasses and 20 dozens of spoons. She gets her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and retails her goods at the market in Sido, for cash or credit, to a clientele usually made up of women.

She expects to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs a month. Part of it will be used to repay the loan and any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food utensils

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Meriam G., 34 years of age, is a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City Mis. Occ. She is married to Amileto G., an OFW (overseas filipino worker). They are blessed with one child who is now in elementary school. She raises her child by the allotment of her husband. 

Meriam joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2008 because she is very much interested with our products and services and for being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. She was on her 4th cycle of loan availment and she was given a privilege to avail an amount of P50,000.00 as her 4th cycle loan availment for the processing on their Land Title documents.

loans.use: Land Title Documents

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señorita Lupita como D. cariño le dicen sus amigos y familiares, ella es originaria D. la localidad D. San Felipe D. los Alzati que se encuentra ubicado en el Estado D. Michoacán. Cuenta con 24 años D. edad,  le ha echado ganas para surtir su negocio D. abarrotes ambulante ya que venD. sus productos como son jabón, frijol, papel higiénico, azúcar, aceite, harina, chiles, shampoo  y otros productos D. primera necesidad en los tianguis D. diferentes pueblos D. la región como son Angangueo, El Rosario, Zirahuato, Melchor Ocampo entre otros. Comenta que ella empezó con este tipo D. negocio porque sus papas le enseñaron desD. muy pequeña ya que ellos tenían su puesto ambulante D. abarrotes y D. frutas y verduras. Comenta que su negocio lo tiene aproximadamente hace 10 años, ella se surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas en el municipio D. Zitacuaro, Michoacán y en Toluca  Estado D. México. Ella quiere mejorar su casa ya que en tiempo D. lluvias se le mete el agua porque es D. lámina. Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con la manutención por que dice: “Ellos ya son grandes a hora me toca a mí y a mis hermanos ayudarlos como alguna vez lo hicieron con nosotros”. Una D. sus metas es poder comprar una camioneta para poder trasladarse a los diferentes tianguis a donD. va a vender sus productos, otro D. sus sueños es poder tener aparte del negocio ambulante tener un negocio estable para ayudar a sus papas para que ellos lo atiendan y no salgan D. su casa porque dice que andar vendiendo en los tianguis es muy pesado por que se tienen que levantar a las dos o tres D. la mañana para trasladarse al lugar donD. venden su mercancía. Dice que con sus ganancias va a invertir en fruta D. temporada y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Srta. Lupita, as she is affectionately called by her friends and relatives, is originally from the town of San Felipe D. Los Alzati in the State of Michoacán. She is 24 years old. Lupita is able to keep her mobile grocery business stocked with products such as soap, beans, toilet paper, sugar, oil, flour, chili peppers, shampoos, and other basic necessities. Lupita sets up her business at the local markets in different towns within the region such as Angangueo, El Rosario, Zirahuato, Melchor Ocampo, and other locations. She says she started this type of business because her parents taught her at a young age since they operated mobile grocery stores and sold fruits and vegetables. Lupita has been in business for approximately ten years. She acquires her products from different stores in the towns of Zitacuaro, Michoacán, and Toluca in the State of Mexico.

Lupita wants to improve her home because water seeps in during the rainy season since the structure is maD. of laminate sheeting. She is single and lives with her parents who help with the expenses. Lupita says, “Now that my parents are older, my siblings and I want to support them in the same manner as they did with us.” One of her goals is to buy a truck so that she can travel to the different markets where she sells her products. She also dreams of helping her parents by starting another mobile business that they can manage near their home because traveling to the different markets can be tiring since one must wake up at 2 or 3am in order to get to the place where the merchandise is being sold. Lupita says she will use her earnings to invest in seasonal fruits and make improvements to her living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her mobile grocery business

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teodora R. y la Sra. Teresa V., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, invitaron a sus amigas y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18 (Díez y Ocho) integrantes.
La sra. Teresa es una vendedora de frutas y verduras, y como se aproxima la estación de otoño necesita ampliar las variedades cítricas de sus productos ofertados, por ello solicita el crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras de esta clasificación.
Son mujeres muy humildes y todas desean superar la pobreza en la que se encuentran ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
This committee was formed after Sras. Teodora R. and Teresa V. visited the office of Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. They invited their friends who decided to join their work group so that they could improve their lifestyles. There are 18 members in this group.

Sra. Teresa is a fruit and vegetable vendor. Since the autumn season is approaching, she needs to expand the variety of citrus fruits that she offers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more fruits of this type as well as vegetables.

These women are extremely humble. They all want to rise above the poverty that they and their families are currently experiencing.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own on the outskirts of the city. Two of her children go to a local school and the third child goes to a kindergarten. 

Her husband works as a miller and Naranchimeg sells beauty products. She began selling cosmetics and stationery in 2006.  She rents a stall at a local market and her current inventory is worth 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She purchases cosmetics and stationery from China twice a month. She is a hardworking and modest person. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT in order to increase her working capital and purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa A. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 27 years old. Melissa is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Melissa owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish like sardines & mackerel. She uses a motorela for transportation, in the local community. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like milk fish & sardines. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like milk fish & sardines, to sell.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut P. got a loan of Rp. 1,300,000. It will be used to buy five piglets. At the time of lending, there were two people who could not attend. They are Ni Made M., because her son is in hospital, and another one, Ni Putu E., had gone to Denpasar. 

Ni Ketut P. and her husband are very grateful to get another loan from MUK. Every month Ni Ketut P. spends the money she makes using the loans to pay family expenses: electricity and water Rp. 100,000 and for the kitchen Rp. 300,000. Ni Ketut P. and all members of the Kucup Mekar group really hope that their efforts can be successful and they can support themselves independently.

loans.use: To buy five piglets.

loans.name: Karubanda Twimukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Lauben M. is the leader of the Karubanda Twimukye group of Kihihi. He is 45 years old and married. He and his wife have six children and four of them are still in school. 

Lauben has a carpentry workshop in Karubanda that has been in existence for over 20 years. He also does joinery in his workshop and he makes doors, windows, chairs and so on. As a result, he has a good customer base. He acquired the skill after working for someone else as well as being a farmer. 

He is hard working and very cooperative and his dream is to be able to expand his business as well as educate all his remaining children. 

He says that as a result of taking loans, his business has somehow grown and he needs a loan to be able to purchase timber for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his business.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en:
Chaka is a married man who has 2 school-going children.  His family lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past 2 years, Chaka has been operating a food café business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Chaka faces a major challenge in the seasonality of his business. He dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Chaka wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, vegetables, tomatoes and rice for his café business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, beans, vegetables, tomatoes and rice for his café

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family.  She has been running her store for 24 years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Analyn is requesting a loan for PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items such as biscuits, groceries and other basic commodities to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has successfully repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF.  Analyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 36 years of age and married with five school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Joel's wife is a housekeeper. Joel is asking for a loan to purchase inputs needed in their field such as fertilizers like manure and hybrid seeds of rice. 

He will also use the loan to pay for the land preparation for his farm. In the future, Joel hopes that his business will earn a high enough income from the yields to continue sending his children in school and finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and hybrid seeds of rice.

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en: Gretchen is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. Gretchen has a retail shop that sells canned goods, candies and breads. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and beverages. Gretchen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Buntuuse Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Farming has been 60-year-old Lawrence's means of livelihood for close to 3 years in Lugazi. While Lugazi is not anywhere near the food basket districts of Uganda, many of the indigenous people there have recently embraced commercial farming though most of it is on a small scale. Many natives principally grow sugar cane. The two sugar cane factories in the district provide a market for most of these sugar cane farmers. Recently however many natives have taken to growing other cash crops such as bananas, cassava, maize, coffee and cabbage.

Lawrence, who is an affable father of 7 buoyant and high spirited children, says that notwithstanding the high cost of doing business in the country, he remains upbeat about the growth of his business. From the beginning, he found it formidable to obtain a footing in a business which was already highly competitive. Unwavering diligence, determination, perseverance and will power have been Lawrence's magic formula for his fledgling success. 

Prior to taking root in this enterprise, Lawrence was working in a small retail trade. The fact that foods such as bananas, maize and coffee sell highly in the food markets in this part of the country has profoundly emboldened Lawrence. Out of this business on a weekly basis, Lawrence is able to make sales profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings. He reckons he will be able to make more than he currently makes if he can apply high grade manure in his farm to ensure good harvests. On the side, he also ekes out additional income from a milk sales business. Lawrence says he is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase high grade manure for his farm. Lawrence’s group is taking its fourth loan from Pearl Microfinance now and their track record in repaying their loans has been commendable.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his farm

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa  est une femme âgée de 66 ans. Elle est veuve et a trois enfants.
Akossiwa travaille  comme  revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis 2006.Elle vend à domicile  dans sa maison sise à Ablogamé.Elle s’approvisionne à Notsé.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 66 years old. She is widowed and the mother of three children. She has been earning her living since 2006 by selling charcoal. She sells out of her house in Ablogamé. She gets her supplies in Notsé. Akossiwa came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina, de 27 años vive en compañía de su esposo Oswaldo. Ambos tienen 2 pequeñas hijas a las que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Desde niña comenzó a trabajar la tierra, ayudando a sus padres en las diferentes actividades agrícolas. Cuando conformó su familia, su esposo comenzó en esta actividad económica. Pero ella confiesa, que no le gusta mucho esa labor; por lo que comenzó con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa. Su trabajo consiste en traer ropa variada de damas, caballeros y niños desde la ciudad a su pueblo natal, donde tiene buenos clientes. Su principal ventaja, es que ella deja a crédito sus prendas, que son pagadas posteriormente. Según comenta tiene clientes de confianza, por lo que obtiene regulares ganancias, que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar; además de sentirse una mujer independiente y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por ello para más adelante desea ahorrar lo suficiente, para poner una tienda surtida y equipada. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Yanina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para abastecer el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yanina, aged 27, lives with her husband, Oswaldo.  They have two little girls together whom they care for with much love and affection in their own home, located in the town of Ricrican. 

She began working the land in childhood, helping her parents in different agricultural activities.  Once she had her family, her husband began in this business.  However, she admits that she does not really like this work, so she started a business buying and selling clothes.  Her job involves bringing a variety of women's, men's and children's clothing from the city to her hometown, where she has good clients.  Her main advantage is that she provides her clothes on credit, and gets paid later. According she has trusted clients from whom she gets regular income, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenditures.  In addition, she considers herself to be an independent woman and one who is eager to get ahead in life.  Because of this, she wants to save enough money to later have a stocked and equipped store. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Mirando a un Futuro Mejor", ("Looking for a Better Future"), and this is her second loan through MFP.  She hopes for the support of all of you to pursue her goals. She also promises to be punctual in her repayments. 

Once Yanina receives your support, she will invest the requested money to buy merchandise to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Duhuze Group

texts.fr:
Samuel  est un  commerçant âgé de 34ans qui habite   en Province de Ngozi au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de chèvres depuis 3 ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Il  est marié a Séraphine et ont ensemble 4enfants dont 1 étudie en 1ere année primaire.

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUHUZE».
texts.en:
Samuel is a 34 year old retailer who lives in Ngozi Province in North Burundi. he has been trading goats for 3 years. He is also a farmer. He attended primary school until 5th grade. He is married to Séraphine with whom he has 4 children, one of whom is in 1st grade at primary school.

He is requesting Kiva credit to increase his capital so that he can buy lots of goats to resell and maximise his profits.
He is member of the community group "DUHUZE

loans.use: purchase goats which he can resell to make a profit.

loans.name: Maria Minerva

texts.es:
La señora   María Minerva, es casada con el señor   Francisco y con quien procreo un hijo de la edad de  un año tres meses.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abarrotes ya que va a poner una tienda de abarrotes para apoyarse con los ingresos de la casa, como  también a su esposo quien trabaja en el campo.

    Esta inspiración comenzó por si sola para poder solventar sus gastos generados, así tener de done  trabajar y obtener mejor calidad de vida.

    Su  más grande deseo es que con el préstamo pueda obtener sus mercancías para  comenzar  instalar  su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Minerva is married to Francisco and they have one son who is three months old. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries because she is going to set up a grocery story to help earn household income and help her husband who works in the fields.

She, herself, was inspired to do this because she wants to be able to help pay their expenses and have a place to work, thereby obtaining a better quality of life. Her greatest wish is to use the loan to buy merchandise so she can begin setting up her store.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La Señora Ruth es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por una comunidad alrededor de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia está rodeada de montañas las mismas que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Ruth tiene 38 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 7 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su segunda hija estudia en la escuela y su ultimo hijo está en el jardín de infantes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Ruth se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y borregos, a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura pero solo para su consumo.
 
En el banco comunal esta reingresando ya que hace 3 años fue socia, el dinero de su crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of 'El Cisne' community bank.  She lives in a community in El Valle parish.  This parish is surrounded by mountains which provide us with beautiful landscapes.  The people are very kind and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.  They work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Ruth is 38 years old, widowed, and has three children from her marriage who are 19, 17 and 4.  Her eldest [son] attends high school in the city, her second child [a daughter] is in elementary school and her youngest [son] is in kindergarten.  She doesn't own her own home but instead lives in her parents' home and shares the household expenses.

Ruth raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, hens and lambs, and sells them when she has a financial need to do so.  She also farms but only for her own consumption.

Ruth is re-joining her community bank as she was a member three years ago.  She will invest her loan money in buying guinea pigs and feed for her animals.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Martina De Los A

texts.es: Doña Martina De Los Ángeles quien desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta productos comestibles de consumo diario, atiende su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y gracias a Dios cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, que le ayuda a atender el negocio tiene varias ideas en su mente con la que quiere comprar materia prima con el crédito como granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, golosinas, pan, sopas, papel higiénico, fósforos y otros productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Martina De Los Ángeles, who has been selling everyday snacks for various years, works from 7 in the morning to 9 at night.  She is a hardworking woman and thanks God that she can count on her son's help to work around the store. She has many ideas on how to use her loan such as buying general merchandise like basic grains, detergents, sodas, sweets, bread, soups, toilet paper, matches, and other products.

loans.use: buy general materials such as basic grains, detergents, sodas, sweets, bread, soups, toilet paper, matches, and other products.

loans.name: Esther  Mueni

texts.en:
Esther is still married to Gabriel. She still practices dairy farming and the business is doing well.

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the entire amount to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Sozui's Group

texts.en:
Sozui is the leader of this group. She is 55 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter. Two older sons are married and live separately with their families. The daughter works in a sewing workshop in Bishkek, and the youngest son lives with Sozui. He helps her with livestock breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening, the family earns about 2,000 soms per month. Sozui wants to increase the number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase four farm animals for breeding. In the future she wishes to see her youngest son get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive por el sector del Salado en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, su mezcla entre lo colonia y lo moderno le dan una belleza singular, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Narcisa tiene 44 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijas de 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas e independientes  y su hija soltera estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Narcisa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, negocio en el cual lleva 18 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, huevos, leche, etc. para la fabricación de sus helados.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Narcisa is a member of the Hermano Miguel communal bank.  She lives in the Salado part of Cuenca city.  This city has been a World Heritage site since December 1999; its blend of colonial and modern gives it a singular beauty, and its people keep up the culture and traditions of their forebears. The variety of its cuisine cultivates the palate of people from both near and far.

Doña Narcisa is 44 years old.  She is married and has three daughters aged 23, 21, and 19 from her marriage.  Her two eldest daughters are married and financially independent, and her single daughter is attending high-school in the city.  She doesn't own her own home, but lives in a rental.

Señora Narcisa works making and selling ice-cream, which is a business she has been in for 18 years.  She works every day of the week, without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for the last four years, and she will invest her new loan in purchasing fruit, eggs, milk, etc for making her ice-cream.

Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit, eggs, milk, etc. for making ice-cream.

loans.name: Ziyadin

texts.ru: Зиядину 45 лет, женат, счастливый отец пятерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1995 году Зиядин начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Зиядина, начатое с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) раз в три  месяца от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Зиядин обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и бычков. Доходы от кредита Зиядин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ziyadin is 45 years old, married and a proud father of five children. In search of income for his family in 1995 Ziyadin began his business in fattening cattle and reselling it. Because of the tenacity and perseverance Ziyadin's business which started with the sum of 10,000 soms (KGS) today brings about 20,000 som (KGS) every three months from the sale of meat and dairy products. In order to further increase the number of livestock Ziyadin has come to the company Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to purchase a cow and bulls. Ziyadin plans to invest the profit from the loan to further increase in the number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Abèle

texts.fr: Abèle vit avec son mari et a deux  enfants. Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente des tenues tout-cousus, des divers, pacotilles, et produits de beauté dans son quartier. Elle s'approvisionnait à dans un marché hors du bénin et a constaté au fils des temps que les mêmes articles sont vendus dans les marchés de cotonou et au même coût. Elle a dû commencer par faire ses achats sur Cotonou et s'y rend au moins une fois par semaine. Soucieuse de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle souhaite le renouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts, renforcer son fonds de commerce et à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Abèle lives with her husband and has two children. She is a vendor  selling ready-to-wear clothing, miscellaneous items, fashion jewelry and cosmetic products in her distric.t She used to stock up at a market outside of Benin. As time passed, she started seeing the same items being sold at the markets of Cotonou at the same cost. She  had to start making her purchases in Cotonou, traveling there at least once a week. With the goal of meeting customer demand, she would like to take out a new microloan from Finadev in order to maximize her profits, bolster her working capital and provide for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy various body creams, gels and beauty  products for women

loans.name: Batai Munashe Group

texts.en:
Regina is 37 years old from Masvingo, Zimbabwe. She is married and has four children aged 17, 12, 9 and 8 years and all the children go to school. 

She is in the business of selling clothes from her clothing stall in Chiredzi town. She has been in the business for one year and has one employee who works for her. She buys her products from South Africa. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy more stock of clothes for resale. She says the major challenge faced is non-payment on time by her debtors. With the income from this loan, Regina will be able to upgrade the standard of living of her family. She is planning to own her own clothing shop in the central business district of Masvingo.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  He does farming so as to earn a living.  He grows crops, rears chickens and does bee-keeping.  He has been farming for eight years and has employed two people. He has grown his business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Jacob hopes to expand his farm in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Songambele Kikuli Group

texts.en:
Atanas is 23 years old and the father of one child. He is hard-working, producing coffee, maize, cassava and beans for more than 11 years. He is facing farming problems due to lack of fertilizer and to crop disease.

Atanas is looking for funding to pay for fertilizer and insecticides. Also, he intends to increase his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in expectation of earning more income that can be used to purchase clothes, fix his house and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is a 53- year-old man from Catigbian, Bohol. He is married and has four dependents. The oldest is 20 years old while the youngest is 10 years old. He does charcoal selling to supports them. He has been doing this for almost 6 years. Aside from selling charcoal, he also owns a farm which he cultivates to get an income. With this, he is asking a loan to buy coconut shell and processed this to make charcoal. Other part of his requested amount is to buy a cow. Perhaps, he also raised cow to sell. In the future, Ernesto wants to improve their livelihood to give his family a better and a comfortable means of living.

loans.use: to buy coconut shell and cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flora would like to buy hair chemicals, Pedicure sets,weaves,extensions and 2 hir dryers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is a young unmarried man whose parents died and left him at a tender age. He started coming to Life in Africa by serving the community food. Through that business, he became interested in the activities at Life in Africa. Due to his good services, he was invited to join and become a full Life in Africa member.

He started by counting materials and then later making bracelets for the Invisible Children campaign. His lifestyle has improved because he earns a lot more than what he made from the previous business.

Since he has sisters who are still jobless at home, he wants to start a pay phone business to help them. He thus wishes to get a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings, which he will pay back in 5 months. (1USD = 1,722 UGX). From the business, he will earn about 130,000 UGX.

His budget is as follows:

Telephone set 150,000 UGX

Sister to operate 20,000 UGX

Renting space 20,000 UGX

Airtime 50,000 UGX

contingencies 10,000 UGX

Total 250,000 UGX

loans.use: Buying a phone set and airtime

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Chen P. is a mother of 4 children and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is pregnant and is going to give birth to her fifth child, makes her living by growing and cultivating crops in a field with her husband. They can typically make around $11/day in revenue from their outputs.

This couple is asking for $1000 loan to purchase two healthy oxen in order to help them work in the field and to use another part of the money for extra seeds. In the future, she and her husband hope to increase their crops in order to make more additional income.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to work in the field

loans.name: Aynar

texts.en: Aynar S. owns and operates a small jewelry store in the town of Devechi, located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Aynar has been working in this business for 6 years and is looking for funding so that he can make some improvements to his small shop.

loans.use: To make improvements to his store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with four children and runs a micro-business out of her home. She sells vegetables, peppers, sesame and palm oil, flour and rice in the village of Yogomaia in the Koinadugu district of Sierra Leone. Her husband’s income is insufficient for the family expenses.

Rebecca plans to expand the business and increase her income and also hopes to build a small shelter where she can run her expanding business. For these reasons, Rebecca is requesting a second loan from SMT of US$ 200.

loans.use: Increase her business inventory to generate more income

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia S. is a 50 year old mother of three children.  One of her daughters is a lawyer. Telesia is looking after her grandson and uses most of her time at home to grow and plant flowers beside her house.
